poc.description: Benjamin Altman is the CEO and Chief Investment Officer of Altman Advisors, a multi-family office he co-founded with his father in 2016. He has a distinguished career in financial planning and asset management, having previously worked at UBS starting in 2004. Mr. Altman earned his Certified Financial Planner designation in 2009 after coursework at Northwestern University and graduated cum laude from Tufts University in 2002. At Altman Advisors, he leads the firm in providing comprehensive financial solutions, including investment management, estate and tax optimization, and legacy development for their clients.
fund.title: Altman Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Altman Advisors is a boutique, multi-family office headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, serving high-net-worth individuals and families. The firm was officially launched as an independent, fiduciary firm in 2016 by Ben and Shelly Altman. Altman Advisors provides comprehensive wealth management, including asset management, financial planning, and family office services, with a focus on multi-generational wealth preservation and growth. The firm surpassed $450 million in assets under management in 2025.
fund.thesis: Altman Advisors employs a fundamental, research-driven investment approach that is tailored to each client's goals and risk tolerance. Their strategy encompasses public equities, credit, and alternative investments, including private equity and structured notes, with a strong emphasis on risk management and holistic financial planning. The firm's stated minimum assets for new client relationships is $5,000,000.

poc.description: Laurent Hopman is the founder of 21North Advisors, an independent multi-family office based in Bahrain that provides bespoke portfolio management services for ultra-high-net-worth families. With over 27 years of experience in the financial sector, his career began as an M&A analyst at Calyon in Milan. He subsequently held roles at Morgan Stanley in equity derivatives trading, and as a fixed income derivatives trader at UBS and Poseidon, a hedge fund, before joining a single-family office in London and later Investcorp, where he was part of the investment committee. Mr. Hopman holds a bachelor's degree in engineering from Ecole Centrale Paris and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
fund.title: 21 North Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; infrastructure; biotech
fund.description: 21 North Advisors is a multi-family office based in Manama, Bahrain, established in 2008. The firm specializes in creating and managing conservative, tailor-made investment portfolios for a select group of high-net-worth families. Its primary mission is to protect and grow client assets through a client-centric approach that emphasizes long-term relationships and confidentiality.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy centers on capital preservation and long-term growth, achieved by building well-diversified, conservative portfolios tailored to each client's specific objectives. They maintain a strong alignment of interests by not distributing or white-labeling products and refusing commissions to avoid conflicts of interest. The firm focuses on managing risk while seeking above-average risk-adjusted performance, leveraging expertise in alternative investments to find optimal opportunities.

poc.description: Sheldon Altman is the Chairman of Altman Advisors, a multi-family office he co-founded in 2016. His extensive career in finance began after earning his MBA from the University of Chicago. Prior to establishing Altman Advisors, he was a top fee-based portfolio manager at Oppenheimer & Co. and later joined UBS in 2002, where he was consistently ranked among the top 1% of advisory teams in the nation. Before his finance career, Mr. Altman served as a naval engineer after graduating from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
fund.title: Altman Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Altman Advisors is a boutique, multi-family office and registered investment adviser based in Chicago, Illinois. Officially established in 2016, the firm's roots trace back to 1977, and it focuses on providing comprehensive wealth management and family office services to high-net-worth individuals and families. The firm's mission is to protect and grow the wealth of its clients, emphasizing multi-generational planning and offering services through its dedicated family office and in-house asset management groups. By the end of its first year, the firm surpassed $250 million in assets under management and exceeded $450 million by 2025.
fund.thesis: Altman Advisors employs a fundamental, research-driven investment approach that is tailored to individual client goals, risk tolerance, and time horizons. Their strategy is centered on long-term wealth preservation and growth, utilizing eight distinct investment strategies across various asset classes including public equities, credit, and alternatives like private equity. The firm serves high-net-worth families and focuses on multi-generational financial planning, aiming to deliver institutional-quality investment management.

poc.description: Ilan Stern is the Chief Investment Officer of 166 2nd Asset Management, a single family office. Before his current role, he was a general partner and managing director at the venture capital firm General Catalyst. Prior to that, Mr. Stern served as a portfolio manager at Soros Fund Management. He began his career at Bear Stearns focusing on Non-Agency Mortgage-Backed Securities and later became a vice president of ABS Trading at Merrill Lynch & Co.
fund.title: 166 2nd
fund.description: 166 2nd Financial Services is the single-family office for WeWork co-founder Adam Neumann and his wife, Rebekah Neumann. Founded in 2019 and based in New York City, the firm manages the family's personal wealth. The name originates from a former apartment address of the couple, symbolizing their more humble beginnings. The firm was established after Neumann reportedly cashed out approximately $700 million from WeWork.
fund.thesis: 166 2nd Financial Services focuses on preserving and growing multi-generational wealth through a diversified investment approach that includes direct investments and fund commitments. The firm's primary sectors of interest are real estate, fintech, proptech, crypto, and healthtech, with a focus on early-stage and seed-round startups.

poc.description: Harry O'Mealia is the Chief Executive Officer and President of 1919 Investment Counsel, a role he has held since 2004, where he oversees the firm's strategy and growth. His career in the financial services industry began in 1985, and he has held senior positions at JP Morgan, US Trust Company, and Tiedemann Trust Company. He has also served as President of O'Mealia Outdoor Advertising Company and Black River Media, and as an Associate in the corporate department of Lowenstein Sandler LLP. Mr. O'Mealia earned his B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania, his J.D. from Boston College Law School, and his M.B.A. in Finance from Columbia University.
fund.title: 1919 Investment Counsel
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; fixed-income; commodities; real-estate; hedge-funds; esg; sustainable-finance; financial-services
fund.description: 1919 Investment Counsel is a wealth management firm that provides customized investment strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions, foundations, and endowments. With roots dating back to 1919 through its predecessor firm, Scudder, Stevens & Clark, it is one of the oldest investment counsel firms in the United States. Now a wholly-owned subsidiary of Stifel Financial Corp., the firm is headquartered in Baltimore and has been recognized by publications like Barron's, Forbes, and InvestmentNews as a top RIA firm.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on proprietary, fundamental research with a strong emphasis on high-quality companies, risk management, and diversification. They employ a tailored approach, building customized portfolios using separately managed accounts to meet the specific risk tolerance, return objectives, and values of each client, including a focus on Socially Responsible Investing (SRI) and ESG factors. Their equity selection process seeks companies with strong balance sheets, sustainable profitability, and competitive advantages, aiming to achieve long-term capital growth while minimizing risk.

poc.description: Mark A. Ell is an owner of Alpha Capital Management Group, LLC, which he co-founded in 2015. He specializes in retirement services, including 401k, 403b, and 457 plans, and holds the Certified Plan Fiduciary Advisor (CPFA) and Accredited Investment Fiduciary (AIF) designations. Prior to his current role, Mark was a business owner for 25 years in Colorado, Arizona, and North Dakota, gaining extensive experience in business operations, budgeting, and planning. He is a graduate of Arizona State University with a degree in Business Management.
fund.title: Alpha Capital Management Group, LLC
fund.sectors: financial-services; public-markets; insurance
fund.description: Alpha Capital Management Group, LLC is a Denver, Colorado-based investment advisory firm registered with the SEC since May 2016. The firm provides discretionary and non-discretionary investment management, financial planning, and retirement plan advisory services. They cater to a clientele of individuals, high-net-worth individuals, estates, trusts, and small to medium-sized businesses.
fund.thesis: Alpha Capital Management Group's investment strategy focuses on creating diversified portfolios tailored to individual client objectives. They primarily allocate client assets across a mix of mutual funds, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), cash, and individual debt and equity securities. As fiduciaries, their approach is centered on providing customized, independent advice to meet the unique financial needs and goals of each client.

poc.description: Christian Carlson serves as the Chief Operating Officer and Managing Director at Continental Grain Company. In his leadership role, he is involved in the strategic and operational management of the firm. Prior to his current position, he held other roles within the company, demonstrating a history of growth within the organization. His career has been focused on the food and agriculture sectors.
fund.title: Continental Grain Company

fund.description: Continental Grain Company is a privately-owned global investor, owner, and operator with a history of over 200 years in the food and agribusiness sectors. Founded in Belgium in 1813, the firm has evolved from a grain trading business to a diversified company with operations in areas like livestock, food processing, and financial services. The company established its first U.S. office in 1921 and is now headquartered in New York.
fund.thesis: Continental Grain Company employs a long-term investment approach, partnering with companies across the food and agribusiness value chain, from early-stage ventures to established market leaders. They leverage their deep industry expertise and global network to support the growth and expansion of their portfolio companies, with a focus on creating a sustainable and efficient food supply chain. The firm invests across various asset classes and has a significant presence in North America, Latin America, Asia, and Europe.

fund.description: 1919 Investment Counsel is a wealth management firm that provides customized investment strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions, and foundations. Founded in 1919 through its predecessor firm, Scudder, Stevens & Clark, it is one of the oldest investment advisory firms in the United States and now operates as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Stifel Financial Corp. The firm has been recognized in various industry rankings, including Barron's Top 100 RIA Firms, FA Magazine's RIA Survey & Ranking, and Forbes' Top RIA Firms.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy is centered on proprietary, fundamental research with a focus on high-quality companies, risk management, and diversification. They construct highly customized portfolios tailored to the specific needs, values, and financial goals of their clients, offering strategies that include equity, fixed-income, and socially responsible investing (SRI) with consideration for environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. Their approach combines bottom-up stock selection with a top-down view for portfolio construction, aiming for long-term capital appreciation.

poc.description: Pierluigi Ciccone is the Founder, Group Chief Executive Officer, and President of the Board at Agenda Invest. He has extensive experience in the financial industry, including wealth management for UHNW entrepreneurial families at UBS, where he focused on money motion events and corporate deals. Prior to his banking career, which began in 2001, he held senior positions at global steel trading firms Duferco SA and Sidermetal Ltd. Mr. Ciccone is a Certified Investment Analyst and is fluent in English, Russian, French, and Italian.
fund.title: Agenda Invest
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; fintech; ai-ml; financial-services
fund.description: Agenda Invest is a multi-family office based in Lugano, Switzerland, that was founded in 2010. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management services to a select group of entrepreneurs and their families. Its services cover asset protection, inter-generational planning, tax analysis, and family governance.
fund.thesis: Agenda Invest's primary purpose is to oversee and manage the financial affairs of wealthy entrepreneurs and their families, with a focus on sustainable capital growth and wealth preservation. The firm states it has a global investment perspective across all strategies and co-manages a platform for private equity funds and direct company investments. They aim to act as a strategic partner to entrepreneurs, providing solutions across various investment areas and proactively developing new business ideas.

poc.description: Lauren Schmaltz is a Vice President and Responsible Investing Analyst at 1919 Investment Counsel. In this role, she is responsible for covering companies in the Information Technology and Communication Services sectors, where she analyzes relevant social, environmental, and responsible finance topics. She has been with the firm since 1999 and is a member of the Internal Responsible Investing Committee. Lauren holds both a B.A. in Finance and Marketing and an M.B.A. from Xavier University.
fund.title: 1919 Investment Counsel
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; fixed-income; public-markets; financial-services; real-estate; esg
fund.description: 1919 Investment Counsel is an investment advisory firm that provides customized equity and fixed-income strategies for institutions, family offices, and high-net-worth individuals. Founded in 1919 as Scudder, Stevens & Clark, it is one of the oldest investment counsel firms in the United States and operates as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Stifel Financial Corp. The firm has received recognition from various industry publications, including being named one of Barron's Top 100 RIA Firms.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on proprietary, fundamental research with a strong emphasis on high-quality companies, risk management, and diversification. They create customized portfolios tailored to the specific risk tolerance, return objectives, and financial goals of each client, with capabilities in socially responsible and ESG investing.

poc.description: Emil Ahlanzberg is an Investment Associate at Alfvén & Didrikson, a role he has held since August 2022. Prior to his current position, he gained experience as an Investment Banking Analyst at J.P. Morgan from July 2021 to August 2022, and as a Finance Intern at Scania Group in 2020. He holds a Bachelor's degree in Business and Economics from the Stockholm School of Economics.
fund.title: Alfvén & Didrikson
fund.sectors: venture-capital; growth-capital; technology; software; saas; fintech; healthtech; consumer; ecommerce; media; transportation; manufacturing; financial-services; insurance
fund.description: Alfvén & Didrikson is a Stockholm-based venture capital firm founded in 2010. They are a long-term, active backer of entrepreneurs and teams, focusing on technology-driven companies with global potential. The firm prides itself on a founder-friendly approach and providing both capital and hands-on support to its portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: Alfvén & Didrikson invests in growth-stage technology companies primarily in Northern Europe. They focus on businesses with proven models and international growth ambitions, typically participating in Series A and Series B rounds. Key investment sectors include software, SaaS, digital platforms, and technology-enabled services.

poc.description: Eduardo Burillo is the Founder of Accretion Capital, where he directs the firm's global investment strategy across real estate, venture, and credit. Earlier in his career, he co-founded and scaled Mexico's first multi-service telecommunications operator, which became the nation's third-largest provider before its sale in 2007. Following a significant cybersecurity event, he founded Known Distance, a venture focused on secure, AI-driven trust architecture. Mr. Burillo has served on the Board of Trustees at the Institute of Contemporary Art, Miami, and holds advisory board positions at Baptist International and the International Conscience Council.
fund.title: Accretion Capital
fund.sectors: venture-capital; real-estate; technology; saas; media; entertainment; ai-ml; consumer; fintech; crypto-blockchain; telecommunications
fund.description: Accretion Capital, founded in 2013, is a multi-strategy investment firm and collective family office. The firm operates as a hands-on ecosystem, focusing on venture capital and real estate investments designed to create resilient, long-term growth. Led by founder Eduardo Burillo, whose family founded Televisa/Univision, the firm emphasizes direct control, disciplined systems, and strategic resilience in its operations.
fund.thesis: Accretion Capital's investment thesis centers on backing ventures where technology, human insight, and strategic execution align to create durable value. In venture capital, they focus on founders with strong character, discipline, and vision, while their real estate platform strategically acquires and capitalizes on legacy assets like residential, hospitality, and commercial properties. The firm acts as a patient, long-term partner, looking for founders who value structure and resilience.

Prior to her current position, she served as the CFO at the private equity firm Procuritas and most recently was a Senior Manager at APEX Sweden.

poc.description: Clark M. Blackman II is the Founder, Managing Member and CEO of Alpha Wealth Strategies, a fee-only wealth management RIA firm. With over four decades of experience in the financial services industry, his career includes roles as a National and Regional Director with Deloitte & Touche, LLP, and positions at PricewaterhouseCoopers and Arthur Andersen. He obtained a BBA in finance and a graduate degree in accounting from the University of Iowa. Mr. Blackman is a CFA charterholder, a Certified Public Accountant (CPA), and holds several other professional designations.
fund.title: Alpha Wealth Strategies
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Alpha Wealth Strategies is a boutique, fee-only SEC registered investment advisory firm founded in 2005 by Clark M. Blackman II. The firm provides investment consulting and financial guidance to a select number of high-net-worth families and successful entrepreneurs. The founder has received notable recognition, including being named one of the "100 Most Influential" people in 2011 by Accounting Today and receiving the AICPA's "Distinguished Service Award" in 2015.
fund.thesis: The firm follows a long-term investment approach rooted in modern portfolio theory, focusing on strategic asset allocation and manager selection. They do not engage in market timing or tactical allocation and primarily recommend open-end mutual funds and separate account managers. The firm explicitly avoids alternative investments such as hedge funds or private equity.

fund.title: Libra Group
fund.sectors: aerospace; energy; cleantech; hospitality; real-estate; transportation; financial-services; media; entertainment; healthcare
fund.description: The Libra Group is a privately owned, global business group founded in 2003 by the Logothetis family. It originated from Lomar Shipping, a maritime company established in 1976, and has since diversified into a multinational entity with 20 operating businesses across nearly 60 countries. The group is predominantly active in six sectors: aerospace, renewable energy, maritime, real estate, hospitality, and diversified investments.
fund.thesis: Libra Group's investment strategy focuses on long-term value creation and diversification across various sectors and geographies. As a family-owned entity, they can take a long-term investment perspective, often counter to prevailing market trends, and are not driven by short-term cycles. They invest in industries that are fundamental to economies and connect communities, leveraging their global network to gain cross-sector insights and drive growth.

poc.description: Alexander Pick is a Managing Partner and founding partner of Agon GmbH, a family and investment office. With 25 years of professional experience, he specializes in family office services, asset and wealth management, and capital markets. His previous roles include founding partner at Cubus Investment Office GmbH, a member of the management board at Sal. Oppenheim & Cie./ Deutsche Bank, Head of Family Office at Allianz Global Investors Europe, Managing Director at Société Générale S.A., and Executive Director at Goldman Sachs & Co. oHG.
fund.title: Agon GmbH
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate
fund.description: Agon GmbH is an independent, modern multi-family and investment office based in Wiesbaden, Germany. Founded in 2020, the firm acts as a central point of contact for its clients in all strategic, tactical, and operational matters concerning the management of their assets. The firm leverages the extensive experience of its founders in family office services, asset management, and real estate to provide tailored solutions.
fund.thesis: Agon GmbH operates with a philosophy of being independent, cooperative, and exclusively committed to the interests of its clients. As an owner-managed company, it focuses on providing solution-neutral analysis and support for securing and preserving wealth for future generations. Their investment focus lies in direct investments (private equity), real estate, and other liquid investments, utilizing a strong network of external partners and experts.

poc.description: Jennifer Dempsey is a founder and Managing Director of AFO Capital, Ltd., a private office located in Fort Worth, Texas, where she is responsible for investment and wealth management for a local family. An SEC filing from June 2022 also lists her as the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer of AFO Capital, Ltd., a role she has held since helping to establish the firm in 2006. Prior to her work at AFO Capital, she was a vice president at Crow Holdings, a real estate private equity company and the family office for the Trammell Crow family. She also holds the position of Independent Director at Bounty Minerals, Inc.
fund.title: AFO Capital, Ltd.
fund.description: AFO Capital, Ltd. is a private single-family office based in Fort Worth, Texas, established in 2007. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services including investment and portfolio management, accounting, financial reporting, tax planning, and trust and estate coordination for the financial affairs of a single family. The company is led by its founder and managing director, Jennifer Dempsey.
fund.thesis: As a private single-family office, AFO Capital's investment strategy is not publicly disclosed. The firm's mandate is to manage the wealth and investments of a single family, which can encompass a wide and varied range of assets and strategies tailored to the family's specific goals and risk tolerance.

poc.role: Managing Director, Chief Investment Officer, Portfolio Manager
poc.description: Charles C. King, also known as Charlie, is a Managing Director, the Chief Investment Officer, and Head of the Philadelphia Office at 1919 Investment Counsel. As CIO, he is responsible for developing and overseeing the firm's investment strategy and process, and he also heads the Asset Allocation Strategy Group. He entered the financial services industry in 1984 and joined 1919 Investment Counsel in 1998, having previously been a Senior Portfolio Manager with CoreStates Family Wealth Group. He holds a B.A. in Biology and Philosophy from Wittenberg University, an M.B.A. from Villanova University, and is a CFA Charterholder.
fund.title: 1919 Investment Counsel
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; fixed-income; commodities; real-estate; esg; sustainable-finance; public-markets; hedge-funds
fund.description: 1919 Investment Counsel is a wealth management firm that provides customized investment strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions, and foundations. Founded in 1919 as the successor to Scudder, Stevens & Clark, the firm is one of the oldest investment advisory firms in the United States and pioneered the investment counsel industry. Now a wholly-owned subsidiary of Stifel Financial Corp., the firm is headquartered in Baltimore and has received recognition such as being named one of Barron's Top 100 RIA Firms.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on proprietary, fundamental research with a strong emphasis on high-quality companies, risk management, and diversification. They employ a hybrid bottom-up and top-down approach to construct customized portfolios of equities and fixed-income securities tailored to each client's specific risk tolerance, objectives, and values, with a notable expertise in Socially Responsible Investing (SRI) and ESG factors.

poc.description: Kristinn Kristinsson is a Founding Partner at 3T FAMILY OFFICE. He has over twenty-five years of experience in investment advisory, wealth management, and tax planning. His career includes positions at notable institutions such as PricewaterhouseCoopers, Credit Suisse, and Bank Julius Baer. Mr. Kristinsson holds an MBA from Columbia University and a Master in Economics from the University of Basle, Switzerland.
fund.title: 3T FAMILY OFFICE
fund.description: 3T Family Office is an independently owned Swiss investment management partnership founded in 2011. The firm is a member of the Swiss Financial Services Standards Association (SO-FIT) and is recognized by the Federal Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA). 3T Family Office caters to a global client base, providing wealth management and investment advisory services with a focus on preserving wealth and delivering attractive risk-adjusted returns.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy is centered on long-term capital growth and revenue generation, with capital protection being a primary consideration. They employ a personalized approach, understanding each client's needs, risk tolerance, and investment horizon to create a tailored investment profile. 3T Family Office operates with an open architecture to provide clients with a selection of the best investments, acting as an intermediary representing the client's interests with custodian banks.

poc.description: Aksel Azrac is a Co-founder and Senior Partner at 1875 Finance SA, where he also serves as Partner & Head of the Multi-Family Office. His career began in consulting for major automobile brands. In 1997, he joined Banque Paribas (Suisse) SA in Geneva, co-managing the Parvest fund for Switzerland, and later joined Banque Ferrier Lullin & Cie in 2001, where he was appointed to the Executive Board in 2002. He co-founded 1875 Finance in 2006. Mr. Azrac studied engineering at the Ecole Polytechnique de Lausanne (EPFL) and business administration at HEC Lausanne.
fund.title: 1875 Finance SA
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: 1875 Finance SA is a Swiss multi-family office and independent wealth management firm founded in 2006. It provides a range of services including private wealth and asset management, portfolio management, and wealth planning to private clients, multi-family offices, and institutional clients. A significant milestone for the firm was the acquisition of a 40% stake by REYL & Cie in 2022, a move approved by the Swiss and Luxembourg financial regulators.
fund.thesis: 1875 Finance's investment philosophy is centered around an open-architecture model, aiming to provide stable, risk-adjusted returns free from conflicts of interest. They emphasize a disciplined, risk-budgeted approach to asset allocation and portfolio construction, focusing on transparency, liquidity, and quality in their investment vehicle selection. The firm primarily serves clients across Europe, with a focus on building and preserving capital for future generations.

fund.description: Alder Investment Management is the private single-family office for the Vestey family, established in 1987. Headquartered in London, the firm oversees the family's wealth, which historically stems from a significant global meat-packing and food distribution business. The office focuses on preserving and growing this capital for future generations by investing across a diverse range of public and private markets.

Alder Investment Management pursues this by investing across multiple asset classes, aligning strategies with the family's financial objectives and values. The firm's activities are designed to manage and preserve private wealth for its founding family.

poc.role: Co-founder & General Manager, AQAL Capital GmbH
poc.description: Thomas Schulz is a Co-founder and General Manager at AQAL Capital GmbH, where he focuses on entrepreneurship, innovation, and integral investing in CleanTech and Internet/Software. With over 40 years of experience as a serial entrepreneur and more than 20 years as an investor, his career includes co-founding Entelios AG, Germany's first nationwide Demand Response Aggregator, and Cybernet AG, the first publicly traded ISP in Germany. Previously, he worked as a strategy consultant for The Boston Consulting Group. Mr. Schulz holds an MBA from Stanford University and a Master of Science in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT).
fund.title: AQAL Capital
fund.sectors: technology; ai-ml; software; cleantech; energy; healthtech; media; entertainment; transportation; agriculture; impact-investing
fund.description: AQAL Capital is a Munich-based angel group and family investment office founded in 2014 by serial entrepreneurs Tom Schulz and Dr. Mariana Bozesan. The firm operates as an exponential-tech holding company making direct and indirect investments across various stages, from early to growth. Dr. Bozesan has received notable recognition, including being named Europe's Female Angel Investor of 2019 and Best European Early Stage Investor of the Year 2017.
fund.thesis: AQAL Capital's investment thesis is rooted in 'Integral Investing', focusing on exponential technology companies with the potential for significant growth and impact, while implementing the UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). They primarily target seed and early-stage companies in the European Union (with an emphasis on the DACH region) and the San Francisco Bay Area, seeking strong leadership teams and proven technology with a short path to break-even. Their investment philosophy is guided by the '6Ps': Parity of People, Planet, and Profit — with Passion and Purpose.

poc.description: John B. Beinecke is a managing director at Antaeus Enterprises, Inc., a private investment firm based in New York. In addition to his role at Antaeus, he serves as the president of The Prospect Hill Foundation and is a director of The Sperry Fund. He is also actively involved in the arts, holding the position of chairman of the Yale School of Drama Board of Advisors and chairman emeritus of Lincoln Center Theater, and serves on the board of Page73 Productions. Mr. Beinecke earned his B.A. from Yale University in 1969.
fund.title: Antaeus Enterprises Inc (Family Office)
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; public-markets; private-debt; real-estate; software; energy; healthtech
fund.description: Antaeus Enterprises Inc. is the single-family office for the Beinecke family, established in 1975. Headquartered in New York, the firm manages the wealth generated from the Sperry & Hutchinson Green Stamps enterprise. Its primary function is to oversee the family's fortune through long-term, patient capital deployment across various asset classes to ensure diversified wealth preservation.
fund.thesis: The firm allocates capital across private equity, venture capital, public markets, private debt, and real estate. Their strategy involves dynamic portfolio construction, evaluating individual investment managers, and assessing co-investment opportunities. Antaeus also advises early-stage venture funds and operating companies in sectors including software, real estate development, aquaculture, and alternative energy.

poc.description: Hampus Thorson is a Partner and Portfolio Manager at Armada Investment Group, a Zurich-based single family office. In his role, he is part of the team responsible for the firm's investments in private equity, public market securities, and real estate. Armada Investment Group focuses on providing founder capital to entrepreneurs in sectors such as software, IT, FinTech, and hardware, primarily in Switzerland, Germany, the UK, and the United States.
fund.title: Armada Investment Group
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; public-markets; real-estate; technology; software; fintech; ai-ml; cleantech; transportation; enterprise-software; insurance; energy
fund.description: Armada Investment Group is a Zurich-based single-family office founded in 2000 by entrepreneur Daniel S. Aegerter. The firm acts as Aegerter's private investment vehicle, managing a diversified portfolio across private equity, public market securities, and real estate. Armada focuses on providing founder capital to visionary entrepreneurs and has a history of backing companies that have grown into successful enterprises.
fund.thesis: Armada's investment philosophy is centered on backing founders with ambitious ideas and unique determination, reflecting Daniel S. Aegerter's own entrepreneurial journey. The firm invests across all stages but has a preference for working with early-stage teams. Geographically, Armada primarily focuses on opportunities in Switzerland, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

poc.description: Daniel S. Aegerter is a Swiss entrepreneur and the Founder/CEO of Armada Investment Group, his private investment firm. He has been actively involved in launching new companies for over 30 years and works with the founders of companies in Armada's venture portfolio. Aegerter founded his first company at the age of 18 and later built Tradex Technologies, an early digital B2B marketplace, which was acquired by Ariba in 2000. Following this exit, at age 31, he established Armada to back visionary founders.
fund.title: Armada Investment Group
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; public-markets; real-estate; technology; software; fintech; ai-ml; energy; cleantech; saas; enterprise-software; insurance
fund.description: Armada Investment Group is a Zurich-based single-family office for the Aegerter family, founded in 2000 by entrepreneur Daniel S. Aegerter. The firm was established after Aegerter sold his company, Tradex Technologies, to Ariba for $5.6 billion. Armada functions as a venture fund and family office, managing a substantial portfolio across private equity, public market securities, and real estate, and provides founder capital to entrepreneurs.
fund.thesis: Armada's investment philosophy is shaped by its founder's entrepreneurial background, focusing on providing "founder capital" to visionary entrepreneurs working on significant problems and meaningful innovation. They invest across all stages but have a primary focus on early-stage teams and are particularly interested in backing founders in Switzerland, Germany, the UK, and the United States. The firm invests in a wide range of sectors, including technology, software, fintech, AI/ML, and cleantech, and also engages in real estate projects with unique value creation opportunities.

poc.description: Mark Baniewicz is a Partner at Corient, following the acquisition of Socius Family Office, where he was President and CEO. He co-founded Socius in 2004 after a career in the NFL with the Jacksonville Jaguars. His experience in professional sports highlighted the need for trustworthy financial guidance for individuals with significant wealth. Mark earned a Bachelor of Science in Finance from Syracuse University and an MBA from the University of North Florida, and he is also a Certified Financial Planner™ professional.
fund.title: Alterna Wealth Management
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; public-markets; commodities; esg; impact-investing
fund.description: Alterna Wealth Management is an SEC-registered investment adviser based in Houston, Texas, with a branch in San Antonio. Previously known as Actinver Wealth Management, Inc., the firm provides personalized investment advice and portfolio management to individuals, high-net-worth individuals, trusts, and institutions. Established in its current form in 2021, the firm is owned by Alterna Holdings, Inc., a subsidiary of Alterna Asesoria Internacional SAB de CV.
fund.thesis: Alterna Wealth Management follows a disciplined and goal-oriented investment approach to help clients preserve and increase their capital. Their investment policy is based on a global approach with diversification across various markets, sectors, industries, and products. The firm creates personalized financial plans tailored to each client's risk tolerance and return objectives, utilizing asset allocation and investment in securities like stocks, mutual funds, and bonds.

fund.title: The David Park Foundation for Innovation & Technology
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; ai-ml; healthcare; biotech; energy; telecommunications; sustainable-finance; education
fund.description: The David Park Foundation for Innovation & Technology is a philanthropic organization that supports STEM education for young people through grants and scholarships. It was established by David J. Park, a venture capitalist who is also the Founding General Partner of the Global Innovation Fund (GIF), an early-stage venture fund launched in partnership with SRI International to commercialize deep-technology. The Foundation's work focuses on supporting learning environments and leadership development from early education through university.
fund.thesis: The Foundation's mission is philanthropic, not investment-driven. It aims to invest in the science of learning and provide young people with the experiences needed to succeed, primarily by awarding grants and scholarships to support STEM education and community projects involving innovation and technology. The founder's separate venture capital thesis, through the Global Innovation Fund, is to commercialize world-class intellectual property from research institutions by pairing it with strong operating talent and regional partners.

poc.description: Dr. Mariana Bozesan is the Founder and Managing Partner of AQAL Capital, an investment company focused on integrally sustainable companies. An award-winning investor and serial tech-entrepreneur, she leverages technology to implement the UN SDGs. Her career as an investor in high-tech, clean-tech, and medical devices began in 1995, and she was an initial investor in Cybernet AG, the first internet company to go public on the German stock exchange. Dr. Bozesan holds a Master of Science degree in Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT) and a PhD in Psychology.
fund.title: AQAL Capital
fund.sectors: technology; ai-ml; software; enterprise-software; cleantech; energy; healthtech; media; entertainment; impact-investing; sustainable-finance
fund.description: AQAL Capital is a Munich-based family office and exponential-tech holding company founded in 2014 by serial entrepreneurs Dr. Mariana Bozesan and Tom Schulz. The firm engages in direct and indirect investments across various stages, from early to growth, with a focus on creating integrally sustainable companies. AQAL Capital is recognized for its 'Integral Investing' philosophy, which emphasizes leveraging exponential technologies to address global challenges, particularly those outlined by the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
fund.thesis: AQAL Capital invests in early-stage, state-of-the-art exponential technology companies with the potential for substantial growth and integral impact, aligning with the UN SDGs within Planetary Boundaries. They prioritize companies with strong leadership teams, proven technology, and a short path to cash flow break-even. The firm's investment philosophy, termed 'Integral Investing', seeks to balance People, Planet, and Profit, guided by Passion and Purpose (the '6Ps').

poc.description: Brett Bean is a Partner at Armory Capital, a family investment office. He is involved in the firm's investment activities, including the recent partnership with Westnet LLC. Prior to his current role, Mr. Bean was the CEO and co-founder of FE Moran Security Solutions, a company that received investment from Armory Capital. His leadership at FE Moran was marked by a focus on aggressive growth and delivering a strong customer experience.
fund.title: Armory Capital
fund.sectors: agriculture; financial-services; consumer; healthcare; manufacturing; software; media; transportation
fund.description: Armory Capital is a single-family investment office that operates with permanent capital, allowing for indefinite investment horizons. With a legacy of over 70 years in private business investment, the firm focuses on the lower middle-market. Armory Capital was founded in 2009 and is based in Champaign, Illinois.
fund.thesis: Armory Capital seeks to build long-term partnerships with growth-oriented companies, emphasizing collaboration, integrity, and teamwork. They target companies with a minimum of $10 million in annual revenue and $2 million in cash flow, looking for opportunities in management buyouts, ownership transitions, and growth capital financing. The firm invests between $10 million and $50 million per transaction across various sectors, including agriculture, business services, consumer products, financial services, healthcare, manufacturing, and software.

poc.description: Brian Gallagher is a Managing Director and the Chief Administrative Officer at 1919 Investment Counsel, where he is responsible for overseeing operations, technology, and client service. He also manages the implementation of the firm's strategic plan. Prior to his current role, he was the firm's Director of Investment Systems and Operations, a position he held since joining in 2008. Before 1919 Investment Counsel, Mr. Gallagher was a Vice President at Legg Mason, where he was in charge of investment systems for Legg Mason Capital Management, and previously worked at Olsen Research Associates.
fund.title: 1919 Investment Counsel
fund.sectors: financial-services; public-markets; fixed-income; private-equity; growth-capital; private-debt; esg; sustainable-finance; venture-capital; real-estate; technology
fund.description: 1919 Investment Counsel is a wealth management firm that provides customized investment strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions, and foundations. Its roots trace back to 1919 with the founding of its predecessor firm, Scudder, Stevens & Clark, which pioneered the investment counsel industry. Now a wholly-owned subsidiary of Stifel Financial Corp., the firm has been recognized by publications like Barron's, Forbes, and Financial Advisor Magazine as a top RIA firm.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy is centered on proprietary, fundamental research with a strong emphasis on high-quality companies, risk management, and diversification. They seek to identify companies with superior characteristics such as solid long-term earnings growth, quality management, strong cash flows, and reasonable valuations, using a hybrid bottom-up and top-down approach. Portfolios are actively managed and tailored to each client's specific goals, risk tolerance, and financial needs, with a focus on the long-term growth of capital.

poc.description: George Davitt is the President of Aragain Capital Management, Inc., a single-family office based in Cambridge, Massachusetts. He is a seasoned legal professional with a background as a Partner and member of the Executive Committee at Goodwin Procter LLP, and previously as the Managing Partner at Testa, Hurwitz & Thibeault LLP. His earlier career includes experience as an associate at Davis Polk & Wardwell in New York and as a law clerk to the Chief Justice of Ontario. Mr. Davitt holds law degrees from the University of Toronto and Oxford University and is a member of the bars in Massachusetts, New York, and Ontario.
fund.title: Aragain Capital LLC
fund.sectors: public-markets; fixed-income; private-equity; venture-capital; hedge-funds
fund.description: Aragain Capital Management is a Boston-based investment advisory firm that operates as a family office. Established around 2006, the firm manages the investment portfolio for an entrepreneur, investor, and philanthropist. According to one source, the firm was formally established in 2010 as a multi-family office before focusing on a single family. It specializes in constructing diversified portfolios to meet specific risk and return objectives across various asset classes.
fund.thesis: Aragain Capital's investment strategy focuses on building a diversified portfolio across all major asset classes. This includes public equities, fixed income, private equity, venture capital, and hedge funds. The firm's primary goal is to manage these assets to meet the specific risk and return objectives of the family it serves.

poc.description: Anne Dias is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Aragon Global Management, an investment firm focused on global equities in the internet, technology, and consumer sectors. Her career began at Goldman Sachs in London, after which she served as a portfolio manager at Soros Fund Management and was a founding member of the investment team at Viking Global Investors. Ms. Dias founded Aragon Global Management in 2001 with initial capital from Julian Robertson of Tiger Management. She holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and graduated from the Georgetown University School of Foreign Service.
fund.title: Aragon Global Management
fund.sectors: hedge-funds; public-markets; technology; software; saas; ai-ml; fintech; consumer; ecommerce; financial-services
fund.description: Aragon Global Management is a hedge fund manager founded by Anne Dias that invests in global public equities with a focus on the internet, technology, and consumer sectors. The original entity was founded in 2001 with seed capital from Julian Robertson of Tiger Management, and the current Delaware limited partnership was formed in 2019 and registered with the SEC in 2021. The firm serves institutional investors and high-net-worth individuals from its headquarters in Miami, Florida.
fund.thesis: Aragon's investment philosophy rests on three pillars: long-term fundamental stock selection, thematic investing, and global investing. The firm seeks to identify key "megatrends" and disruptive innovation, such as AI, to find companies with improving long-term business prospects at attractive valuations. They employ a multi-year time horizon for long positions and a 6-12 month horizon for short positions, investing in both US and international companies.

poc.description: Jacob "Jake" Ambrose is a Managing Partner and Co-founder of Armory Capital, a family investment office established in 2009. At Armory Capital, he is involved in making long-term investment decisions in private businesses, supported by the firm's permanent capital structure. His prior experience includes roles as an Analyst at Highland Capital Management LP, an Associate at Goldner Hawn Johnson & Morrison, Inc., and an Analyst at Piper Jaffray Cos. Mr. Ambrose holds an undergraduate degree from the University of Illinois and an MBA from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
fund.title: Armory Capital
fund.sectors: agriculture; consumer; financial-services; healthcare; manufacturing; software; technology
fund.description: Armory Capital is a single-family investment office with a legacy of over 70 years in private business investment. Operating with permanent capital, they are not constrained by traditional fund timelines and can hold investments indefinitely. The firm emphasizes long-term partnerships built on mutual trust and integrity, working collaboratively with the management teams of their portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: Armory Capital seeks to invest in privately held, lower middle-market companies with a minimum of $10 million in revenue and $2 million in cash flow. They target various transaction types, including management buyouts, growth equity, and ownership transitions, with a focus on sectors like agribusiness, business services, consumer products, financial services, healthcare services, manufacturing, and software. Their investment approach is flexible, considering both majority and minority equity stakes and a willingness to co-invest with partners.

poc.description: Bryan Polley serves as the SVP Managing Director Client Advisory at Ascent Private Capital Management of U.S. Bank. In his role, he provides advisory services to high-net-worth clients. Prior to his current position, he was a wealth management advisor at the Private Client Reserve of US Bank, which he joined in 2015. Previously, he worked as a senior investment consultant at Allodium Investments, where he served high net worth clients and institutions.
fund.title: Ascent Private Capital Management of U.S. Bank
fund.sectors: financial-services; impact-investing
fund.description: Ascent Private Capital Management is a multi-family office and a subsidiary of U.S. Bank, established in 2011 to serve ultra-high-net-worth families. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services including investment consulting, private banking, trust and estate planning, and family office services. Ascent has received recognition in the wealth management industry, including being named the 2025 winner in the Family Wealth Counselling category by Family Wealth Report.
fund.thesis: Ascent's investment strategy integrates traditional wealth management with a focus on wealth impact, helping families align their financial capital with their human, intellectual, and social capital. They emphasize values-based investing, including environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles and impact investing, to create a positive impact alongside financial returns. The firm caters to clients with significant wealth, with client net worth minimums cited as increasing over time, from over $25 million in 2011 to at least $75 million by 2018.

poc.description: Robert J. Arogeti is a Partner at Aprio, where he serves as a seasoned advisor to high-net-worth individuals, families, and fiduciary clients. His expertise lies in estate and individual income taxation, wealth transfer, legacy preservation, and charitable giving. Previously, he was a partner at Habif, Arogeti & Wynne, LLP before its rebranding to Aprio. He earned his Master of Professional Accounting (MPA) with a concentration in Tax from the University of Texas and his Bachelor of Science in Business Administration (BSBA) in Accounting from the University of North Carolina.
fund.title: Aprio
fund.sectors: private-equity; manufacturing; real-estate; hospitality; technology; aerospace; defense; financial-services; healthcare; consumer; education
fund.description: Aprio is a premier, full-service business advisory and certified public accounting (CPA) firm headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded in 1952 as Habif Arogeti & Wynne, the firm rebranded to Aprio in 2015 and has since grown to become one of the top 25 largest accounting firms in the United States. Aprio provides a range of services including advisory, audit, tax, wealth management, and private client services to clients in all 50 states and over 50 countries. The firm has expanded significantly through a robust M&A strategy, completing over 20 mergers and acquisitions between 2017 and 2023 and receiving its first institutional capital investment from Charlesbank Capital Partners in 2024 to accelerate further growth.
fund.thesis: Aprio's strategy centers on providing comprehensive advisory and accounting services to drive growth, manage risk, and protect wealth for its clients, which range from startups to market leaders. The firm focuses on an aggressive growth strategy through the acquisition of other accounting and advisory firms to expand its geographic footprint and service offerings in key sectors. Aprio serves a diverse client base in industries such as manufacturing, real estate, hospitality, government contracting, and technology, offering specialized transaction advisory services for deals with values up to $250 million.

poc.role: Partner & Senior Portfolio Manager, Director of Asset Management Group
poc.description: Michael Mackinnon is a Partner & Senior Portfolio Manager, and the Director of the Asset Management Group at Altman Advisors. He has a background as a financial advisor and has previously held positions at PPM America. His experience is in portfolio management for individuals and small businesses, as well as the selection of other advisers.
fund.title: Altman Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; public-markets; fixed-income; financial-services
fund.description: Altman Advisors is a boutique, multi-family office headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, established in 2016. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management, financial planning, and discretionary portfolio management services to high-net-worth individuals and families. With roots dating back to 1977, the firm operates as an independent, fiduciary adviser, focusing on multi-generational wealth preservation and growth.
fund.thesis: Altman Advisors employs a fundamental, research-driven investment approach that is tailored to each client's specific goals and risk tolerance. Their strategy encompasses a diversified range of asset classes including public equities, credit, and alternative investments like private equity and real estate. The firm emphasizes holistic financial planning, risk management, and objective advice to manage and grow wealth across generations.

poc.description: Sekhar Puli is an accomplished entrepreneur and investor with over 25 years of experience in the technology and business sectors. He is currently a Managing Partner at AROA Ventures, a venture capital firm. Previously, he was the founder and CEO of REAN Cloud, an IT service management company that was acquired by Hitachi Vantara. He also served as the Global CEO of ArchLynk, a supply chain management company. Mr. Puli holds a Master's degree in Computer Science from George Mason University and an MBA from Georgetown University.
fund.title: Private Equity, FinTech, Business Serivces, Industrials, Energy
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; software; media; entertainment; financial-services; retail; healthtech; fintech; consumer; infrastructure; education
fund.description: Aroa Ventures is the family office of OYO's founder, Ritesh Agarwal, established in 2020. Initially sponsored by Agarwal's RACo Holding Company, it is now a venture capital firm that backs mission-driven entrepreneurs. The firm focuses on early to growth-stage businesses, providing capital and operational support to accelerate their growth and deliver strong, risk-adjusted returns. Notable companies in its portfolio include CRED, Unacademy, Urban Company, and Zetwerk.
fund.thesis: Aroa Ventures employs a multi-sector and multi-stage investment strategy, focusing on early to growth-stage companies from Pre-Seed to Series C. The firm seeks to partner with entrepreneurs of high repute, investing in businesses with proven unit economics and a high potential for scale. Aroa's ticket size ranges from approximately $500,000 to $5 million, targeting sectors such as consumer, technology, fintech, healthtech, and leisure infrastructure, primarily in India and Southeast Asia.

poc.description: Ahmed (Jim) Morshed is an IFA - Asset Manager at Ruby Capital, a Multi-Family Office. His previous experience includes roles as a Director at Berkeley Financial Ltd, a Financial Consultant at Sanlam, and a Financial Advisor at Barclays Wealth and Investment Management. He has been in the financial industry since at least 2012.
fund.title: Ruby Capital
fund.sectors: hedge-funds; financial-services; consumer
fund.description: Ruby Capital Partners LLP is a London-based investment management and advisory firm established in 2005. The company is authorized and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and provides services to private funds and qualified investors. It operates globally, partnering with hedge funds and alternative investment firms.
fund.thesis: Ruby Capital Partners' investment strategy focuses on capital markets, event-driven, and special situations strategies. The firm offers discretionary investment management services to private pooled investment funds. There is no publicly available information on their specific stage preference or ticket size.

poc.description: Urs Bamert is the Managing Director and founder of Atrium Family Office AG, which he established in 2008. His career in finance includes founding Bamert & Partner AG in 2002, which he sold in 2021. Previously, he worked for a Swiss bank in Toronto and served as a chancellery secretary at the Swiss Embassies in Paris and Tokyo. Mr. Bamert's education includes training in the Swiss finance and credit industry, the Canadian Securities Course from The Canadian Securities Institute, and an executive program at the Swiss Finance Institute.
fund.title: Atrium Family Office AG
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; venture-capital; financial-services
fund.description: Atrium Family Office AG is an independent, founder-owned multi-family office established in 2008 and based in Zug, Switzerland. The firm provides a range of coordinated services to its clients, acting as a single point of contact for specialists in fields such as banking, legal matters, taxes, real estate, and private equity. Atrium Family Office AG emphasizes discretion and transparency in its operations.
fund.thesis: Atrium Family Office AG's investment thesis centers on providing comprehensive and personalized financial advisory and wealth planning services to high-net-worth individuals and families. Their approach is to act as a coordinator for a network of external service providers across various sectors, including private equity and real estate, to preserve and grow family assets through tailored strategies. The firm is based in Switzerland and appears to have a focus on serving its local market.

fund.title: Bioverge Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; healthcare; healthtech; biotech; ai-ml; software; technology
fund.description: Bioverge Ventures is a venture capital firm and investment platform founded in 2016 that specializes in early-stage healthcare startups at the intersection of biology and technology. They aim to democratize access to venture capital investments in the healthcare sector for accredited investors. Notable achievements include several portfolio company exits and a portfolio with companies valued at over $100 million.
fund.thesis: Bioverge's investment thesis focuses on the convergence of healthcare and technology, a sector they term "TechBio". They seek to invest in companies with strong teams and a clear vision for transforming healthcare from a reactive "sick care" system to a preventative, personalized one. Their primary focus is on early-stage companies in the healthcare, healthtech, and biotech sectors, often leveraging AI and machine learning, with a preference for Seed and Series A rounds, but also participating in later stages.

poc.description: Terri Ludwig is the CEO of Ballmer Group, where she leads the organization's strategy for funding initiatives aimed at expanding economic opportunity and reducing systemic inequities in the United States. She has held this position since 2019. Her extensive career includes serving as the CEO of Enterprise Community Partners, President and CEO of Merrill Lynch Community Development Company, and CEO of ACCION New York. Terri holds a Master in Public Administration from Harvard Kennedy School and a Bachelor of Science from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
fund.title: Ballmer Group
fund.sectors: impact-investing; education; healthcare; real-estate
fund.description: Ballmer Group, founded in 2015 by former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer and his wife Connie Ballmer, is a philanthropic investment company dedicated to improving economic mobility for children and families in the United States. Operating as a family office, the firm invests in leaders and organizations that are working to reshape opportunity and reduce systemic inequities. Notable initiatives include a $425 million donation to the University of Oregon to establish the Ballmer Institute for Children's Behavioral Health and a $165 million commitment to Communities in Schools.
fund.thesis: Ballmer Group's investment thesis centers on providing long-term, unrestricted support to organizations capable of creating systemic change and improving economic outcomes for underserved populations. They conduct significant data-based due diligence before investing and focus on a wide range of sectors including early childhood, K-12 education, college and career pathways, housing, behavioral health, and criminal justice. While they invest nationally across the United States, they have a deep focus on Washington state, Los Angeles County, and southeast Michigan.

poc.description: Cheryl R. Holland is the Founder of Abacus Planning Group, a wealth management firm. She began her career in econometric research after graduating from Bryn Mawr College with a degree in economics. Holland founded Abacus Planning Group in 1998 to provide fee-only financial planning and money management. She is a Certified Financial Planner (CFP) and holds a certificate in Family Business Advising.
fund.title: Abacus Planning Group
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Abacus Planning Group is a fee-only, SEC-registered investment adviser founded in 1998 by Cheryl Holland. The firm provides personalized financial planning and investment management services, primarily for families with shared assets. As of 2025, the firm manages approximately $1.8 billion in assets for around 300 clients. Abacus has been recognized by the Financial Times as one of the "300 Top Registered Investment Advisers".
fund.thesis: Abacus employs a holistic and customized investment strategy centered on each client's individual financial goals, risk tolerance, and personal circumstances. As a fee-only fiduciary, its approach is to build diversified, cost- and tax-aware portfolios, primarily utilizing funds and ETFs, including those with ESG and socially responsible considerations. The firm's philosophy is based on a long-term, disciplined perspective, avoiding market timing and focusing on a global allocation across various asset classes.

poc.description: Tony Brita serves as the COO/CIO and Principal at Ash Crest Corp, a single family office based in Fort Wayne. Previously, he was the managing director of Katz, Sapper & Miller's Fort Wayne office, where he accumulated over 16 years of public accounting experience. His expertise includes entrepreneurial advisory, assurance services, and transaction advisory for clients across various industries. Mr. Brita holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in accounting from Ball State University and is a Certified Public Accountant.
fund.title: Ash Crest Corp
fund.sectors: impact-investing; technology; saas
fund.description: Ash Crest Corp is a single family office founded in 2016. Based in Fort Wayne, United States, the firm primarily engages in seed-stage investments. As a private investment firm, it maintains a small team to manage its operations.
fund.thesis: Ash Crest Corp's investment strategy is centered on providing seed-stage funding to companies. The firm's geographic focus is on businesses based in the United States. Information regarding specific sectors of interest, such as impact investing, technology, or SaaS, is not publicly available.

poc.description: Kathleen “Kathy” Burge was a co-founder and former executive of Appleton Partners, having been instrumental in the firm's creation in 1986. Prior to her retirement, she was a trusted Wealth Manager, a member of Appleton's Equity Investment Committee, and held executive management responsibility for Finance and Administration. Her leadership over many years was integral to the firm's long-term success. It is with great sadness that Appleton announced her passing at the age of 75.
fund.title: Appleton Partners
fund.sectors: public-markets; fixed-income; financial-services; private-equity
fund.description: Appleton Partners is an independent, 100% employee-owned wealth management firm based in Boston, Massachusetts. Founded in 1986, the firm provides personalized financial planning and investment management, creating and managing separate client-focused equity, fixed-income, and balanced portfolios. Appleton Partners serves high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutional clients, emphasizing a customized approach rather than a “one-size-fits-all” mentality.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy emphasizes quality, liquidity, and tax efficiency, focusing on high-quality bonds and stocks to preserve capital and enhance long-term risk-reward characteristics. Their process is built on proprietary, fundamental research complemented by macroeconomic and technical analysis to identify attractive investment opportunities primarily in the U.S. public equity and fixed income markets. They utilize separate account management to tailor portfolios to individual client objectives, risk tolerance, and tax situations.

poc.description: Joao Portugal da Cunha serves as the Managing Director at Amorim Holding II, a family office based in Mozelos, Portugal. Due to limited publicly available information, further details about his professional background, specific responsibilities, and career history are not available.
fund.title: Amorim Holding II
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; energy; commodities; financial-services; real-estate; consumer
fund.description: Amorim Holding II is a key holding company within the larger Grupo Américo Amorim, a prominent Portuguese multinational conglomerate with a history dating back to 1870. The group, founded by the Amorim family, has evolved from its origins in the cork industry to become a diversified investment holding with significant interests in energy, real estate, and luxury goods. Led by Paula Amorim, the granddaughter of the visionary leader Américo Amorim, the group is known for its strategic, long-term investments in market-leading companies.
fund.thesis: Grupo Américo Amorim's investment strategy focuses on acquiring significant or controlling stakes in companies with strong market positions and potential for sustained growth. The group has historically diversified its portfolio by investing in emerging and profitable sectors, both within Portugal and internationally. While the group has explored private equity through initiatives like the now-quiet Amorim Global Investors, its more recent and active venture-style investments are highly specialized, such as those through Amorim Cork Ventures, which backs startups with innovative applications for cork.

Her professional background and specific responsibilities at the firm are not detailed in publicly available information. Further details regarding her career history, years of experience, and educational background could not be immediately verified through public search results.
fund.title: Aragain Capital LLC
fund.sectors: public-markets; fixed-income; private-equity; venture-capital; hedge-funds
fund.description: Aragain Capital Management is a Boston-based investment firm that provides advisory services. Established around 2006-2010, the firm operates as a family office, managing the investment portfolio of what is described as a single entrepreneur, investor, and philanthropist. Aragain invests across a wide array of asset classes to build a diversified portfolio.
fund.thesis: Aragain Capital's investment strategy focuses on constructing a diversified portfolio tailored to meet specific risk and return objectives. The firm allocates capital across public equities, fixed income, private equity, venture capital, and hedge funds to achieve its goals. Further specific details on its investment criteria, sector, or geographic focus are not publicly available.

poc.description: Zachary Berger is a Managing Director at ArchPoint Investors. Further details about his professional background, including career history and education, are not publicly available.
fund.title: ArchPoint Investors
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; fixed-income; public-markets
fund.description: ArchPoint Investors is an SEC Registered Investment Advisor founded in 2009, originally as Botty Investors, LLC. The firm acts as a multi-family office, providing wealth management and investment advisory services to a global clientele of high-net-worth families, endowments, and foundations. With offices in Miami and Chicago, ArchPoint serves clients across the United States, Europe, and South America.
fund.thesis: ArchPoint's investment philosophy centers on capital preservation through a benchmark-free, valuation-intensive, and real-return focus. The firm utilizes a blended approach, combining traditional investments like public equity and fixed income with alternative strategies, which include hedge funds, private funds, real estate, and direct private investments. Portfolios are customized based on each client's specific goals, risk tolerance, and time horizon, with opportunistic investing driving asset allocation decisions.

poc.description: Michael Santarelli is the Managing Partner and Portfolio Manager at Altman Advisors, where he oversees investment holdings, maintains asset allocations, and ensures best execution. With over two decades of experience in institutional investing, he has deep expertise in trading all asset classes, risk analysis, and portfolio management. Prior to joining Altman Advisors in 2021, he was a Managing Director at PPM America. He earned his Bachelor of Finance from Illinois State University and an MBA from DePaul's Kellstadt Graduate School of Business.
fund.title: Altman Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; financial-services; technology; healthcare; real-estate
fund.description: Altman Advisors is a multi-family office founded in 2016, with roots dating back to 1977. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management, financial planning, and discretionary portfolio management services to high-net-worth individuals and families. Key milestones include surpassing $250 million in AUM in their first year (2017) and exceeding $450 million in 2025.
fund.thesis: Altman Advisors employs a fundamental, research-driven investment approach focused on multi-generational wealth preservation and growth. Their strategy encompasses public equities, credit, and alternative investments, including private equity and real estate, tailoring investment solutions to each client's goals and risk tolerance. The firm emphasizes a holistic planning process and leverages time-tested asset allocation models to navigate market volatility.

poc.description: Anastassios Caloupis is a Founding Partner at Armatus Family Office AG with over 20 years of experience in trading, Investment Advisory, and Wealth Management. Prior to establishing Armatus, he held positions in Private Banking at Julius Baer, Société Générale, Citibank, and Beta securities. He holds an MSc Hons in Investment and Finance and a BSc Hons in Mathematics for Economics from Middlesex University of London. Mr. Caloupis also holds the Swiss certification of wealth management advisor for banks (CWMA).
fund.title: Armatus Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate; crypto-blockchain; technology; impact-investing; healthtech
fund.description: Armatus Family Office is a Swiss multi-family office headquartered in Zurich, founded in 2018. The firm provides wealth advisory and tailor-made portfolio management services to single family offices and wealthy families. Armatus is privately owned and operates independently of banks, functioning under the compliance and regulatory framework of Aquila AG, a FINMA-regulated entity which is also a minority shareholder.
fund.thesis: Armatus employs a holistic and client-centric investment approach, providing advisory services where clients retain full control over their investment decisions. The firm's strategy is built on creating customized mandates based on client-specific risk profiles, objectives, and constraints, which can include thematic or specific geographical allocations. Their advisory covers strategic asset allocation, core strategies, and tactical trades to complement the overall portfolio structure.

poc.description: Jennifer McGeehan serves as the Chief Administrative Officer for Ascent Private Capital Management of U.S. Bank. In her leadership position, her focus is on client experience and innovation, aiming to provide families with advanced financial solutions and strategies. Her contributions to the field were recognized when she was named the 2025 Private Asset Management Award winner for Women and Wealth Advocate of the Year by with.Intelligence.
fund.title: Ascent Private Capital Management of U.S. Bank
fund.sectors: financial-services; impact-investing; real-estate; technology
fund.description: Ascent Private Capital Management is a multi-family office founded in 2011 as a subsidiary of U.S. Bank. It is dedicated to serving ultra-high-net-worth families with substantial wealth, helping them preserve and grow their financial, intellectual, social, and human capital across generations. The firm has been recognized with multiple awards, including 'Best Private Wealth Manager – Client Service – over $5 billion' by Private Asset Management (PAM) Magazine in 2014.
fund.thesis: Ascent's investment philosophy centers on a holistic and integrated approach that addresses both the quantitative and qualitative aspects of multi-generational wealth. Their strategy combines traditional wealth management services, such as investment consulting and private banking, with strategic 'wealth impact planning' which includes family governance, philanthropy, and preparing heirs, all grounded in the family's specific values and vision.

poc.description: Joshua Davis is a Partner at Baseline Partners LLC, where he is a member of the Management Committee and Investment Committee. He is responsible for leading business development and capital raising efforts for the firm's strategies. His career history includes roles as a Vice President at Bank of America Merrill Lynch's Global Corporate & Investment Bank, as well as positions at J.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank, Citi Private Bank, and J.P. Morgan Private Bank. Joshua earned a B.A. in Economics from Columbia College at Columbia University.
fund.title: Baseline Partners
fund.sectors: real-estate; private-debt
fund.description: Baseline Partners is an alternative investment manager specializing in private credit and commercial real estate. Affiliated with the Cardon Family Office, a third-generation family business, the firm was founded to offer investors alternatives to traditional fixed-income and equity with a focus on capital preservation and consistent income. Baseline Partners manages private funds that invest in short-term, first-lien loans secured by commercial real estate.
fund.thesis: Baseline Partners' investment strategy centers on originating and acquiring senior-lien, short-term bridge loans backed by commercial real estate across the United States. The firm targets loans for purchase, rehab, value-add, or stabilization purposes, focusing on asset classes such as multifamily, mixed-use, office, retail, and warehouse. They employ an institutional due diligence process to underwrite experienced investors and operators, requiring a full personal guaranty on loans.

fund.title: Aurec Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; technology; telecommunications; consumer; ecommerce; infrastructure; insurance; agriculture; saas; financial-services
fund.description: Aurec Capital is a single-family office with a global presence, including headquarters in New York and Tel Aviv, and offices in Berlin, Warsaw, and Shanghai. Founded in the late 1960s by the Khan and Meitar families, the firm has a long history of entrepreneurial investments and has been instrumental in establishing leading companies in sectors like telecommunications, insurance, and infrastructure. Aurec Capital invests across private equity, venture capital, and real estate, managing a diverse portfolio of direct investments and partnerships.
fund.thesis: Aurec Capital's investment strategy is driven by an entrepreneurial spirit, focusing on diversifying opportunities and building long-term partnerships with strong founding teams. The firm invests in companies that have a secured proof-of-concept and are in the scale-up phase, targeting sectors with long-term growth and daily demand such as TMT, logistics, consumer goods, infrastructure, and technology. Geographically, their investments are spread across North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific (specifically China), Australia, and New Zealand.

His previous roles include VP of M&A at Prudential Financial, a consultant at Booz Allen Hamilton, and financial management positions at PepsiCo and CBS. Allen holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from Middlebury College.
