fund.title: Argentum Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; saas; fintech; enterprise-software; software
fund.description: Argentum is a New York-based growth equity firm that partners with entrepreneurs to build B2B software, tech-enabled services, and business services companies. Founded in 1988, the firm invests in companies that are at a growth inflection point, filling the gap between early-stage venture capital and later-stage private equity. Argentum has been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a top founder-friendly investor and was named the Small Business Investment Company of the Year in 2016 by the U.S. Small Business Administration.
fund.thesis: Argentum focuses on B2B software and tech-enabled services, targeting bootstrapped companies with revenues between $3 million and $25 million. The firm provides $3 million to $15 million in capital for growth, acquisitions, or shareholder liquidity, typically taking minority ownership stakes. Argentum's strategy involves a hands-on approach, working with management to implement operational best practices, source strategic acquisitions, and drive organic growth.

poc.description: Kilian Pender is a Founding Partner at Birchway Capital, where he is responsible for the firm's investment strategy. His career in investing began in private equity with roles at Blackstone and Centerbridge Partners. He was also a general partner at Northzone, co-leading growth and scale-up investing. Pender is a former entrepreneur, having founded hiber, a SaaS enabled b2b marketplace. He holds an MSc in Political Economy from the London School of Economics and a BA in Economics from Trinity College Dublin.
fund.title: Birchway Capital
fund.sectors: technology; software; saas; ai-ml; fintech
fund.description: Birchway Capital is a London-based growth equity investment firm founded in 2024. It operates as a specialist investor focusing on technology scale-ups across Europe. The firm was established to address a perceived gap in the European technology investment landscape for high-growth, capital-efficient businesses.
fund.thesis: Birchway Capital invests in fast-growing technology companies and tech-enabled services within the European Union and the United Kingdom. They target businesses with annual revenues between €8 million and €35 million that are profitable or close to profitability. The firm typically makes minority investments, taking a stake of 15-35% in its portfolio companies.

poc.description: Jez Hansell is a Founding Partner at Birchway Capital, where he is responsible for the firm's involvement with its portfolio companies. His previous experience includes a six-year tenure at Amazon, where he created and scaled three high-growth teams across Europe. Prior to that, he was the COO at hiber for approximately two years and spent five years at Bain, focusing on PE deal advisory and post-acquisition strategy. He holds a PhD in Development Physiology and an MA in Natural Sciences, both from Cambridge.
fund.title: Birchway Capital
fund.sectors: technology; software; saas; ai-ml
fund.description: Birchway Capital is a growth equity investment firm based in London, United Kingdom, founded in 2024. It specializes in investing in fast-growing European technology scale-ups. The firm utilizes a data-led approach to identify potential investments and combines its team's operational and investment experience to support portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: Birchway Capital focuses on high-growth technology companies and tech-enabled services in the EU or UK that are profitable or close to profitability. They target businesses with annual revenues between €8 million and €35 million and look to invest €8-30 million per company. The firm acts as a minority investor, aiming to acquire a 15-35% stake, and provides capital for various purposes, including growth financing, M&A, and providing liquidity for founders.

poc.description: Rael Gorelick is a Partner and the Head of Investments at Biltmore Family Office, where he is responsible for the firm's investment strategy, due diligence, and sourcing. He joined the firm in 2013 when the Gorelick family became the second founding family. Prior to Biltmore, he co-founded Gorelick Brothers Capital, an investment firm recognized for its due diligence and thematic investing. His earlier career included strategic positions at Atlantic Assurance Group and Showtime Networks Inc. Rael is a 1994 graduate of Northwestern University.
fund.title: Biltmore Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; fixed-income
fund.description: Biltmore Family Office is an independent, collaborative multi-family office founded in 2008 by Chris Cecil. The firm provides wealth management, investment advisory, and family office services to a limited number of high-net-worth, multi-generational families. Headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, with an office in Florida, Biltmore focuses on customized stewardship of generational wealth, emphasizing collaboration and transparency.
fund.thesis: Biltmore Family Office's investment thesis is centered on a customized "family balance sheet" framework, aligning a family's assets with their priorities, which are categorized as Lifestyle, Generational, and Legacy needs. The firm scours the globe for investment opportunities, leveraging its network of family offices, endowments, and institutional investors to source unique ideas, including private equity, hedge funds, real estate, and direct company investments. Their approach is collaborative, often incorporating investment ideas from client families with specific industry expertise, and focuses on long-term, after-tax, and after-fee returns.

poc.description: Antony Antoniou is the Managing Director at Aspida Capital, a property investment company. He also holds the position of Managing Director at Robert Irving and Burns, where he leads the company's growth strategy in commercial and residential investment properties. His previous roles include positions at Chadstone Surveyors, RoFund, and Mercantile Land.
fund.title: Aspida Capital
fund.sectors: real-estate
fund.description: Aspida Capital is a specialist real estate investment company operating as the single-family office for Tony Yerolemou and his family. Founded in 2017, the firm focuses on the UK property market, managing investments and providing co-investment solutions and support to other family offices and fund managers. The name 'Aspida' is Greek for 'shield', reflecting the company's core mission of preserving and protecting wealth through high-quality real estate investments.
fund.thesis: Aspida Capital's investment thesis is centered on wealth preservation through acquiring and managing high-quality real estate assets across all property sectors within the UK. The firm engages in the entire property investment cycle, from origination and financial structuring to value enhancement and asset management. They partner with other private and institutional investors through joint ventures, syndication, and advisory mandates to capitalize on opportunities.

poc.description: Henry Billingsley is a Partner at the Billingsley Family Office. Prior to his current role, he was a Partner at the Trammell Crow Company, where he focused on investing in and joint venturing industrial developments across the country. His earlier career included positions at Hayden Stone on Wall Street and Colonial Management in Boston. He holds an undergraduate degree from Stanford University and an MBA from Harvard University.
fund.title: Billingsley Family Office
fund.sectors: real-estate
fund.description: Founded in 1978 by Lucy and Henry Billingsley, Billingsley Company is a real estate development and management firm specializing in master-planned communities. The company develops, owns, and manages a diverse portfolio of office, multifamily, retail, and industrial properties, with a significant presence in the Dallas-Fort Worth area. Co-founder Lucy Billingsley, daughter of legendary developer Trammell Crow, has been inducted into the Dallas Business Hall of Fame and the NTCAR Hall of Fame for her contributions to the industry.
fund.thesis: Billingsley Company's strategy focuses on the long-term ownership and development of large-scale, mixed-use communities based on new urbanism principles. Their approach involves acquiring large tracts of raw land in the path of growth, often holding it debt-free, and developing it into integrated environments with a rich array of amenities to attract tenants and residents. The firm acts as a single-source provider, managing all aspects from design and finance to leasing and long-term management, primarily within the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex.

fund.title: Bar Harbor Wealth Management
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate
fund.description: Bar Harbor Wealth Management is the wealth management division of Bar Harbor Bank & Trust, a community bank founded in 1887. The firm provides comprehensive investment management, financial planning, trust, and estate services to a clientele of individuals, families, businesses, and non-profit organizations. As a key financial services provider in Northern New England, it primarily serves communities across Maine, New Hampshire, and Vermont.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy is client-centric, focusing on creating personalized portfolios that align with individual goals, risk tolerance, and financial situations. Their approach emphasizes long-term growth and diversification, utilizing a mix of individual stocks, bonds, exchange-traded funds, and mutual funds to build and preserve client wealth. Operating with a fiduciary responsibility, the firm's geographic focus is primarily on its Northern New England client base.

poc.description: Christian Zito is a Client Manager at Black Oak Family Office SA. His previous experience includes a role as a Junior Relationship Manager at an external asset manager in Zurich. He also has experience as a Private Banking Intern at Falcon Private Bank Ltd.
fund.title: Black Oak Family Office SA
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Black Oak Family Office SA is a multi-family office based in Geneva, Switzerland, founded in 2015. The firm provides a range of services including investment advisory and asset management. It operates under Swiss company law and is regulated by the Self-Regulatory AOOS, which is approved by the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA).
fund.thesis: Black Oak Family Office's investment philosophy centers on wealth preservation and the multigenerational transmission of assets and values. Their approach is highly personalized, creating tailored solutions for private clients and family offices by focusing on asset allocation and broad diversification to mitigate risk. The firm utilizes an open architecture philosophy, collaborating with a global network of external specialists in areas such as fiduciary management, legal affairs, taxation, real estate, and private equity.

poc.description: Leif Oddvin Jensen serves as the Chairman of the board for Brødrene Jensen AS, an investment company with a primary focus on real estate companies and projects. In his leadership role, he works in close collaboration with Mont Investor Partners AS, which manages the company's portfolio. Brødrene Jensen AS also invests in early-stage and growth companies, mainly within the property sector, and operates primarily in the Greater Oslo region. The company was originally founded as a construction business in 1935.
fund.title: Brodrene Jensen AS
fund.sectors: real-estate; technology; venture-capital
fund.description: Brodrene Jensen AS is a privately owned Norwegian investment company with a history dating back to 1935. The firm has a strong focus on real estate, complemented by investments in innovative start-ups and technology companies, particularly within the property technology sector. Managed in collaboration with Mont Investor Partners AS, Brodrene Jensen AS takes an active ownership approach to its investments.
fund.thesis: Brodrene Jensen AS operates with a dual investment strategy, focusing on both real estate and innovative growth companies. In its venture and growth investments, the firm primarily targets early-stage companies, mainly in the real estate technology sector, and also acts as an active minority owner in established companies with significant growth ambitions. The firm seeks to be a long-term, strategic partner, leveraging its capital, expertise, and network to foster value creation.

Aspen Grove Capital invests across a wide range of asset classes, including public equities, private equity, real estate, and hedge funds.

Aspen Grove focuses on long-term, opportunistic investments in high-potential businesses, often within the small and middle markets, and works closely with existing management teams. poc.description: Pascal Cagni is the Founder and CEO of C4 Ventures, a leading European venture capital fund he established in 2014. Previously, he had a distinguished career at Apple from 2000 to 2012, where he was the Vice President and General Manager for Europe, the Middle East, India, and Africa (EMEIA), significantly growing the region's revenue. His earlier career includes key roles at Packard Bell NEC, Compaq, and Booz Allen & Hamilton. Cagni holds an MBA from HEC Paris, a degree in Public Service from Sciences Po Paris, and a degree in Business Law from the University of Strasbourg III Robert Schumann.
fund.title: C4 Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; ai-ml; software; ecommerce; cleantech
fund.description: C4 Ventures is a European venture capital firm founded in 2014 by former Apple and Microsoft executives. The firm operates with an 'operators backing entrepreneurs' ethos, leveraging the operational experience of its team to support its portfolio companies. Since its inception, C4 Ventures has invested in over 54 tech startups, with a notable track record that includes backing 12 unicorns and achieving over 20 exits, including 2 IPOs.
fund.thesis: C4 Ventures focuses on early-stage investments, primarily at the Series A stage, with selective late Seed and Series B rounds, in technology companies across Europe. The firm's investment thesis is centered on the AI revolution, with a dual focus on software applications and 'Physical AI' such as robotics, autonomous systems, quantum computing, and frontier hardware. They seek to back ambitious entrepreneurs with a global vision and invest in companies with a strong technological moat.

fund.title: ZACHARIAS AG
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: ZACHARIAS AG is a Swiss wealth management firm and multi-family office based in Zurich. Founded in 2015, the company specializes in creating tailored financial solutions for ultra-high-net-worth individuals (UHNWIs). A significant milestone for the firm was being granted a portfolio manager license by the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA) in 2023.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on providing customized financial solutions and comprehensive guidance to its clients. Their approach emphasizes flexibility, speed in strategic decision-making, and proactive risk management. ZACHARIAS AG focuses on providing access to off-market investment opportunities in alternative asset classes, including private equity and debt, alongside traditional portfolio management.

poc.description: Nikki Gokey is a Partner & Head of Planning at Biltmore Family Office, where she provides advisory services to families in areas such as investments, estate and gift tax planning, family governance and education, and income tax planning. With over two decades of experience, she previously served as the Managing Director of the Florida region for GenSpring Family Offices and as a Senior Tax Manager with Grant Thornton and Arthur Andersen. Nikki earned both her Bachelor of Science in Accounting and her Master of Accounting in Taxation from The Florida State University and is a Certified Public Accountant in Florida.
fund.title: Biltmore Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds
fund.description: Biltmore Family Office is an independent, collaborative multi-family office founded in 2008 by Chris Cecil. The firm provides wealth management, investment advisory, and planning services to a limited number of high-net-worth, multi-generational families, positioning itself as an alternative to traditional Wall Street firms. With offices in North Carolina and Florida, Biltmore Family Office fosters a partnership between its client families, partners, and professionals to manage and grow generational wealth.
fund.thesis: Biltmore Family Office's investment strategy is a customized, long-term process centered on a "Family Balance Sheet" framework that aligns a family's total assets with their financial priorities. The firm constructs portfolios diversified across various asset classes, including private equity, real estate, hedge funds, and direct company investments, to solve for three wealth priorities: Lifestyle (lower risk cash flow), Generational (moderate growth to outpace inflation), and Legacy (higher growth). They source unique investment ideas through a network of family offices, endowments, and institutional investors, often focusing on smaller niche managers.

fund.description: C4 Ventures is a European venture capital firm founded in 2014 by former technology operators, including Pascal Cagni, a former Apple executive. Based in Paris and London, the firm leverages its operational experience to support entrepreneurs from inception to exit. Since its inception, C4 Ventures has invested in over 50 tech startups, with a notable track record that includes 12 unicorns and more than 20 exits, including IPOs for companies like Riskified and Via.
fund.thesis: C4 Ventures primarily invests in early-stage European startups, typically at the Series A stage, with selective investments in late Seed and Series B rounds. With a typical ticket size of €2-5 million, C4 Ventures acts as a hands-on partner, often taking a board seat to provide operational support.

poc.description: Lawrence D. Belfer serves as the Chief Executive Officer of Belfer Management LLC, a single family office where he is responsible for overseeing the firm's investment and philanthropic activities. Previously, he held the positions of Vice-Chairman, President, and Chief Operating Officer at Belco Oil and Gas Corp. fund.title: Belfer Management

fund.description: Belfer Management is a single-family office based in New York City that manages the investment and philanthropic activities of the Belfer family. Founded in 2000 by Robert Belfer and his son, CEO Laurence Belfer, the firm originated with a focus on the energy, real estate, and financial services sectors. Over time, the office has expanded its investment scope to maintain a more diversified portfolio across a wide range of industries.
fund.thesis: Belfer Management invests its own principal capital, which allows for a flexible, patient, and long-term investment strategy without the constraints of traditional fund structures. The firm employs a diversified, generalist approach, considering both control and non-control investments across the capital structure with an emphasis on equity, and also partners or co-invests with like-minded families and firms. While historically focused on specific industries, their mandate is now global and diversified across various sectors, including technology, healthcare, and consumer goods.

poc.description: Ross Revenaugh serves as the President and Portfolio Manager at Avalon Capital Management, a role he began in 2020. He is actively involved in all facets of the business and is a member of the investment strategy team. Prior to joining Avalon, he was an Investment Committee member at Windward Investment Management, where he led the West Coast office. His earlier career included roles as an investment banker at Morgan Stanley and Robertson Stephens, and he also served as a Field Artillery Officer in the US Army. Mr. Revenaugh earned a B.S. in Economics from the United States Military Academy at West Point and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
fund.title: Avalon Capital Management
fund.sectors: public-markets; fixed-income
fund.description: Avalon Capital Management is an independent, boutique wealth management firm and registered investment adviser based in Redwood City, California. Founded in 1992, the firm provides individualized financial guidance and portfolio management for clients including executives, professionals, and inheritors, primarily in the Bay Area. A key milestone for the firm was the 2016 development of its proprietary quantitative investment process called "Ada," an acronym for Avalon Dynamic Allocation.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on its proprietary "Ada" (Avalon Dynamic Allocation) process, which aims to protect downside and capture upside for more stable results. This quantitative strategy utilizes a strategic mix of ETFs with weekly rebalancing, driven by historical data, to dynamically select strong relative asset trends and avoid weak ones. The approach is designed to be a scenario-based asset allocation that can perform well in various economic environments where traditional stock and bond portfolios might falter.

fund.description: Belfer Management is a single-family office for the Belfer family, founded in 2000 by Robert Belfer and his son, Laurence Belfer. Headquartered in New York City, the firm manages the family's investment and philanthropic activities. While the family's wealth was historically rooted in the energy, real estate, and financial services sectors, the office now manages a more diversified global portfolio.

On the private side, they often partner with like-minded families and firms, while in public markets, they maintain a concentrated, long-biased portfolio.

poc.description: Chris Cecil serves as Partner & CEO of Biltmore Family Office, where he oversees the delivery of advice to client families. With over 30 years of experience, he specializes in investment management, multi-generational planning, and the succession of closely held businesses. Prior to founding Biltmore Family Office in 2008, he was a Partner at GenSpring Family Offices, President for the Southeast and Florida regions for JPMorgan Private Bank, and a Managing Director at Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. He earned his degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and has received executive degrees from Harvard Business School and the Darden Business School.
fund.title: Biltmore Family Office

fund.description: Biltmore Family Office is a multi-family office founded in 2008 with locations in North Carolina and Florida. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management services to a limited number of high-net-worth families, focusing on a collaborative and aligned approach to grow generational wealth. Biltmore Family Office's mission is to foster collaboration between the intellectual capital of its client families and provide top-tier investment, wealth planning, education, and governance advice.
fund.thesis: Biltmore Family Office's investment strategy is centered around a customized "Family Balance Sheet" framework, which aligns a family's assets with their priorities, categorized as Lifestyle, Generational, and Legacy needs. The firm constructs diversified portfolios across various asset classes, including public equities, fixed income, private equity, real estate, and hedge funds, with a focus on achieving the best risk-adjusted, after-tax, and after-fee returns. They leverage their extensive network of family offices, endowments, and institutional investors to source unique and niche investment opportunities worldwide.

poc.description: G. Chadd Mason, JD, LLM, CWM, is the CEO and Co-Founder of The Cabana Group, a financial services firm he co-founded in 2007. His responsibilities include leading the firm's wealth management, legal counsel, retirement solutions, and financial planning services for a diverse clientele. Before his current role, Mason had a nearly two-decade legal career, which included being a founding partner at Gunn, Mason, Kieklak and Dennis, and serving as a Circuit Court Judge in the Fourth Judicial District of Arkansas. He earned his Juris Doctor degree from the University of Denver, a Master of Laws (LL.M.) in international tax, wealth management, and financial services from the Thomas Jefferson School of Law, and a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from the University of Arkansas.
fund.title: Cabana Holdings
fund.sectors: financial-services; hedge-funds; public-markets
fund.description: Cabana Holdings, operating through its subsidiary Cabana LLC (dba Cabana Asset Management), is an SEC-registered investment adviser founded in 2007. The firm provides financial planning and wealth management services to individuals, institutions, and other investment advisers, bringing financial services, legal counsel, and retirement solutions under one roof. Cabana is known for its risk-managed investment strategies and has been recognized as one of the nation's fastest-growing RIAs.
fund.thesis: Cabana's investment philosophy centers on risk management, utilizing a proprietary Cyclical Asset Reallocation Algorithm (CARA) to manage its portfolios. The firm's core strategy is the "Target Drawdown Series," which quantifies risk by identifying a maximum expected loss from peak to trough and aims to keep the portfolio within that parameter. This approach, which primarily invests in broad asset class ETFs, is designed to minimize emotional decision-making by investors during volatile markets and allow them to remain invested for long-term growth.

fund.thesis: The firm's stated strategy is to engage in trustee activities, operate a family office, handle various financial transactions, and manage its own portfolio of companies, foundations, and assets. It focuses on holding and managing its own equity participations and general wealth management. The company may also acquire, hold, and develop real estate and intellectual property rights.

fund.title: Calibrium
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; public-markets; biotech; venture-capital; hedge-funds
fund.description: Calibrium is a private investment office for a prominent European family, operating from Zurich, Switzerland. Formerly known as Aeris Capital until its rebranding in 2017, the firm was founded in 2006. Calibrium manages a diverse portfolio across various asset classes, including public equity, hedge funds, real estate, venture capital, and private equity, acting as a financial advisor to the family's interests.
fund.thesis: Calibrium's investment strategy is centered on long-term capital preservation and growth through a diversified portfolio designed to balance risk and opportunity across different market cycles. The firm emphasizes meticulous market analysis, due diligence, and strategic asset allocation to ensure stability and growth potential. With a global investment outlook, Calibrium focuses on late-stage venture and buyout opportunities.

fund.title: Kiltoprak Financiers NV
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Kiltoprak Financiers NV is an independent corporate finance advisory and corporate services boutique founded in the Netherlands in 2011 as part of the Bericorp Financial Services Group NV. The firm provides corporate finance advisory, due diligence, and transaction services to investors and medium to large-sized corporations globally. Through its trust company, it also offers corporate, financial, and management services in the Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, and Malta.
fund.thesis: Kiltoprak aims to assist stakeholders in identifying high-growth, value-added businesses and manages the subsequent investment and financing process through end-to-end corporate finance advisory. The firm's mission is to integrate clients' corporate and financial needs into ethical and intelligent solutions. While their advisory services are global, their corporate and trust services have a specific geographic focus on Turkey, Eastern Europe, and the CIS region.

poc.description: Tom Eriksson serves as the Chief Investment Officer at Calibrium AG, a private investment office based in Zurich, Switzerland. He has approximately 30 years of experience in financial markets and investment activities. Prior to his current role, Eriksson was the Managing Director of Adveq Management AG and held various directorships at Wärtsilä. He holds a Master of Science degree in Economics and Business Administration from the Hanken School of Economics in Helsinki and serves on the boards of several other companies, including Oy Hartwall Capital Ab and Tolomeo Capital AG.
fund.title: Calibrium
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; venture-capital; biotech; public-markets
fund.description: Calibrium AG, formerly known as Aeris Capital, is a private single-family office headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland. Founded in 2006, the firm provides investment and financial services for the family of the late Klaus Tschira, a co-founder of the software company SAP AG. Calibrium invests across a wide range of asset classes, including private equity, real estate, venture capital, biotech, and public markets, with a focus on long-term capital preservation and growth.
fund.thesis: Calibrium pursues a global, multi-asset investment strategy with a long-term perspective, aiming to create a diversified portfolio that balances risk and opportunity. The firm focuses on late-stage venture capital and buyout opportunities, seeking to invest in ventures with strong potential for value creation. Their geographic focus includes Europe and the United States.

poc.description: Douglas J. Free is the Managing Partner at Clearwell Group, a family office advisory firm based in Tampa, Florida. His responsibilities include investment management, estate planning, philanthropic advisory, and family business consulting. Prior to Clearwell Group, he was a Senior Portfolio Manager at LCM Global, ran a hedge fund investment due diligence team at Merrill Lynch, and was Director of Sector Research at Geneva Global. Mr. Free holds an MBA from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University and a double-major in Economics and History from Eckerd College.
fund.title: Clearwell Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; manufacturing; healthcare; software; financial-services
fund.description: Clearwell Group is a family office investment firm founded in 2009 and based in Tampa, Florida. The firm makes control equity investments in private businesses and also invests in commercial, industrial, and multi-family residential real estate. Clearwell Group operates with a focus on building lasting businesses and supports entrepreneurs with a collaborative approach.
fund.thesis: Clearwell Group's investment thesis centers on making control equity investments in companies headquartered in the southeastern United States, with a particular focus on Florida. They seek businesses with at least $2 million in EBITDA and employ a patient capital approach without the artificial time constraints of traditional fund structures. The firm's areas of interest include manufacturing, business services, environmental services, healthcare, software, and financial services.

poc.description: Natalie Holm is a Managing Director and Client Advisor at Caprock, bringing nearly 25 years of experience as a trusted advisor to executives, business owners, and multi-generational families. In her role, she assists clients in managing the complexities of investing and aligning their wealth with their values. Prior to Caprock, she was a Senior Client Advisor at Laird Norton Wealth Management and a consultant at Russell Investments, where she advised high-net-worth individuals. Natalie earned the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation in 1997 and holds a B.A. in Business Leadership from the University of Puget Sound.
fund.title: Caprock
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; private-debt; real-estate; infrastructure; commodities; public-markets; fixed-income; impact-investing; financial-services
fund.description: Caprock is a multi-family office founded in 2005 that provides customized wealth solutions for ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, and select foundations. The firm acts as an outsourced chief investment officer and chief financial officer, serving as a trusted partner for those who seek objective advice on their entire balance sheet. In March 2024, Caprock announced its first acquisition, of Grey Street Capital, a boutique advisory firm, which brought Caprock's assets under advisement to over $11 billion.
fund.thesis: Caprock employs an endowment-style investment approach with a particular focus and expertise in non-public markets, including private equity, venture capital, real estate, and private credit. The firm is also a leader in impact investing, aiming to construct a highly diversified mix of investments tailored to client objectives with a global perspective. They are open to partnering with first-time and emerging managers to provide clients with access to a broad range of alternative investments.

poc.description: Adrian Warner is the Founder of Avenir Capital, a firm he established in 2011. He has also been described as CEO, Managing Director, and Chief Investment Officer of the company. With over two decades of experience in private equity and public market investment across Australia, the US, and Asia, his career includes roles as a Partner at Catalyst Investment Managers, Managing Director at CVC Asia Pacific, and investment professional at Pacific Equity Partners and AEA Investors Inc. He began his career as a management consultant with Bain & Company and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of New South Wales.
fund.title: Avenir Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; financial-services; hedge-funds
fund.description: Avenir Capital is a boutique fund manager based in Sydney, Australia, founded in 2011 by Adrian Warner. The firm operates as a single-family office for its founder and also offers its investment strategy to a broader market through the Avenir Global Fund. Avenir Capital has a long-term alliance with Fidante Partners, part of the Challenger Group, to support the growth and distribution of its fund.
fund.thesis: Avenir Capital employs a fundamental, value-based investment strategy, focusing on building a concentrated portfolio of 15 to 30 undervalued global equity securities. The firm invests with a long-term horizon of three to five years, emphasizing capital preservation and a large margin of safety. Their approach is to identify quality companies in both developed and emerging markets that are trading significantly below their intrinsic value.

poc.description: Yannick Ergas serves as the CIO at Chelton GmbH - Chelton AB (Multi Family Office). His professional background includes experience in investment management and a role as a board member for a real estate company. He is based in the Zurich area.
fund.title: Chelton GmbH - Chelton AB
fund.sectors: hedge-funds; financial-services
fund.description: Chelton Wealth is a multi-family office and asset management firm founded in 2016 with entities registered in Sweden and the UAE. The firm provides discretionary asset management and tailored portfolio services to high-net-worth individuals, family offices, corporations, and institutional investors. Chelton specializes in alternative investment strategies, particularly intraday trading and quantitative models, aiming to deliver strong risk-adjusted returns independent of market cycles.
fund.thesis: Chelton's investment philosophy centers on capital preservation and generating absolute returns through a combination of quantitative analysis and experienced human oversight. The firm utilizes a multi-manager, multi-system approach, focusing on short-term, primarily intraday, trading strategies in highly liquid markets like major global currencies, gold, oil, and indices. Their core strategy is to blend uncorrelated trading systems to reduce volatility and deliver consistent performance regardless of broader stock and bond market direction.

poc.description: Steve Rector serves as the Chief Financial Officer and Secretary/Treasurer at Cowles Company, where he also leads the company's growth capital investment strategy. His responsibilities include managing financial functions, bank relationships, and audit and tax functions. Prior to his long tenure at Cowles, which he joined in 1989 as an internal auditor, he was a Certified Public Accountant at Coopers & Lybrand (now PwC). Mr. Rector is a graduate of Whitworth University with a BA in Accounting.
fund.title: Cowles Company
fund.sectors: real-estate; media; healthcare; saas; cleantech; agriculture; venture-capital
fund.description: Cowles Company is a fourth-generation, family-owned enterprise founded in 1890. Initially a newspaper publisher, it has diversified into a portfolio of legacy companies in media, real estate, broadcasting, and newsprint manufacturing. The company actively invests in high-potential growth businesses through its venture capital arm, Cowles Ventures, aiming to support long-term value for its stakeholders and communities.
fund.thesis: Cowles Company, through its venture arm Cowles Ventures, invests in early-stage (Seed to Series A) companies primarily in the Western United States, with a focus on the Inland Northwest. They look for businesses with clear defensibility, market validation, and scalability, particularly within the Healthcare, Media, Environmental Advancement, and B2B SaaS sectors. The investment strategy is described as opportunistic, seeking companies with strong brand potential, patented products, and passionate leadership that is addressing a market need or providing a new solution to a problem.

poc.description: Tim Cosh is an Investment Manager and Director at Colindale, a single family office. He is also a property developer and the founder of FORM+Co, a venture that showcases his projects and seeks co-investment opportunities. An Adelaide native and alumnus of Scotch College, recent reports indicate he has relocated with his family to Byron Bay, NSW. His sister, Katrina Cosh, is an interior designer at the associated Colindale Design.
fund.title: Colindale

fund.description: Colindale is the private investment vehicle for the Australian Smorgon family, descending from one of the country's largest family businesses. Founded in its earliest form in 1870 by the Michell family, it evolved from an agricultural business into a progressive single-family office. Colindale manages a diverse, global portfolio with interests in sectors like sustainable food, agriculture, renewable energy, and environmental solutions.
fund.thesis: Colindale operates as a long-term, sector-agnostic investor with a global mandate, focusing on relationship-driven engagement and active partnership in its ventures. The firm's strategy encompasses direct investments and partnerships in private equity, real estate, public markets, and agriculture. They maintain portfolios and partnerships with other family offices and private investors across Australia, Asia, Europe, and the Americas to unlock diverse investment opportunities.

poc.description: Mark Sandiforth is the Acquisitions Director at Consensus Business Group, where he is involved in acquiring residential and commercial ground rent investments across the United Kingdom. He is a key contact for investment opportunities within the firm. Publicly available information indicates he holds an MBA and has also been a director at Freehold Managers PLC, a property management company.
fund.title: Consensus Business Group
fund.sectors: real-estate; technology; healthtech; biotech; cleantech; agriculture; energy; media; private-equity; venture-capital
fund.description: Consensus Business Group (CBG) is a UK-based single-family office that acts as an advisor to the Tchenguiz Family Trust. Founded in 2003 by Vincent Tchenguiz, the firm is a significant owner and asset manager of residential freeholds in the United Kingdom. In addition to its real estate focus, CBG actively invests in technology companies, with a notable emphasis on the Israeli tech sector.
fund.thesis: Consensus Business Group's investment strategy is twofold, with a primary focus on acquiring residential and commercial ground rent investments in the UK. Concurrently, the firm allocates capital to high-growth technology sectors, including healthtech, life sciences, and cleantech, with a strong geographic preference for Israel. CBG emphasizes its ability to execute transactions swiftly due to its independent capital structure, without reliance on debt finance or protracted board approvals.

poc.description: Robert Jan Teuwissen is the Founder and Chairman of Chelton AB, a firm specializing in asset management and financial technology. He has an extensive career in the financial industry, spanning over 30 years, with a focus on trading in financial markets. Previously, he served as the Chief Executive Officer of Chelton GmbH from March 2016 to February 2024. His experience includes managing trading desks, advising on interest rate and FX risk globally, and a consistent track record of generating above-average returns.
fund.title: Chelton GmbH - Chelton AB
fund.sectors: hedge-funds; commodities; public-markets; financial-services
fund.description: Chelton AB is a financial institution founded in 2016 that operates as a diversified asset management firm with a global presence, including offices in Malmö, London, Dubai, and Hong Kong. They provide discretionary asset management services to a client base that includes high-net-worth individuals, family offices, corporations, and institutional investors across all inhabited continents. The firm has been recognized as a 2025 winner of the Worldwide Finance Awards.
fund.thesis: Chelton Wealth's investment strategy focuses on generating strong, risk-adjusted returns in all market conditions by employing proprietary quantitative technologies and systematic, rule-based trading. Their primary area of expertise is in G10 currency trading, aiming for returns that are uncorrelated with traditional asset classes like stocks and bonds. The firm combines quantitative analysis with experienced-based decision-making and active risk management to achieve its target of an average annual return of 12-13%.

poc.description: Avy Stein is the Founder and Co-Chairman of Cresset Capital, a multi-family office. Before establishing Cresset in 2017, he was the Chief Executive Officer of Willis Stein & Partners, a private equity firm he co-founded in 1994. His earlier career includes serving as Managing Director for Continental Illinois Venture Corp, President of Cook Energy Corporation, and beginning his career as an attorney at Kirkland & Ellis in 1980. Stein earned his law degree from Harvard Law School and a B.S. in accounting from the University of Illinois.
fund.title: Cresset Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; venture-capital; private-debt; public-markets; technology; healthcare; financial-services; education; consumer
fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office and private investment firm founded in 2017 by Eric Becker and Avy Stein. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management and family office services to high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, entrepreneurs, and institutional clients. Cresset has experienced rapid growth, surpassing $70 billion in assets under management, and has been recognized as a top advisory firm by publications such as Barron's and Forbes.
fund.thesis: Cresset's investment thesis is centered on providing clients with a comprehensive, client-first approach to wealth management, offering access to a broad range of public and private investment opportunities typically available to large institutional investors. They focus on creating customized, tax-efficient portfolios and provide services that encompass financial planning, wealth strategy, and direct private investments in areas like private equity, real estate, and private credit. The firm primarily serves entrepreneurs, CEO founders, and ultra-high-net-worth families across the United States.

poc.description: Ray D. Colado was appointed President of Commerce National Bank & Trust on January 1, 2008, and has also held the role of CEO. He began his banking career in 1998 as a trainee at the National Bank of Commerce, which was later acquired by Wachovia. Following his time at Wachovia, he was instrumental in chartering the current Commerce Bank & Trust. He is a 1993 graduate of Furman University.
fund.title: Commerce Bank & Trust
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Commerce Bank & Trust of Florida was a community bank headquartered in Winter Park, dedicated to serving Central Florida's businesses, professionals, and residents. The bank was established in February 2003, continuing the work of a prior institution, the Bank of Commerce, which was founded in 1986 and later acquired. The researched entity, Commerce Bank & Trust, has since been acquired by and integrated into Valley National Bancorp, a larger regional bank holding company. The original website for Commerce Bank & Trust now redirects to Valley National Bank's website.
fund.thesis: As a community bank, Commerce Bank & Trust's strategy was centered on building long-term, personal customer relationships and making prompt, locally-informed banking decisions. Its successor, Valley National Bank, focuses on providing a full suite of financial services, including commercial, retail, insurance, and wealth management. Valley National's recent strategy involves a significant pivot away from its traditional focus on commercial real estate (CRE) lending towards growing its commercial and industrial (C&I) and auto loan portfolios to optimize risk-adjusted returns.

fund.title: Magnolia Private Office S.A
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Magnolia Private Office S.A. is an independent, Geneva-based trust and fiduciary firm founded in 2019. The company specializes in private wealth structuring and estate planning for high-net-worth individuals and their families. Magnolia Private Office is a professional regulated Swiss trustee and company administrator, licensed by the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA).
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy is centered on stability, continuity, and endurance to protect, preserve, and enhance client wealth with a long-term, inter-generational vision. They provide a range of services including trusteeships, company management, private equity, and real estate, leveraging a sophisticated worldwide network of investment, legal, and tax professionals. Their approach involves creating and administering trusts, companies, and other legal entities in Switzerland and abroad to meet client objectives.

poc.description: Trent Gahm is an Associate at Colt Ventures, a private investment firm based in Dallas, Texas. His role and specific responsibilities at the firm are not publicly detailed. Information regarding his career history and educational background is not readily available.
fund.title: Colt Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; hedge-funds; technology; biotech; healthcare; fintech; real-estate; energy; consumer; retail; financial-services; cleantech
fund.description: Colt Ventures is a diversified private investment firm founded in 2003 and headquartered in Dallas, Texas, with a presence in New York City. Operating as a family office for founder Darren Blanton, the firm invests across a variety of sectors, including both private and public companies, as well as other investment funds. Colt Ventures aims to make investments that have a meaningful and measurable impact.
fund.thesis: Colt Ventures' investment strategy focuses on inefficient markets and companies with proven management teams and a clear path to near-term value creation and liquidity. The firm is sector-agnostic, with notable investments in biotechnology, oil & gas, technology, real estate, consumer, and financial services. They invest in both private and public companies and also allocate capital to hedge funds, venture capital, and private equity funds.

poc.description: Patrick Regan serves as a Managing Director and Deputy Chief Investment Officer at Cresset Capital. In this role, he advises the investment team on manager and strategy recommendations based on internal research and due diligence. His responsibilities include extensive travel to evaluate potential investment partners. Patrick earned a master's degree in finance from the University of Minnesota, Carlson School of Management, and a bachelor's degree in economics from St. John's University, and he also holds the CFA® charterholder designation.
fund.title: Cresset Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; private-debt; venture-capital
fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office founded in 2017 by Eric Becker and Avy Stein to provide a new paradigm for wealth management for entrepreneurs, CEO founders, and high-net-worth families. The firm offers a comprehensive suite of family office services and access to institutional-quality private investments through its investment arm, which was rebranded from Cresset Partners to Peakline Partners in February 2025. Cresset has received numerous accolades, including being recognized as a top RIA firm by publications like Barron's and Forbes.
fund.thesis: Cresset's investment thesis revolves around providing its clients with direct access to curated private investment opportunities in sectors like private equity, real estate, private debt, and venture capital, which are typically unavailable to individual investors. The firm operates under a "True Fiduciary®" standard, emphasizing a client-first approach and leveraging its extensive network to source and execute investments. Their private investment arm, Peakline Partners, focuses on long-term partnerships with entrepreneurs and management teams, investing in U.S.-based businesses across various stages and sectors including financial services, healthcare, technology, and real estate.

fund.description: Cottonfield Family Office AG is a multi-family office headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2004. [1, 2, 9, 10] The firm provides comprehensive wealth management services to entrepreneurial families, senior executives, and private individuals, including succession planning, direct investments, and asset structuring. [2, 9, 14] A key milestone is its upcoming merger with Bodewise Family Office, effective January 1, 2026, after which the combined entity will operate as Bodewise Cottonfield Family Office AG. [1, 3, 4] The firm was notably shortlisted for the 'Multi Family Office Team of the Year' award by the Society of Trust and Estate Practitioners (STEP) in 2011, 2012, and 2013. [11]
fund.thesis: The firm operates as a 'personal CFO' for its clients, emphasizing independent, holistic, and long-term strategic advice tailored to complex family fortunes. [8] Its strategy involves consolidating and overseeing all client assets, including bankable assets, real estate, and private holdings, to align with a client's individual risk-return profile. [2] The merger with Bodewise reinforces a shared philosophy of providing access to private market investments, such as private equity and venture capital, alongside traditional wealth management and succession planning. [1, 5, 6]

poc.description: Peter Schuppli is a Managing Partner and a founding partner of Cottonfield Family Office AG, a role he has held since 2004. He is an experienced Family Officer, specializing in providing dedicated services to entrepreneurial families, including guidance on asset transfer and succession planning. Prior to founding Cottonfield, he had a long career with Credit Suisse Group, culminating in a five-year tenure on the Executive Board of Bank Leu AG. Mr. Schuppli studied at the University of Zurich and The Wharton School and is a Certified Financial Planner (CFP).
fund.title: Cottonfield Family Office AG
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Cottonfield Family Office AG is a multi-family office based in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2004. The firm provides comprehensive and personalized services to entrepreneurial families, senior executives, and philanthropists, including succession and estate planning, direct investments, and diversified capital-markets portfolios. A notable milestone is the upcoming merger with Bodewise, with the combined entity to be named Bodewise Cottonfield Family Office AG, effective from the beginning of 2026. The firm was also shortlisted for the 'Multi Family Office Team of the Year' award by the Society of Trust and Estate Practitioners (STEP) in 2011, 2012, and 2013.
fund.thesis: Cottonfield Family Office's investment thesis revolves around providing independent, conflict-free, and generational oversight for their clients' assets. They focus on a holistic approach that includes not only investment management but also strategic advice on asset structuring, risk management, and governance, as well as legal and tax matters. The firm's strategy is to act as a long-term, trusted partner for all aspects of their clients' wealth, with a focus on creating tailor-made and sustainable solutions.

fund.description: Cottonfield Family Office AG is a multi-family office based in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2004 by Peter Schuppli and Michael Häusler as a partner company of Aquila AG. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management services for entrepreneurial families, senior executives, and private individuals, focusing on long-term, personalized strategies. A significant milestone is its planned merger with Bodewise, another Zurich-based multi-family office, to operate under the name Bodewise Cottonfield Family Office AG starting January 1, 2026.

The core philosophy emphasizes risk management, transparency, and developing simple, sustainable solutions tailored to individual client needs, including succession planning, M&A, and tax structures.

fund.description: Commerce Bank & Trust is a locally-owned community bank headquartered in Winter Park, Florida, serving the businesses, professionals, and residents of Central Florida. Originally opened as Commerce Bank of Florida in February 2003, it was granted trust powers in 2006, leading to a name change. On December 30, 2021, the bank converted from a national to a state-chartered bank, officially becoming Commerce Bank & Trust.
fund.thesis: The bank's strategy centers on building long-term customer relationships through personalized service and local, expedient decision-making. Its primary focus is commercial lending, offering products such as commercial real estate loans, lines of credit, equipment financing, and construction loans to its Central Florida client base. The bank's 2024-2026 strategic plan emphasizes growing its loan portfolio and enhancing cross-selling and marketing efforts within its service area.

fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office and private investment firm founded in 2017 by Eric Becker and Avy Stein to provide a more comprehensive and client-aligned wealth management experience. The firm serves high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, entrepreneurs, and institutions with a suite of services including wealth and investment management, family office services, and access to private investments. Cresset has grown rapidly through both organic growth and strategic acquisitions, frequently being recognized as a top RIA firm by publications like Barron's and Forbes.
fund.thesis: Cresset's investment philosophy is centered on a client-first, "True Fiduciary®" standard, providing access to a broad range of public and private market opportunities. The firm utilizes both active and passive management strategies and focuses on creating customized, tax-efficient portfolios that align with clients' long-term goals. A key part of their strategy is offering direct access to institutional-quality private investments across private equity, real estate, private credit, and venture capital, opportunities not typically available to individual investors.

poc.description: Hanley Sayers is a Partner, Managing Director, and Wealth Advisor at Cresset, where he helps lead the firm's presence in Texas. fund.title: De Rendtmeesters
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: De Rendtmeesters is an independent multi-family office based in Arnhem, the Netherlands, founded in 2000. The firm acts as a central advisor for wealthy families, providing a holistic overview of their entire capital and coordinating between specialists like banks, asset managers, and tax advisors. Their services include asset management, risk management, and guidance on wealth transfer to the next generation.
fund.thesis: De Rendtmeesters' strategy is to provide long-term, independent advice that offers clients 'overview, insight, and foresight' into their total wealth. They function as generalists who manage the overall financial picture, focusing on the family's long-term objectives, risk management, and continuity rather than promoting specific financial products. Their investment guidance covers a range of asset classes, including publicly listed stocks and bonds, private equity, and real estate, tailored to each family's strategic goals.

fund.thesis: The firm acts as a trusted financial advisor, developing and implementing financial solutions for both the liquidity needs of shareholders and the capital needs of the business. fund.title: Doliver Advisors LP

fund.description: Doliver Advisors, LP is an SEC-registered investment advisory firm headquartered in Houston, Texas, established in 1988. The firm specializes in quantitative investment strategies, particularly focusing on closed-end funds, alongside personalized wealth management and private equity opportunities. As of December 2024, the firm managed approximately $615 million in assets on a discretionary basis for a diverse client base that includes high-net-worth individuals, corporations, and pension plans.
fund.thesis: Doliver Advisors' investment philosophy centers on wealth preservation and long-term growth, utilizing customized portfolio management across public securities and private equity to meet individual client needs. A core strategy involves quantitative analysis of the closed-end fund market to identify and capture inefficiencies related to discounts and premiums to Net Asset Value. The firm also employs a "Focused Growth Strategy" that seeks to invest in high-quality, disruptive companies with predictable, recurring revenue streams and strong secular growth opportunities.

fund.description: Chasefield Capital, Inc. is a multi-family office and Registered Investment Adviser located in Lakewood, Colorado. The firm's establishment was linked to an entrepreneurial liquidity event, and it focuses on preserving and growing multigenerational assets.

The firm focuses on strategic asset allocation, tactical shifts, and risk management, while also developing its own private equity funds to add value to client portfolios. fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office founded in 2017 that provides comprehensive wealth management and investment advisory services to high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Cresset aims to provide clients with access to a wide range of investment opportunities, including private equity, real estate, and other alternative investments, alongside traditional public market strategies.

poc.description: K. Don Cornwell is the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Dynasty Equity, a global sports investment firm. fund.title: Dynasty Equity

fund.thesis: Dynasty Equity's investment strategy centers on making strategic investments in resilient, compelling, and differentiated assets across the global sports ecosystem. They emphasize a thoughtful, collaborative approach, leveraging their team's deep experience in private equity, sports, media, and entertainment to build enduring partnerships.

fund.description: Eton Advisors is an independently managed investment advisory firm that provides wealth management and family office services to high-net-worth families across North America. Founded in 2009, the firm was acquired by Focus Financial Partners in 2017. A notable achievement is the development of its affiliate, Eton Solutions, which provides a proprietary technology platform, AtlasFive®, for the wealth management industry and has received awards for its innovations.
fund.thesis: Eton Advisors' investment strategy is centered around a goals-based approach, tailoring portfolios to meet the specific multi-generational objectives of each client family. The firm acts as a 'manager of managers,' utilizing an open architecture approach to select external investment managers. Their strategy favors a passive tilt for efficient asset classes while seeking a diversified approach for alternative investments such as hedge funds, private equity, and real estate to access top-tier managers.

poc.description: W. Jackson Parham, Jr. is a Founding Partner and the Chief Investment Officer at Eton Advisors L.P., where he oversees the firm's investment group and applies a goals-based investment process to client portfolios. With over 25 years of experience in the industry, he is also a member of Eton's Investment Committee. Prior to co-founding Eton Advisors, he served as the CIO of the UBS Multi-Family Office Group and was a founding principal and CIO of the US Trust Multi-Family Office Group. Earlier in his career, Jack spent ten years as a College Finance Professor and served as Chairman of the Department of Business, Economics and Accounting at Hillsdale College.
fund.title: Eton Advisors L.P
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; biotech; healthcare; public-markets; financial-services
fund.description: Eton Advisors is an independent multi-family office that provides sophisticated wealth management and family office services to ultra-high-net-worth clients. Founded in 2009, the firm offers integrated advice on wealth structuring, investment consulting, and family office services with a multi-generational approach. A key milestone for the company was joining the Focus Financial Partners network in September 2017. In 2015, the founders of Eton Advisors established Eton Solutions, a technology company that developed the AtlasFive® platform to enhance efficiency and data management for family offices.
fund.thesis: Eton Advisors' investment philosophy is centered around a "Goals-Based" approach to asset allocation, which prioritizes maximizing the probability of achieving a client's specific, multi-generational goals over simply maximizing portfolio returns. The firm creates customized portfolios and employs an open architecture, 'manager of managers' model, utilizing both passive and active investment strategies depending on the asset class. Their focus is on serving affluent families primarily across North America.

poc.role: Founder / Managing Director / Investment Committee Member
poc.description: J. Craig Falls is the Founder and Managing Director of Enclave Advisors, a private, multi-family investment office he established in 2012. His career in investments began in 2000 at Goldman Sachs & Co., and he later served as a Region President for Northern Trust before founding Enclave. Prior to his investment career, he practiced law, assisting clients with investment-related matters. Mr. Falls earned a Finance degree from Texas Tech University and a law degree from Vanderbilt University Law School.
fund.title: Enclave Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Enclave Advisors is an independent registered investment advisory firm and multi-family office established in 2012. The firm serves a select group of families, businesses, and charitable organizations by providing comprehensive investment advice, trust and estate planning guidance, and family office services. Enclave Advisors has received recognition, including being named to the Financial Times' list of Top 300 Financial Advisors and having its founder, J. Craig Falls, included in Barron's List of the Top 1,200 Financial Advisors and Forbes' Best-In-State Wealth Advisors.
fund.thesis: Enclave Advisors employs a disciplined, independent approach to investment management, customizing portfolios based on each client's specific objectives. Their strategy focuses on components that can be controlled, such as portfolio structure, risk management, asset allocation, and diversification, rather than attempting to time the market. The firm acts as a fiduciary, analyzing all client assets to avoid unintended concentrations of risk and does not sell proprietary funds to ensure advice is solely in the client's best interest.

poc.description: Robert E. Mallernee is a Founding Partner and the CEO of Eton Advisors, L.P. With over 30 years of experience, he specializes in providing comprehensive investment, financial, and estate planning for closely held businesses, senior corporate executives, and wealthy families. His career history includes roles as head of the UBS Multi-Family Office Group, a founding principal of the US Trust Multi-Family Office, and a Senior Tax Manager at Arthur Andersen and Price Waterhouse. Mr. Mallernee holds an MBA in International Business & Finance from the University of Chicago and a BS from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, and he is also a Chartered Financial Analyst.
fund.title: Eton Advisors L.P
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Eton Advisors is an independently managed multi-family office serving ultra-high-net-worth families across North America. Founded in July 2009, the firm provides integrated wealth management, investment consulting, and family office services. A key milestone was joining the Focus Financial Partners network in September 2017, which expanded its footprint in the ultra-high-net-worth sector. The firm is also noted for creating Eton Solutions, a technology platform developed to enhance process efficiency and data management for wealthy families.
fund.thesis: Eton Advisors' investment philosophy centers on a "Goals-Based" approach, customizing portfolios to maximize the probability of achieving a client's specific, multi-generational goals rather than focusing solely on market benchmarks. The firm invests across a range of asset classes, including private equity, hedge funds, and real estate, preferring a diversified approach to alternatives where they believe top-tier managers can add significant value. Their strategy involves designing a specific asset allocation for each client based on their wealth plan, risk tolerance, and return objectives, primarily investing with external managers.

poc.description: Han de Groot is the founder of the De Groot Family Office (DGFO), which he established after the sale of his global marketing technology company, MetrixLab, to a private equity firm. He founded MetrixLab in 1999 and expanded it internationally through organic growth and several acquisitions. Following a merger with Japan-based Macromill, he served as the Global CEO and a Board Director of the combined entity, which later went public on the Tokyo Stock Exchange. Through DGFO, he is also involved in an initiative to build an AI Gigafactory in Rotterdam.
fund.title: De Groot Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; technology; healthcare; media; financial-services
fund.description: De Groot Family Office (DGFO) is a private single-family office founded by entrepreneur Han de Groot. It was established after he sold his global marketing technology company, MetrixLab, to the private equity firm Bain Capital. The firm leverages de Groot's extensive experience in building, scaling, and exiting international companies to manage the family's capital and invest for the long term.
fund.thesis: DGFO operates as a long-term, committed investor with no preset exit timeline, taking both minority and majority stakes in its portfolio companies. The firm focuses on businesses with an EBITDA between €1 million and €10 million, where it can apply its entrepreneurial experience to help organizations expand globally, grow through M&A, and execute successful exits. DGFO's core sectors include technology, life sciences, media, financial services, and real estate.

poc.description: Lucas Sheiner is a Vice President at Declaration Partners, a growth equity and real estate investment firm. He is a member of the growth equity investment team in New York City, with a focus on consumer and crypto/web3 investments. Prior to joining Declaration Partners in 2021, he worked at JPMorgan in the Technology Investment Banking Group. Mr. Sheiner is a graduate of Amherst College.
fund.title: Private Equity, Growth Equity, Platforms,
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; real-estate; venture-capital; healthcare; technology; consumer; fintech; crypto-blockchain; software; manufacturing
fund.description: Declaration Partners is a private investment firm founded in 2017, anchored by the family office of David M. Rubenstein, co-founder of The Carlyle Group. The firm partners with entrepreneurs, operators, and investors, leveraging a combination of institutional private equity sophistication and a family office mindset. Declaration Partners' strategies encompass private investments, real estate, and GP solutions, with a focus on long-term value creation.
fund.thesis: Declaration Partners pursues a flexible and opportunistic investment approach, aiming to generate attractive risk-adjusted returns with a long-term perspective. The firm seeks to invest in growth companies across various sectors, including technology, healthcare, consumer, fintech, and real estate, primarily in North America. They emphasize partnership and alignment with management teams, providing both capital and strategic resources to support growth.

poc.description: Dr. Kurt Moosmann is the Executive Vice-Chairman of Elsa Peretti Holding Ltd., the single family office of the late jewelry designer Elsa Peretti. With over 25 years of experience, he is a sought-after expert in advising business-owning families and entrepreneurs globally. His career includes founding Moosmann Advisors in 2014, co-founding and chairing Dara Capital, and holding senior positions at Quilvest Switzerland and Deutsche Bank, where he led the International Wealth Planning Division. Dr. Moosmann holds a Doctorate of Law from the University of Zurich and an MBA in International Wealth Management from Carnegie Mellon University.
fund.title: Elsa Peretti Holding
fund.sectors: consumer; financial-services
fund.description: Elsa Peretti Holding AG is a single-family office for the estate of the late, renowned jewelry designer Elsa Peretti. Founded in 2018, the firm is domiciled in Zurich, Switzerland. The holding company was established to manage the wealth of Ms. Peretti, who was a highly successful designer for Tiffany & Co. and an heiress to her father's oil business fortune.
fund.thesis: Specific details regarding the investment thesis, sector focus, or stage preference of Elsa Peretti Holding are not publicly available. As a single-family office, its primary purpose is likely the preservation and management of the Peretti family's assets. The philanthropic arm of the family, the Nando and Elsa Peretti Foundation, is very active globally but its activities are separate from the holding company's investment strategy.

poc.description: Shaival Desai is a Partner at Desai Ventures, a family office based in Ahmedabad, India, that invests in early-stage start-ups. He is also a co-founder of Petpooja, a successful online restaurant billing platform. His professional background includes a stint at a venture capital firm in Mumbai, and he holds a degree in engineering from the US and is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA). As an active angel investor, he has a portfolio of companies primarily in the retail and consumer sectors.
fund.title: Desai Ventures
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; commodities; energy; crypto-blockchain; venture-capital; technology; consumer; ecommerce; cleantech; ai-ml; financial-services
fund.description: Desai Ventures is a family office based in Ahmedabad, India, founded by Dr. Mayur Desai. Active for over a decade, the firm specializes in early and growth-stage investments, positioning itself as a key investor in the Indian startup ecosystem. As of late 2025, the firm is an active investor with a portfolio of over 40 companies, which includes notable successes like the unicorn company Licious.
fund.thesis: Desai Ventures' core philosophy is to support founders by developing a strong relationship prior to investing, focusing on the team's cohesion and ability. The firm primarily invests in seed-stage startups across various sectors within India, and also targets pre-seed and seed-stage climate technology startups globally, with a specific focus on India, the US, the UK, and Europe.

poc.description: Lucie Paulet serves as an Investment Analyst at Figana, a single family office. Further details about her professional background, specific responsibilities, and career history are not publicly available.
fund.title: Figana
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; fixed-income; venture-capital; technology; consumer; retail
fund.description: Figana is the single-family office for Gabriel Naouri and his family, based in Monte Carlo, Monaco. The firm focuses on deploying capital to support unique ideas, entrepreneurs, and transformative opportunities. Figana emphasizes generating superior, asymmetrical risk-adjusted returns and often partners with other Tier 1 global family offices and general partners.
fund.thesis: Figana's investment strategy centers on backing exceptional entrepreneurs and transformative ideas with a focus on private equity. The firm seeks opportunities that offer superior, asymmetrical risk-adjusted returns and takes a collaborative approach by partnering with leading global family offices and GPs. While specific sectors are not detailed, their founder has a history of investments in commercial products, internet retail, and educational services.

poc.description: Andrew Cupps is the founder of Cupps Capital Management. He has an extensive career in investment management, having started his career in 1992 at Driehaus Capital Management. Subsequently, he managed hedge fund and mutual fund assets at Strong Capital Management before establishing his own firm. More recently, he has held roles as a Portfolio Manager at Advisory Research Investment Management and Bosun Asset Management, and as of 2025, he is the Head of Team, Portfolio Manager & Analyst at Polen Capital.
fund.title: Cupps Capital Management
fund.sectors: hedge-funds; growth-capital; technology; healthcare; consumer; software
fund.description: Cupps Capital Management was a Chicago-based investment management firm founded by Drew Cupps in 2000. The firm provided investment services to private funds and institutional accounts, focusing on growth-oriented investment objectives and long/short strategies. The firm's SEC registration was terminated in late 2016, and its team and strategies were later integrated into other asset managers, most recently moving to Polen Capital in 2025.
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy, continued by its founding team, focuses on U.S. micro-cap, small-cap, and SMID-cap growth equities. The investment process blends fundamental, thematic, and technical analysis to identify inflection points across emerging trends, innovation cycles, and industry shifts that can drive long-term earnings growth. This approach favors a pragmatic, data-driven methodology to find strong performance potential in companies.

fund.description: DIG Investment, also known as Djursholm Investment Group, is a Stockholm-based multi-family office founded in 2011. It functions as an investment vehicle for the founders of H&M, Karl-Johan Persson and his father Stefan Persson, and is managed by Martin Söderström. The firm focuses on direct investments in unique situations within the global alternatives markets, often targeting the innovative technology sector.
fund.thesis: DIG Investment primarily engages in direct investments in special situations, with a strong focus on the technology sector. The firm has a diverse portfolio, investing across various sectors including High Tech, Consumer, and Enterprise Applications. While they invest across multiple stages, from Seed to Series J, they have a notable focus on Series B rounds, particularly in Swedish startups.
