poc.description: Lisa van Walleghem is the CEO and Founder of MAXIMAI Investment Partners, where she leads a team providing tailored solutions for global clients and spearheads business development. With over 30 years of experience in wealth management for ultra-high-net-worth clients, she specializes in generational planning and global portfolio allocation with a focus on alternative investment strategies. Her career began in 1992 at Merrill Lynch, where she founded the MaximAI Wealth Management Group and earned the designation of Private Wealth Specialist for Latin America.
fund.title: MAXIMAI Investment Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; financial-services; biotech; healthcare
fund.description: MAXIMAI Investment Partners is a boutique family office and investment advisory firm founded in 2016. The firm provides wealth management, domestic and international estate and trust planning, and family office services to a select group of ultra-affluent global clients. MAXIMAI has been recognized by publications like Forbes as a "Best-In-State Wealth Advisor."
fund.thesis: MAXIMAI Investment Partners operates with a "Family First" philosophy, focusing on building long-term relationships with multiple generations of their clients' families. They utilize an independent, open-architecture platform, which gives them access to a wide range of investment managers, private equity funds, and hedge funds to serve their clients' international financial interests. The firm primarily serves global clients with a particular focus on Latin America and the Caribbean.

poc.description: Bob Dunkin serves as a Managing Director and Wealth Advisor at Cresset, where he also leads the firm's West Palm Beach office. With a career spanning nearly 30 years in financial services, he provides comprehensive wealth management strategies for a diverse clientele including entrepreneurs, corporate executives, and multi-generational families. Prior to joining Cresset, he was a Senior Vice President and Private Client Advisor at U.S. Trust and previously held roles as CFO for a private family office and a principal at a private equity investment firm. Mr. Dunkin earned both his Bachelor of Arts in history and his MBA with a concentration in finance from Southern Methodist University.
fund.title: Cresset Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; private-debt; venture-capital; financial-services; public-markets; technology; healthcare; consumer; education
fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office that provides comprehensive wealth management and family office services to high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, and entrepreneurs. Founded in 2017 by Eric Becker and Avy Stein, the firm was established with the vision of reinventing the client wealth experience, moving away from traditional models. Cresset has experienced rapid growth, becoming an award-winning firm recognized by publications like Barron's and Forbes, and has grown significantly through both organic expansion and strategic acquisitions of other wealth management firms.
fund.thesis: Cresset's investment philosophy is centered on a client-first, "True Fiduciary®" standard, offering personalized, goals-based financial planning and strategic asset allocation. The firm provides clients with access to a diverse range of investment opportunities across both public and private markets, including private equity, real estate, private credit, and venture capital, which are typically unavailable to the average investor. Cresset focuses on long-term, sustainable growth and risk management, utilizing a combination of active and passive strategies to build resilient portfolios for its clients, who are primarily located across the United States.

poc.description: Victoria Karasin is the Director of Advisory Services at FFT Wealth Management, where she advises families on the sustainability of wealth across generations. With over two decades of experience in the family office space, she previously held the same role at AM Global Family Investment Office. Victoria is a graduate of Fordham University, holding a Bachelor of Science in Economics, and has earned the Chartered Trust and Financial Advisor (CTFA) designation.
fund.title: FFT Wealth Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; venture-capital; public-markets; healthcare; biotech; ai-ml; financial-services
fund.description: FFT Wealth Management is a multi-family office founded in 2009 to serve the needs of ultra-high-net-worth individuals and families. The firm provides investment management and family office services, including advice on estate planning, philanthropic giving, and other lifestyle considerations. Key milestones include partnering with Wealth Partners Capital Group in 2017, acquiring AM Global and Optima Asset Management in 2019, and merging with Stanhope Capital Group in 2021 to become one of the largest independent wealth managers globally.
fund.thesis: FFT's investment philosophy centers on creating customized, globally diversified portfolios tailored to each client's specific objectives and risk tolerance. The firm leverages its global reputation to gain access to exclusive alternative investments, including top-tier venture capital, private equity, and hedge funds, often providing clients with "early look" opportunities. They utilize a proprietary investment system called AlphaBeta to analyze and manage portfolios across a wide variety of strategies.

poc.role: Chief Operations Officer and Chief Compliance Officer
poc.description: Jenny McCann serves as the Chief Operations Officer and Chief Compliance Officer at Enclave Advisors, bringing over 13 years of experience in investment firm operations. Prior to her current role, she was the CFO/COO for Treaty Oak Capital Management. Her career began in public accounting as an auditor for Deloitte, and she also worked as a Business Analyst for Dell Managed Services. Ms. McCann holds a BBA and MS in Accounting from Texas A&M University and is a Certified Public Accountant.
fund.title: Enclave Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Enclave Advisors is an independent registered investment advisory firm founded in 2012. The firm serves a select group of families, businesses, and charitable organizations by providing comprehensive investment advice, coordinated with trust and estate planning guidance and family office services. Enclave Advisors has received recognition, being named to the Financial Times' 'Top 300 Financial Advisors' and with its founder being included in Barron's 'Top 1,200 Financial Advisors' and Forbes' 'Best-In-State Wealth Advisors'.
fund.thesis: Enclave Advisors employs an independent, disciplined approach to investment management, customizing client portfolios based on specific objectives and circumstances. Their philosophy prioritizes risk management, portfolio structure, asset allocation, and diversification over market timing. The firm emphasizes transparency, does not sell proprietary funds, and acts as a fiduciary to ensure their advice is solely in the best interest of their clients.

poc.description: Jina Kim is the Managing Director of Gates Capital Partners, a single family office based in Denver, CO, and has been with the firm since 2018. She is responsible for leading the firm, which invests in private equity, public equity, and other strategies, primarily in North America. Prior to her current role, Ms. Kim was a Manager at Frontier Airlines in the finance and corporate development group and also worked at Rockbridge Growth Equity, a middle-market private equity firm. She began her career as an Analyst in the Financial Sponsors Group at Wells Fargo Securities and holds a Bachelor of Business Administration from the University of Michigan's Ross School of Business.
fund.title: Gates Capital Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; esg
fund.description: Gates Capital Partners is a single-family office based in Denver, Colorado, that serves the Gates family trusts, members, and affiliates. Established in 2005, the firm continues the legacy of the founders of the Gates Corporation, a global manufacturing company. Gates Capital Partners primarily invests with top-tier private equity managers in buyout and growth equity strategies, and also considers co-investment opportunities.
fund.thesis: Gates Capital Partners focuses on partnering with private equity managers across multiple funds, emphasizing a long-term investment horizon. Their strategy centers on buyout and growth equity, with additional interests in secondaries and special situations, while generally avoiding early-stage venture capital, real estate, or credit funds. The firm's geographic preference is for funds located in North America and they integrate environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria into their investment process to mitigate risk and enhance returns.

poc.description: Orlando Campopiano is the Founder of Essentia Family Office. His previous experience includes a role as an Independent Financial Advisor at Alpha Patrimoine. He also has a background in private banking, having worked at institutions such as ING and Puilaetco Dewaay Private Bankers.
fund.title: Essentia Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate
fund.description: Essentia Family Office is an independent multi-family office based in Lugano, Switzerland, founded in 2009. It provides strategic wealth management, estate planning, and advisory services to an international clientele. In early 2023, LFG Holding SA acquired a qualified stake in the firm, an acquisition approved by the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA).
fund.thesis: Essentia's investment philosophy centers on establishing deep, long-term relationships with clients to holistically manage their private wealth, family continuity, and business dynamics. The firm acts as a single, independent point of reference, defining tailored strategies and coordinating complex needs across accounting, legal, tax, and corporate advisory. Their approach involves intervening on both the financial and the family/emotional fronts to achieve strategic objectives.

poc.role: Partner and Co-Head of Private Investments
poc.description: Brian Stern is a Partner and Co-Head of Private Investments at Declaration Partners, where he concentrates on investments in financial services and financial technology. Prior to joining Declaration in 2019, he was the Head of Strategic Investments for Stone Ridge Asset Management. His previous experience includes serving as a Managing Director and Head of BlackRock Private Markets for eight years, and a role in the US Treasury on the Presidential Task Force on the Auto Industry. Earlier in his career, he was a Director at Merrill Lynch Global Private Equity, an Engagement Manager at McKinsey & Co., and an Analyst at Smith Barney.

fund.thesis: Declaration Partners pursues a flexible investment strategy across various domains including Growth Equity, Real Estate, and Platform Companies, aiming to partner with entrepreneurs and like-minded investors to generate long-term value. Their real estate strategy often involves proprietary joint ventures and preferred equity positions to provide downside protection while capturing upside.

fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Eton Advisors is an independent multi-family office boutique serving ultra-high-net-worth families across North America. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of integrated services, including wealth structuring and investment consulting, aiming to combine the customized service of a single-family office with the economies of scale of a multi-family office. Founded by former executives from the UBS Multi-Family Office Group, Eton acts as a trusted partner to guide clients in designing and implementing multi-generational wealth strategies.
fund.thesis: Eton Advisors' investment philosophy is centered on a "Goals-Based" approach, which customizes portfolios to maximize the probability of achieving a client's specific, prioritized goals over multiple generations. The firm acts as a "manager of managers," employing an open architecture to select external investment managers and build tailored portfolios. For alternative investments like private equity, hedge funds, and real estate, Eton seeks top-tier active managers, while favoring passive strategies for efficient asset classes like large-cap equities.

poc.description: James Pryor formerly held the position of Chief Compliance Officer at Doliver Advisors, L.P., a role he started in April 2021. Prior to this, he was the Chief Operating Officer at AltruVista and held multiple positions at Vanguard. According to available information, he is currently the Regional Manager at Corient and President of Archon Consultants LLC. He holds an MBA and a Master of Science in Finance from the Fox School of Business at Temple University.
fund.title: Doliver Advisors LP
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; growth-capital; real-estate
fund.description: Doliver Advisors LP is an SEC-registered investment advisory firm headquartered in Houston, Texas, established in 1988. The firm specializes in quantitative investment strategies, particularly focusing on closed-end funds, alongside comprehensive wealth management and private equity opportunities. As of December 2024, the firm managed approximately $615 million in assets on a discretionary basis for a diverse client base that includes high-net-worth individuals, corporations, and pension plans.
fund.thesis: Doliver Advisors' core investment thesis revolves around a quantitative strategy focused on the closed-end fund (CEF) niche, aiming to capitalize on inefficiencies in discounts and premiums to Net Asset Value (NAV). For growth-oriented investments, the firm seeks to buy high-quality companies in attractive industries with long-term, secular growth opportunities that are disrupting existing business models and feature predictable, recurring revenue streams. The firm also provides clients with access to private equity and alternative investments to offer diversification from public markets and potentially higher income opportunities.

poc.description: Robert L. Riedl is the President and CEO of Endowment Wealth Management, Inc., where he also serves as the Director of Family Wealth Management services. With over 40 years of professional experience, his career began at Arthur Andersen & Co. after which he founded and presided over Fox Valley Spring Company and Oak-Bay Corporation. For a decade, from 2003 to 2013, he was the Director of Wealth Management at Sumnicht & Associates, LLC. Mr. Riedl earned his Bachelor's Degree from Marquette University with a double major in Accounting and Finance and holds CPA, CFP®, and AWMA® designations.

fund.description: Legacy Star Capital Partners, founded in 2016, is a generalist multi-family office and private equity firm based in Austin, Texas. The firm focuses on private debt and equity investments across a range of sectors. It operates as a Registered Investment Adviser (RIA).
fund.thesis: Legacy Star Capital Partners seeks to invest through both debt and equity in companies operating in the energy, real estate, infrastructure, manufacturing, specialty finance, and technology sectors. The firm is a generalist investor and is actively seeking new investment opportunities. Its geographic focus includes North America, with a specific emphasis on acquiring assets throughout the continental United States.

poc.description: Danielle Udland is a Vice President at Declaration Partners LP. Her previous experience includes roles in fundraising and investor relations at Apollo Global Management from 2019 to 2022 and in investment marketing at JP Morgan from 2016 to 2019. She also served as a Peer Career Coach at the University of Michigan Stephen M. Ross School of Business.
fund.title: Private Equity, Growth Equity, Platforms,
fund.sectors: private-equity; growth-capital; real-estate; venture-capital; fintech; healthcare; software; ai-ml; consumer
fund.description: Declaration Partners is a private investment firm founded in 2017, backed by the family office of David M. Rubenstein, co-founder of The Carlyle Group. The firm combines an institutional investment approach with a flexible, long-term family office perspective. Declaration Partners focuses on private equity, growth equity, real estate, and GP solutions, investing across various sectors.
fund.thesis: Declaration Partners seeks to partner with entrepreneurs, operators, and family-owned businesses to build sustainable, long-term value. Their strategy is opportunistic and flexible, encompassing growth equity investments in capital-efficient companies, building platform businesses in enduring sectors, and real estate investments. The firm leverages its global network and deep sector expertise to identify and support its portfolio companies, with a primary geographic focus on the United States.

poc.description: Laust Johnsen is the Chief Executive Officer at Friheden Invest, a role he assumed in January 2023. Prior to this, he had a long and significant tenure of over 15 years at Capital Four, a Danish credit boutique he joined at its inception in 2007. At Capital Four, he held various key positions including Partner, Portfolio Manager, head of trading, and interim chief operating officer. His career in finance began at Nordea Investment Management, where he worked as a quantitative analyst focusing on risk management and performance analysis.
fund.title: Friheden Invest
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; consumer; retail; software; fintech
fund.description: Friheden Invest is a single family office founded by Niels Martinsen, the founder of the Scandinavian fashion house IC Group. Established in 1969 in Copenhagen, the firm has a long history rooted in the fashion and lifestyle industry. Following the delisting of IC Group from the stock exchange in 2019, Friheden Invest now wholly owns the brands Tiger of Sweden and By Malene Birger, and also manages a diversified portfolio of direct investments and fund investments.
fund.thesis: Friheden Invest primarily focuses on direct venture and growth stage investments within the lifestyle sector, leveraging its deep industry experience. The firm takes an active role in its portfolio companies, providing strategic support and operational expertise. While their direct investments are concentrated in the lifestyle and fashion sectors, they also manage a broader portfolio across various funds and asset classes.

fund.description: Garland Capital Group is a private investment firm founded in 2012 and based in Chicago, Illinois. The firm specializes in growth-focused equity investments, primarily targeting high-growth companies. Garland Capital Group invests in a wide range of sectors, including B2B, B2C, information technology, fintech, infrastructure, manufacturing, and digital media.
fund.thesis: Garland Capital Group focuses on investing in high-growth companies at the Seed, Series A, and Series B stages. The firm seeks to facilitate the launch of industry-disrupting products and services in traditional markets and provides not just financial backing but also strategic support and mentorship to its portfolio companies. Their investment focus is primarily on companies based in the United States.

poc.description: Christian Hammes is the founder and Managing Director (Geschäftsführer) of Eta Family Office GmbH, which he established in 2015. He specializes in providing strategic consulting, controlling, and risk management services to families, foundations, and institutions. His prior experience includes serving as a board member at Do Investment AG, and roles in wealth management at BHF-BANK AG and Dresdner Bank AG, after beginning his career in capital market analysis.
fund.title: Eta Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; private-debt
fund.description: Eta Family Office is a multi-family office founded in 2015 by Christian Hammes, based in Munich, Germany. The firm provides strategic asset management, controlling, and risk management services to an exclusive clientele of entrepreneurs who have sold their businesses, family groups, single-family offices, foundations, and institutional investors. Eta Family Office utilizes a proprietary analytical tool called "EtaAnalytics" for financial stress testing and portfolio analysis.
fund.thesis: Eta Family Office's investment thesis centers on providing a holistic and forward-looking approach to asset management for its clients. Their strategy involves developing individual, long-term asset strategies that encompass secular and strategic asset allocation, as well as sustainability and impact investing principles. The firm emphasizes a data-driven and institutionally-oriented approach, focusing on transparency and independent advisory to coordinate and oversee all economic and operational aspects of their clients' wealth.

poc.description: Erik Brandberg is a Partner and Investment Manager at Gullspång Invest, a Swedish family office he manages alongside his brothers, Gustaf and Magnus Brandberg. The firm, founded by their father Christer Brandberg, focuses on long-term investments in sectors such as energy, food, water, health, and resource efficiency. Erik is part of the investment team that directs the family's capital towards entrepreneurial teams addressing significant global challenges.
fund.title: Gullspang Invest
fund.sectors: impact-investing; cleantech; energy; consumer; healthtech; education; software; saas; biotech; venture-capital
fund.description: Gullspång Invest is a Stockholm-based single family office founded in 2010 by Christer Brandberg and his sons. The firm is an impact-investing fund that partners with entrepreneurs to address significant global challenges by transforming fundamental systems into more sustainable states. A key milestone for the firm was the establishment of Gullspång Re:food in 2021 to focus specifically on investments within the food system.
fund.thesis: Gullspång Invest employs a long-term, value-oriented investment philosophy, prioritizing sustainable value creation over short-term exits. They seek to partner with purpose-driven entrepreneurs who are developing commercially viable solutions in sectors such as food, energy, and clean tech. The firm invests across various stages, from pre-seed to Series C, with a typical investment size starting from approximately $3 million.

poc.description: Randall S. Winters is the Founder and Principal of E.L.K. Capital Advisors, a role he has held since 2005. With over 25 years of experience in financing and advisory, his expertise includes working with private equity funds on buyout financing, recapitalization, and fundraising. Prior to founding E.L.K. Capital, Mr. Winters was a senior member of the Financial Sponsors Investment Banking Group at Deutsche Bank and its predecessors, Bankers Trust and BT Alex. Brown. He holds a BSBA from the Boston University School of Management and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
fund.title: ELK Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; private-debt
fund.description: Founded in 2005, E.L.K. Capital Advisors is a Chicago-based boutique advisory firm and registered broker-dealer. The firm specializes in debt and equity capital raising, institutional fund placement, and M&A advisory services for privately held businesses and fund managers. E.L.K. Capital Advisors serves clients across private equity, private credit, venture capital, and real estate sectors.
fund.thesis: E.L.K. Capital Advisors' strategy centers on leveraging its long-term relationships with a broad network of institutional investors to secure optimal capital partners for its clients. The firm focuses on late-stage VC, growth capital, LBO, and acquisition financing, working closely with privately held companies, transaction sponsors, and spin-out fund managers. Their approach is high-touch and deeply involved, often working on a single fund placement at a time to ensure dedicated attention and successful execution.

poc.description: Emilie Martinsen-Kønigsfeldt is the Chairman of Friheden Invest A/S, the family office founded by her father, Niels Martinsen, who also founded IC Group. In 2023, she took over the chairmanship and completed the succession of the company by acquiring 100% of the ownership and voting rights. Previously, she pursued a career in professional show jumping for many years before rejoining the family business. In addition to her role at Friheden Invest, she is also the owner and creative director of the fashion brand By Malene Birger and founded the health clinic Apogii Clinic in London.
fund.title: Friheden Invest
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; consumer; retail; ecommerce; technology; software; fintech
fund.description: Friheden Invest is a single family office founded by Niels Martinsen, the founder of the Scandinavian fashion conglomerate IC Group. Established in conjunction with the long history of IC Group, which dates back to 1969, Friheden Invest now manages a diverse portfolio of investments in various funds and asset classes. Following the delisting of IC Group in 2019, Friheden Invest became the sole owner of the remaining brands, Tiger of Sweden and By Malene Birger, and actively pursues direct investments in high-growth companies.
fund.thesis: Friheden Invest primarily focuses on direct investments in companies within the lifestyle, fashion, and consumer goods sectors at the venture and growth stages. The firm seeks to take an active role in its portfolio companies, leveraging its extensive industry experience, operational expertise, and strategic relationships to support growth. While specific financial criteria are not publicly disclosed, their approach targets businesses with strong brand potential and scalable models, with a geographical focus on Northern and Western Europe.

poc.description: Arild Johansen currently holds the position of Partner at Thunissen, an asset management firm. Further details regarding his professional background, specific responsibilities, and career history are not publicly available.
fund.title: Thunissen

poc.description: Tucker Donahue serves as a Portfolio Manager at GFG Capital, where he oversees the firm's investment process and philosophy to construct client portfolios. He has been in the financial services industry since 2011 and joined GFG Capital in 2014. Prior to GFG Capital, he was a member of the investment teams at ZPR Portfolio Management and KCM Asset Management. Mr. Donahue holds a B.B.A in Finance and Financial Management Services from Stetson University and is a CFA Charterholder.
fund.title: GFG Capital
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate; private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; technology; software
fund.description: GFG Capital is a multi-family office founded in 2003 by brothers Eduardo and Mauricio Gruener in Miami, Florida. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management, financial advisory, and family office services to high-net-worth clients. GFG Capital is a Registered Investment Adviser (RIA) with the SEC and emphasizes a family-focused approach to wealth preservation and growth.
fund.thesis: GFG Capital's investment philosophy centers on creating customized, long-term investment strategies tailored to individual client goals and risk tolerance. Their approach emphasizes downside protection through optimal asset allocation and cost-efficient implementation, utilizing a blend of mutual funds, ETFs, and occasionally independent managers. The firm seeks to invest in assets that align with global trends such as digitalization and societal changes, with a focus on the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean for its real estate activities.

poc.description: Chris Evdaimon is an Investment Manager in the Private Companies team at Baillie Gifford, where he leads the on-the-ground presence in the San Francisco Bay Area. He has approximately 20 years of experience in entrepreneurship and early-stage investments. His prior roles include being a Partner at Sinovation Ventures for 10 years, a Managing Partner at Eastern Bell Venture Capital, and the CEO of ICDL Asia. He holds a M.Eng. in Mechanical Engineering from Imperial College in London and an MBA from INSEAD.
fund.title: Eudaimonia Capital
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; healthcare; consumer; enterprise-software; ai-ml; manufacturing; aerospace; transportation; agriculture; fintech; real-estate; media
fund.description: Eudaimonia Capital Pte. Ltd. is a seed-stage investment firm that applies the ancient Greek principle of 'Eudaimonia'—a life of activity in accordance with reason—to its investment philosophy. The firm is led by Chris Evdaimon, an investor with 20 years of experience in early-stage ventures, previously a Partner at Sinovation Ventures. Eudaimonia Capital focuses on technology-driven companies across a wide range of sectors.
fund.thesis: The firm operates as a seed-stage investor, focusing on technology companies that align with its core principle of 'Eudaimonia'. While no specific ticket size is disclosed, its portfolio indicates a global geographic focus, with investments in North America, Europe, and Asia. The founder's background suggests a particular interest in industrial automation, robotics, and edtech, which is reflected in the firm's diverse portfolio.

poc.description: Pierre Lamunière serves as the Chairman of Edipresse Group, a role he has held since 1998. He began his career with the company in 1977 and was later appointed CEO in 1986. His career includes numerous directorships, having served as a Director of La Poste, Chairman of the Management Board of the Fédération Internationale de la Presse Périodique (FIPP), and a board member for Banque Cantonale Vaudoise (BCV) and Tamedia AG. Mr. Lamunière earned his undergraduate degree from the University of Lausanne and holds an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
fund.title: Edipresse
fund.sectors: media; real-estate; ecommerce; consumer
fund.description: Edipresse is a Swiss family investment office with a history dating back to 1907. Originally a major player in media and publishing, the Lamunière family took the company private in 2011 to transform it into a family office. Today, Edipresse's main activities are concentrated in media, particularly through its Tatler Asia brand, real estate investments primarily in Switzerland, and digital ventures.
fund.thesis: Edipresse focuses on long-term value creation by investing in high-potential markets with the goal of achieving leadership positions in each activity. Their strategy involves reinforcing their position in digital media and e-commerce, particularly in the luxury and lifestyle sectors in Asia. The firm actively supports and invests in promising digital ventures that align with their established media and consumer-focused portfolio.

poc.description: Peter Valk is a Partner and one of the founders of F&F Family Office, a firm he has been with since 2000. His professional background includes studies in law in Leiden and economics in Tilburg, which he leverages in his role as a family officer. Prior to his current role, he worked at Van Lanschot Bankiers, where he was the director of the family office.
fund.title: F&F Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; public-markets; fixed-income
fund.description: F&F Family Office is a multi-family office based in Vlijmen, Netherlands, founded in 2000. The firm operates as an independent consultancy, specializing in providing a range of financial services to high-net-worth families. F&F aims to unburden families by overseeing their capital, liaising with their financial contacts, and assisting with various financial choices.
fund.thesis: F&F Family Office's investment approach is purely advisory and independent, as they do not sell their own investment products. Their strategy is to help families find the right investment balance across various asset classes like stocks, bonds, and real estate, tailored to the family's goals and risk tolerance. The firm acts as a central coordinator for their clients' specialists, providing customized financial advice and services that also include administration and estate settlement.

poc.description: Thomas Holt is a founder and the Managing Partner/President of Global Trust Wealth Management, LLC, where he has accumulated nearly 20 years of experience in the financial services industry. His responsibilities include overseeing portfolio and cash management, designing intricate investment strategies, securities trading, and client relationship management. Holt holds several professional designations including Certified Public Accountant (CPA) and Personal Financial Specialist (PFS), and has a Master of Liberal Arts in Finance from Harvard University and a Master of Professional Accountancy from Clemson University.
fund.title: Global Trust Asset Management
fund.description: Global Trust Asset Management, LLC is an independent Registered Investment Advisor founded in 2007. The firm provides a range of financial services including investment management, financial planning, and tax and estate solutions for individuals, families, trusts, and corporations. As a fee-only firm, they do not accept commissions, aiming to align their interests with those of their clients, for whom they have a fiduciary responsibility.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy centers on diversification, active asset allocation, and a disciplined approach to managing risk and taxes. They construct individualized portfolios based on the client's specific goals, risk tolerance, and financial situation, believing that asset mix is the primary determinant of performance. Their strategy involves using both passive and active approaches, focusing on low-cost investing to maximize returns while managing portfolio volatility.

poc.description: Peter Pauley is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of (qp) global family offices, a firm that manages investments and family offices for a select group of families. He has over 30 years of experience in financial services. Prior to founding (qp) global in 2017, he was the CIO and COO of Seven Valleys, a single-family office. His earlier career includes roles as a Senior Vice President at The Capital Group, a portfolio manager at two registered investment advisors, and senior positions at Bankers Trust in Hong Kong and New York. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School and a BA from Duke University.
fund.title: global family offices
fund.sectors: private-equity; biotech; healthcare; public-markets; technology; consumer
fund.description: QP Global Family Offices, LLC is a multi-family office founded in 2017 by Peter Pauley and Brendan MacMillan. Headquartered in Greenwich, CT, the firm establishes and manages bespoke single-family office platforms for a select group of ultra-high-net-worth families. QP Global provides integrated services including investment management, strategic planning, governance, and risk management, acting as a private family office team for its clients.
fund.thesis: QP Global's strategy is to provide the benefits of a dedicated single-family office without the associated operational burdens, serving as a long-term, fully aligned partner to a few families. The firm invests directly across multiple asset classes and market cycles, focusing on tailored opportunities for substantial wealth preservation and growth. While specific sector focus is broad, their investment appetite includes buyouts and biotech/life sciences, with a primary geographic focus on North America.

fund.title: Gopher Asset
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; public-markets; fixed-income; hedge-funds; venture-capital
fund.description: Gopher Asset Management, established in 2010, is a wealth management firm and a subsidiary of Noah Holdings Limited, a prominent independent wealth management company in China. The firm provides a range of services including private equity, real estate, and wealth management to high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutional investors. Gopher Asset is recognized as one of China's first institutions to receive the "qualified private equity fund manager" certification from the Asset Management Association of China.
fund.thesis: Gopher Asset's investment strategy centers on a "multi-strategy, multi-style, multi-manager" approach, with a primary focus on Fund of Funds (FOF) products to achieve diversification and stable returns. The firm emphasizes asset allocation across various classes, including private equity, venture capital, real estate, and secondary market investments. Geographically, Gopher Asset focuses on investments in China and the United States, aiming to leverage cross-border opportunities.

poc.description: Randy Chappel serves as a Managing Director at Hersh Family Investments (HFI), a role he has held since 2004. Prior to his tenure at HFI, he was a partner at Rainwater Inc., the family office of Richard E. Rainwater, from 1990 to 2002. His earlier career included roles at Natural Gas Partners, Crescent Real Estate Equities, and Goff Moore Strategic Partners. Mr. Chappel earned both his A.B. in Economics in 1989 and his M.B.A. in 1994 from Stanford University, where he was recognized as an Arjay Miller Scholar.

fund.description: Hersh Family Investments (HFI) is a single-family office for the Kenneth A. Hersh family, headquartered in Dallas, Texas. Founded in 2004, HFI makes direct investments across a variety of sectors, including private equity, venture capital, and real estate. The firm leverages the extensive experience of its founder, Kenneth A. Hersh, who co-founded NGP Energy Capital Management, to deploy patient capital with a long-term perspective.
fund.thesis: HFI partners with proven management teams in growth-focused businesses that have strong cash flow potential and clear opportunities for value creation. The firm's strategy includes buy-and-build opportunities, early-to-late-stage growth capital, special situations, and formation capital, with a focus on long-term value. Geographically, their real estate investments are concentrated in Texas and other business-friendly states.

fund.description: Harbour Equity provides equity capital to experienced real estate developers throughout Canada. Founded in 2011 by Ari Silverberg, Paul Schachter, and Alan Winer, the firm utilizes flexible joint venture structures for both ground-up development and value-add opportunities. Since its inception, Harbour Equity has deployed over $300 million across more than 60 joint venture investments in over 20 Canadian cities. The firm operates through a series of funds, with its sixth fund, Harbour Equity JV Development Fund VI, completing an initial closing of $82.45 million in 2022.
fund.thesis: Harbour Equity's strategy is to provide flexible and patient equity to experienced developers, often investing at the early stages of a project, including at the time of land acquisition before zoning approvals are in place. They focus on joint ventures, preferred equity, and other hybrid structures for a wide range of asset classes, including residential (for-sale and rental), retail, office, industrial, senior housing, and self-storage. The firm targets investments in primary and strong secondary markets across Canada, partnering with developers who have a proven track record in the specific asset class and geographic area.

poc.description: Martin Gunhaga serves as an Investment Manager at Fort Knox, a Swedish single-family office focused on private investments. He joined the firm in 2011 and also holds the title of CIO. Prior to his current role, he spent 13 years in asset management at Handelsbanken, where his last positions were head of advisory asset management and equity trading in northern Sweden. He has extensive experience serving on boards of directors.

fund.description: Fort Knox is a family-owned investment company based in Umeå, Sweden, founded by entrepreneur Krister Olsson. The firm operates as a local growth engine, investing in small and medium-sized companies with strong ideas, primarily in the Umeå region. The company was established in 2005 and is now co-owned by Olsson's children, Markus and Johanna.
fund.thesis: Fort Knox focuses on being a long-term owner for unique entrepreneurs, whom they refer to as "local world champions." They invest across many different industries and company phases without a required exit strategy, leveraging their capital strength and extensive network to foster regional growth. As a small and agile firm, they pride themselves on short decision-making processes from idea to investment.

poc.description: Johanna Olsson is a Partner at Fort Knox, a family-owned investment company based in Sweden that focuses on investing in small and medium-sized enterprises. She is part of the founding family and, along with her father Krister Olsson and brother Markus Olsson, is actively involved in the family's philanthropic efforts through the Olsson and Olsson Foundation and the Fort Knox Foundation. These foundations have made significant donations to medical research at Umeå University. Her professional responsibilities also appear to extend to real estate development projects associated with the firm.

The firm provides a range of wealth management services, including financial advisory, risk management, and estate planning, primarily to high-net-worth families. fund.title: Harmony Family Office

They apply a rigorous risk policy approach to preserve financial freedom for their clients. While based in Europe, their investment network is primarily located in the United States to capitalize on financial innovation and emerging opportunities.

fund.description: Gopher Asset Management was established in March 2010 as a subsidiary of Noah Holdings Limited, a large independent wealth management company in China. fund.description: Harbour Equity Capital Corp. is a Canadian real estate private equity company founded in 2011 by Ari Silverberg, Paul Schachter, and Alan Winer. The firm provides equity capital to experienced real estate developers for new development and redevelopment projects across Canada. Since its inception, Harbour Equity has deployed over $300 million to more than 65 joint venture investments, creating an estimated $2.5 billion in real estate value.
fund.thesis: Harbour Equity focuses on mid-market investments, providing flexible equity solutions like traditional joint ventures and preferred equity to development partners. They invest in a broad range of commercial and residential asset classes, including residential (for-sale and rental), retail, industrial, office, senior housing, and self-storage. The firm often invests early, at the time of land acquisition before zoning approvals are in place, partnering with experienced developers in primary and strong secondary markets across Canada.

poc.description: Seb Calabro is the Chief Investment Officer for Granger Management LLC, where he serves a select number of institutional and private clients. His career began in 1991, and prior to his current role, he was the founder and managing member of CurAlea Associates LLC from 2010 to 2020. He holds a Master of Science in Financial Services from The American College and an undergraduate degree in History and Political Science from Connecticut College.
fund.title: Haviland & Sams LLC
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Haviland & Sams is an independent financial planning and advisory firm founded in 2003. Based in Farmington, Connecticut, the firm is a Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) dedicated to the preservation, protection, and growth of its clients' wealth. They provide comprehensive financial planning, tax planning, and risk management services primarily to individuals and families.
fund.thesis: The firm operates as a fiduciary, focusing on creating customized financial strategies based on a deep evaluation of their clients' needs, goals, and values. They serve a diverse client base, including professionals and business owners with complex financial situations, and are compensated directly by client fees rather than commissions to minimize conflicts of interest. Their services are geographically focused on the East Coast of the United States, with clients from Maine to Florida.

poc.description: Bill Hood is the Founder and Managing Member of Hall Capital Holdings, LLC, a family investment office he established in 2001. With over 38 years of operating, private equity, venture capital, and real estate investment experience, he is responsible for managing the firm's overall investment portfolio. Prior to Hall Capital, Bill Hood founded Special Data Processing Corp. in 1984. He has also served as an Independent Director for American Coastal Insurance Corp. and held director positions at United Insurance Holdings LC and United Property & Casualty Insurance Co.
fund.title: Hall Capital Holdings
fund.sectors: private-equity; manufacturing; consumer; retail; healthcare; technology; real-estate; financial-services; media; telecommunications; aerospace; defense; insurance; energy
fund.description: Hall Capital is a family-owned private investment company with roots dating back to 1920, founded by automotive pioneer Fred Jones. Headquartered in Oklahoma City, the firm is now led by Jones' grandsons and has a diversified portfolio of business interests. Hall Capital focuses on providing long-term, patient capital and partners with management teams to foster growth.
fund.thesis: Hall Capital employs a long-term, "buy and hold" investment strategy, seeking control investments in established, founder-led, middle-market businesses with a history of positive cash flow. They are sector-agnostic but have significant holdings in the automotive, real estate, and private investment sectors. Their approach is to act as a flexible, collaborative partner, valuing the legacy and culture of the companies they invest in over rapid restructuring or fixed exit timelines.

fund.title: Haas
fund.sectors: Residential Real estate
fund.description: Harbour Equity Capital Corp. is a Toronto-based firm founded in 2011 that provides equity capital to experienced real estate developers across Canada. Part of The Harbour Group, the company invests in ground-up development and value-add opportunities through flexible structures like joint ventures and preferred equity. Since its inception, Harbour Equity has invested in over 65 projects, which are estimated to comprise over $2.5 billion in real estate value upon completion.
fund.thesis: Harbour Equity focuses on providing flexible and patient equity solutions to developers, often investing at the early stages of a project, including at the time of land acquisition before zoning approvals are secured. The firm partners with experienced developers in primary and strong secondary markets throughout Canada, investing across various asset classes including residential, retail, office, industrial, and student housing. Their investment strategy targets mid-market opportunities, enabling partners to leverage their own equity and scale their operations.

poc.description: Patrick Horsman is an American entrepreneur and investor serving as the Managing Partner of Horsman Holdings, a single family office focused on alternative investments. His career began after graduating from the University of Arizona in 2002, when he co-founded Blue Sand Securities, a placement agent for alternative investment funds. He also co-founded and was the COO of Merion Investment Management, a litigation finance fund, and is the Managing Partner and Co-Founder of Coral Capital, which focuses on decentralized finance and cryptocurrency.
fund.title: Horsman Holdings
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; venture-capital; technology; agriculture; insurance; financial-services; crypto-blockchain
fund.description: Horsman Holdings is a single-family office for the Horsman Family, founded in 2008 and headquartered in Miami Beach. The firm manages assets for the family's trusts, foundations, and insurance entities, investing primarily in alternative investments. Managed by Patrick Horsman, the office focuses on a diverse range of sectors including hedge funds, private equity, real estate, and venture capital.
fund.thesis: Horsman Holdings' investment thesis centers on identifying and investing in esoteric, niche strategies that are likely to produce uncorrelated returns. The firm is sector-agnostic but shows a preference for litigation, agriculture, insurance, technology, and digital assets. This approach reflects a focus on discovering highly specialized investments that possess a sustainable competitive advantage.

poc.description: Patrick Lenouvel is the founder and principal portfolio manager at Japa International, where he specializes in discretionary investment management for high-net-worth clients, families, and pension funds. He has been involved in the development of the firm since its beginning. His career includes teaching corporate finance, securities analysis, and financial institutions at SFU, Rotman School of Management, and the University of Toronto. Mr. Lenouvel holds a PED from IMD in Switzerland and a Master in Finance from Texas A&M, and is a past President of the CFA Society Ottawa.
fund.title: Japa International
fund.sectors: financial-services; fixed-income
fund.description: JAPA International is a boutique investment management firm that provides personalized portfolio and investment management services. It specializes in discretionary investment management for high-net-worth individuals, families, and pension funds. The firm was founded by Patrick Lenouvel, who serves as the principal portfolio manager. Japa International Ltd was incorporated on October 8, 2015.
fund.thesis: JAPA International employs a global, absolute-return, and value-based approach to manage risk and enhance portfolio performance. The firm utilizes a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to select and invest in securities, focusing on both fixed income and equities. Their fee structure is value-oriented, with lower fees on fixed income assets and performance-based fees for returns exceeding a 15% hurdle rate.

poc.description: Matthew Salloway is the Chief Executive Officer of GSI Ventures, a global family office, where he focuses on venture capital and portfolio market expansion into the MENA region. He is also the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of SIP Global Partners, an international venture fund investing in global technology companies. Previously, Mr. Salloway was the Founder and Managing Partner of the Salloway Law Group PC and an associate at O'Melveny & Myers LLP. He holds a law degree from the University of Pennsylvania Law School and a Bachelor of Arts from Brandeis University, where he graduated Magna Cum Laude.
fund.title: GSI Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; real-estate; consumer; retail; entertainment; private-equity; cleantech; media
fund.description: GSI Ventures is a single-family office founded in 2015, representing the Al Saud family. With a presence in New York and Riyadh, the firm focuses on managing the family's capital with an emphasis on early-stage technology investments. GSI, standing for Growth, Sustainability, and Integrity, aims to act as a strategic bridge for its portfolio companies, facilitating their expansion between North America and the Middle East.
fund.thesis: GSI Ventures invests globally across multiple asset classes with a primary focus on venture capital in the technology sector. The firm seeks to be a strategic partner to its portfolio companies, not just an investor, by helping them penetrate the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region. They look for best-in-class technologies that can have a significant impact, with stated interests in areas such as the 5G economy, autonomous driving, and workplace safety technology.

He is also an active investor and has numerous publications and appearances at conferences such as WallStreet. His prior experience includes co-founding and serving as CEO of Invest Help.

fund.title: Evolve Family Office

fund.description: Evolve Family Office is a multi-family office based in Singapore, established in 2019. The firm provides wealth management solutions and invests in a range of financial instruments. Its principal activity is registered as management consultancy services.
fund.thesis: Evolve Family Office invests in public markets and fixed-income securities, including equities, bonds, structured products, and financial derivatives. The firm's investment philosophy emphasizes strong risk control to deliver high alpha for all investments in the shortest possible time.

poc.description: Seth Johnson was most recently the Chief Executive Officer of IPGL, the family office of billionaire Michael Spencer, a role he was appointed to in January 2024 and stepped down from in August 2025. He has had a long-standing professional relationship with Lord Spencer, working with him for approximately 30 years. Prior to his CEO role at IPGL, Johnson was the CEO of Nex Markets, the electronic execution division of NEX Group, and also held the position of Global Head of Strategy at ICAP. His experience also includes holding non-executive positions in investment, trading, and technology firms.
fund.title: IPGL Holding
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; financial-services; fintech; healthtech; cleantech; saas; energy; insurance
fund.description: IPGL Holding is a single-family office founded in 1986 to manage the wealth of billionaire Michael Spencer, derived from the creation and sale of inter-dealer broker ICAP and NEX Group. Based in London, the firm operates as a privately owned holding company, investing across a diverse range of sectors. IPGL is recognized as one of the largest family offices in the UK.
fund.thesis: IPGL's investment strategy centers on partnering with experienced management teams to cultivate fast-growing businesses, with a long-term objective of developing them into industry leaders. The firm deploys patient capital across various stages, from venture and growth equity to private credit and real assets, with a significant focus on the financial services sector. They primarily focus on investments within the United Kingdom.

poc.role: Managing Partner and Chief Operating Officer
poc.description: Betsy Duff is a Managing Partner and the Chief Operating Officer at Harbour Capital Advisors, bringing over 25 years of experience in private and investment banking and corporate finance. From 2001 to 2011, she was a Private Client Advisor at U.S. Trust, Bank of America Private Wealth Management. Prior to that, she worked in Banc of America Securities' Global Project Finance unit and in Global Corporate Finance. She earned her B.A. from Brown University.
fund.title: Harbour Capital Advisors
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; public-markets; technology; software; healthcare; consumer
fund.description: Harbour Capital Advisors is an independent, fee-only multi-family office founded in 2011 and based in Tysons Corner, Virginia. The firm provides holistic wealth planning, investment management, and personalized family office services to a select group of high-net-worth families and their charitable organizations. Acting as a fiduciary, the firm serves as a dedicated point of contact for all aspects of a family's financial affairs, positioning itself as a wealth guardian and trusted counselor.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy centers on active management, employing a combination of top-down macroeconomic analysis and bottom-up security evaluation to build customized portfolios. This approach allows for tactical investments to capture near-term opportunities while maintaining a long-term focus on tax efficiency and risk mitigation. Their investment philosophy utilizes a mix of public securities and private investment opportunities to preserve and grow client wealth.

fund.title: Kalodion GmbH
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; real-estate; impact-investing
fund.description: Kalodion GmbH is a single family office based in Berlin, Germany, founded in 2019 by entrepreneur David Zimmer following the sale of his company, inexio. The firm actively invests in venture capital, private equity, and real estate, with a declared focus on sustainability and a long-term investment horizon. Kalodion is recognized as one of the more active venture capital single family investors in Germany and also engages in philanthropic activities.
fund.thesis: Kalodion's investment strategy centers on supporting promising start-ups and established companies with growth potential, alongside investments in exceptional real estate. The firm operates with the values and approach of a family business, emphasizing a long-term, stakeholder-oriented perspective. In its venture capital activities, Kalodion primarily focuses on seed-stage startups in Germany across a diverse range of sectors, from consumer to high-tech industries.

poc.description: Dennis Rosario is the Vice President of Asset Management at The Swig Company, where he is responsible for due diligence on new acquisitions and managing various properties within the company's portfolio. With over 25 years of experience in commercial real estate, his specializations include asset management, financial analysis, and sustainable building practices. Prior to joining The Swig Company in 2014, he served as Director of Asset Services for CBRE and held portfolio and financial management roles at Cushman and Wakefield. Mr. Rosario earned a Bachelor of Science degree from St. Mary's College and an MBA from Golden Gate University.
fund.title: The Swig Company
fund.sectors: real-estate
fund.description: The Swig Company, LLC is a privately owned real estate investment firm based in San Francisco with a history of investment, development, and management of commercial properties in major U.S. markets. Founded in 1936 by Benjamin Swig, the company has a long-term investment perspective and initially gained renown for establishing the Fairmont Hotel brand. Today, the firm's diversified portfolio consists of over seven million square feet of office buildings and other commercial properties.
fund.thesis: The Swig Company's investment strategy focuses on acquiring and adding value to commercial real estate assets through proactive asset management, redevelopment, and professional property management. They seek office and multifamily investment opportunities, particularly undervalued or underperforming properties where they can apply their expertise to maximize value. The firm primarily targets core urban markets in the San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles County, and Seattle, with asset values between $30 million and $200 million.

fund.description: Helms Family Office is a specialized Swiss-based multi-family office and alternative asset manager located in Geneva. The firm positions itself as an atypical manager that deviates from traditional investment methodologies to remain fluid and adapt to changing financial markets. They focus on building long-term partnerships with clients by providing customized, discreet, and efficient solutions for wealth planning, asset management, and other family office services.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on robust risk management and a diversified, adaptable approach across private equity, venture capital, and real estate. In private equity, they invest across the full spectrum from venture to buyouts, seeking to add value by providing capital and operational support to strong management teams in the EMEA region. For early-stage ventures, they focus on sectors like Life Sciences, AI/ML, Fintech, and Energy, while their real estate strategy is predominantly Pan-European with a focus on major markets like Germany, the UK, and Switzerland.

fund.title: HF Capital
fund.sectors: energy; infrastructure; sustainable-finance; impact-investing; insurance
fund.description: HF Capital is the single-family office for the Haslam family of Tennessee, founders of the Pilot Company. Established in 2020 and based in Knoxville, the firm manages the multi-generational wealth derived from the family's business endeavors. HF Capital deploys evergreen capital globally through direct investments in operating companies and commitments to investment managers across various asset classes.
fund.thesis: HF Capital's investment strategy focuses on a globally diversified portfolio with a significant emphasis on the energy sector, including both traditional and renewable sources, as well as infrastructure. The firm partners with long-term operators and makes direct investments and fund commitments, recently committing up to $725 million to a strategy focused on decarbonizing conventional energy assets. Their portfolio includes ventures in energy, insurance, and food production, reflecting a broad, multi-asset class approach.

poc.description: Thomas S. Kim is the Managing Partner and Chief Investment Officer at Harbour Capital Advisors, LLC, with over 25 years of experience in the investment management and financial services industry. poc.description: Matti Rönkkö serves as the Head of Kiilto Ventures, the venture capital arm of the Finnish family-owned company Kiilto. In his role, he is responsible for investing in and supporting early-stage startups focused on the sustainable built environment. His previous career experience includes a position at Rocket Internet, where he gained insights into speed, scale, and company culture. At Kiilto Ventures, he combines family capital with industry expertise to back innovations in areas such as decarbonization, circularity, and construction inefficiency.
fund.title: Kiilto Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; impact-investing; cleantech; manufacturing; software; technology; real-estate; consumer
fund.description: Kiilto Ventures is the corporate venture capital arm and family office of Kiilto, a Finnish family-owned company with a long history in manufacturing chemicals for construction, industry, and professional hygiene. Founded in 2019, the firm invests in early-stage startups that are innovating and disrupting the built environment. Kiilto Ventures aims to collaborate with and support startups that offer sustainable solutions and can potentially partner with the Kiilto Group's core businesses.
fund.thesis: Kiilto Ventures invests in early-stage startups (pre-seed and seed) that are developing solutions to make the built environment more sustainable for people and the planet. They focus on companies innovating in circular and sustainable materials, hardware and software for construction and operations, and creating healthier, more resilient spaces. Their initial ticket size ranges from €100,000 to €500,000, with a primary geographic focus on the Nordics and Baltics, while also co-investing across Europe.

fund.title: Hilshaw Group
fund.sectors: real-estate; aerospace; sustainable-finance; agriculture; fintech; technology
fund.description: Hilshaw Group is a Dubai-based multi-family office and investment advisory firm. The group is involved in investment management, real estate financing, and development funding for large-scale projects. A notable milestone for the company was its 2023 diversification into the aviation industry through a strategic joint venture in aircraft leasing. The firm has also gained recognition for its role as the exclusive advisor and financial consultant for major sustainable smart city projects in Kenya and Albania.
fund.thesis: Hilshaw Group's investment thesis is centered on diversification as a primary growth strategy, aiming to make strategic investments that provide significant returns for its stakeholders. The firm focuses on opportunities in low supply and finite real estate, as well as sustainable and environmentally friendly projects. Their geographic focus includes the UAE, with a significant allocation towards real estate to support remote work visas, and emerging markets such as Kenya and Albania for large-scale infrastructure projects.

poc.description: Thomas Spencer is an Investment Director at IPGL Holding. He also holds the position of Director at IPGL (HOLDINGS) LIMITED, a role to which he was appointed on January 1, 2020. His full name is recorded as Thomas George Spencer in official filings. Further details on his professional career history are not readily available in the public domain.
fund.title: IPGL Holding
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; financial-services; insurance; energy; healthtech; healthcare
fund.description: IPGL Holding is the private holding company and single-family office of Lord Michael Spencer, founded in 1986. It is known for founding and developing ICAP plc, which later became NEX Group, a major financial technology and brokerage firm. A key milestone was the sale of NEX Group to CME Group in 2018 for £3.9 billion, a significant event in the financial services industry.
fund.thesis: IPGL partners with experienced management teams to build fast-growing businesses with a long-term perspective, particularly in the financial services, technology, and energy sectors. The firm engages in both private equity and venture capital, deploying patient capital across various stages from seed to growth equity. Geographically, IPGL's investment focus is primarily on the United Kingdom.

poc.description: Bob Levine is the Founder and Managing Partner of L2 Capital Partners, where he serves as the firm's coach and senior investment advisor. He founded L2 Capital in 2011 to invest his personal capital in private transactions. Prior to L2 Capital, Bob co-founded Milestone Partners in 1995 and helped build it into a successful buyout firm. His earlier career included executing middle-market M&A transactions at Lehman Brothers and other investment banks, as well as practicing business law. Bob holds a B.A. from Northwestern University, a J.D. from George Washington University, and an M.B.A. with distinction from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.
fund.title: L2 Capital Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; technology; healthcare; consumer; manufacturing; ecommerce; financial-services
fund.description: L2 Capital Partners is a private equity firm founded in 2011 that specializes in making controlling investments in lower middle-market, founder-led companies. The firm is known for its hands-on, operational approach to driving growth in its portfolio companies, inspired by lean principles. L2 Capital focuses on businesses at an inflection point where their expertise can accelerate market share gain.
fund.thesis: L2 Capital's investment thesis centers on partnering with founder-led, niche businesses with untapped potential for rapid and lasting growth. They seek companies with annual revenues between $15 million and $150 million and EBITDA between $4 million and $15 million. The firm's geographic focus is on North America, and they primarily execute majority buyout transactions.

poc.role: Vice President and Chief Investment Officer
poc.description: Ana Marshall is the Vice President and Chief Investment Officer for the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation, where she is responsible for asset allocation, strategic investment policy, and implementation of the foundation's multi-billion dollar endowment portfolio. Her career in investment began in 1986. Prior to joining the Hewlett Foundation in 2004, she was a Senior Portfolio Manager at RCM Capital Management and an analyst and portfolio manager at Bank of America. Ana graduated Magna Cum Laude from the University of San Diego with a degree in Economics and is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholder.
fund.title: Hewlett Foundation
fund.sectors: education; impact-investing; private-equity; public-markets
fund.description: The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation is a nonpartisan, private charitable foundation established in 1966 by Hewlett-Packard co-founder William R. Hewlett and his wife, Flora Lamson Hewlett. As one of the largest philanthropic institutions in the United States, it advances ideas and supports organizations globally to promote a better world. The foundation concentrates its significant grantmaking resources on solving social and environmental problems in areas including education, environment, global development and population, performing arts, and effective philanthropy.
fund.thesis: The foundation's investment strategy is centered on managing its endowment to produce strong, risk-adjusted returns that ensure the perpetuity of its grantmaking activities. The investment office focuses on a diversified portfolio and has historically allocated capital towards absolute return strategies to reduce volatility and correlation with public equity markets. While the foundation makes grants to solve societal problems, its endowment's primary goal is maximizing financial returns; former leadership has publicly argued that prioritizing social impact within the main investment portfolio over financial returns could be detrimental to the foundation's long-term mission.

poc.description: Andreas Casutt is a Director at Horizon21 AG and a Partner at the law firm Niederer Kraft Frey in Zurich, where he previously served as Managing Partner from 2006 to 2014. His legal practice focuses on corporate law, mergers & acquisitions, private equity, and employment law. In addition to his role at Horizon21, he holds several other board memberships, including Chairman of Siegfried Holding AG and Vice Chairman of Mikron Holding AG. He received his doctorate in law from the University of Zurich and an LL.M. from the University of Michigan.
fund.title: Horizon21
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; infrastructure; commodities; real-estate; private-debt; venture-capital
fund.description: Horizon21 is a single-family office based in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2004. It was established to manage the wealth of its founder, Swiss financier Rainer-Marc Frey, following the sale of his hedge-fund manager RMF Investment Group. The firm, which employs around 10 people, is privately owned by its founder and focuses on serving his and his family's needs.
fund.thesis: Horizon21 pursues a global, multi-asset investment strategy with a focus on alternative investments. The firm's approach combines venture, buyout, and private credit strategies, and it also specializes in fund of fund investments, targeting stages from seed to mature companies. The investment philosophy is centered on long-term wealth preservation and growth through a diversified, global portfolio.

poc.description: Antonio Luis Ferré Rangel is the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Kingbird Investment Management, the real estate subsidiary of Grupo Ferré Rangel. He is leading an expansion of the real estate business, focusing on growth, development, and the integration of new technologies. His career began in 1992 at Puerto Rican Cement, where he held several executive positions, including President and Chief Operations Officer. He holds a Master's in Business Administration from Suffolk University and a B.S. in Natural Science from Sacred Heart University.
fund.title: Kingbird Investment Management
fund.sectors: real-estate; impact-investing
fund.description: Kingbird Investment Management is the independent real estate investment management subsidiary of the fourth-generation Ferré Rangel family office. Founded in 2008, the firm serves as a fiduciary for global family offices, institutional, and high-net-worth investors, investing its own capital alongside them. Kingbird focuses on creating sustainable value and has invested in over 20,000 multifamily units with a Gross Asset Value of approximately $4.0 billion as of December 31, 2024. In April 2025, one of its funds, Kingbird Co-Investment Venture, LP, was recognized by Preqin as a top-performing private real estate fund for vintage years 2017–2022.
fund.thesis: Kingbird employs a research-driven and cycle-resilient investment strategy, focusing on the strongest risk-adjusted opportunities in supply-constrained U.S. growth markets. The firm invests across the capital stack—including LP, GP, Co-GP, preferred equity, and mezzanine positions—in multifamily housing to mitigate risk and capture upside potential. They target value-add Class "B" properties catering to young professionals and essential workers, as well as distressed assets in high-growth regions with supply constraints.

poc.description: Nicolas Ferretjans serves as a Director at Horizon21 AG, a single family office based in Zurich, Switzerland. In his capacity, he is involved in the firm's private investment activities. Horizon21 was established in 2004 to manage the assets of its founder and family.
fund.title: Horizon21
fund.sectors: private-equity; commodities; hedge-funds; real-estate
fund.description: Horizon21 AG is a single-family office headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2004. The firm was established to manage the wealth of its founder, Swiss financier Rainer-Marc Frey, and his family. Horizon21 has evolved from a private equity platform to a comprehensive multi-asset investment firm with a focus on long-term wealth preservation and alternative investment strategies.
fund.thesis: Horizon21 pursues global alternative investments, combining venture, buyout, private credit, and liquid strategies. The firm specializes in fund of fund investments and seeks opportunities across various stages, from seed and startup to mature buyouts. Their investment approach is characterized by a diversified global focus and a disciplined methodology, reflecting Swiss precision.

poc.description: Felicity Keller is a Senior Advisor at J. Stern & Co., where she also serves as a Holding Board Director and a Non-Executive Director for several of the Group's companies. She was instrumental in establishing the firm's presence in Switzerland, managing its operations there for ten years. With over 30 years of experience in the private client, family office, and financial services sectors within Switzerland, she has held numerous senior executive positions, including managing director and in-house lawyer. Ms. Keller holds an LLB Honours Degree from University College London and is a non-practising Barrister.
fund.title: J,Stern & Co
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; consumer; public-markets; fixed-income; technology; media; healthcare; manufacturing; infrastructure
fund.description: J. Stern & Co. is an independent investment partnership that builds on the 200-year banking heritage of the Stern family. The firm transitioned from a family office to an investment partnership in 2012 and provides bespoke investment management services to families, entrepreneurs, trustees, charities, and other long-term investors. Headquartered in London, with offices in New York, Zurich, and Malta, the firm serves a global client base.
fund.thesis: J. Stern & Co. follows a long-term, research-intensive investment approach focused on quality and value to achieve real returns across market cycles. They invest in a concentrated portfolio of 20-30 high-quality, sustainable global companies with strong competitive advantages and significant growth potential, without adhering to index weightings. The firm's investment decisions are based on their in-house, fundamental research, and they manage several strategies including World Stars Global Equity, Multi-Asset Income, and Emerging Market Debt.

poc.description: Steve South is the Senior Advisor to the President at Keel Point. Prior to this role, he served as the company's Chief Wealth Officer for five years, where he was responsible for overseeing the Horizon Family Office Team. His career began on Capitol Hill, where he held positions as the Assistant Majority Counsel to the U.S. Senate Labor Subcommittee and as General Counsel to U.S. Senator Don Nickles. Following his time in the Senate, he was Counsel to the Vice President of the Legal Services Corporation and an Associate with the International Foundation.
fund.title: Keel Point
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; private-debt; public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; impact-investing
fund.description: Keel Point is a multi-family office and investment management firm that provides holistic wealth management, family office services, and institutional asset management. A predecessor firm was founded in 1998, with the current iteration formed through a merger in 2015. The firm serves high-net-worth individuals, multi-generational families, and institutions with a planning-based and collaborative approach to financial advisory and investment management.
fund.thesis: Keel Point's investment philosophy is grounded in rigorous, data-driven analysis, viewing investing as a science with a strong emphasis on risk management. They construct customized portfolios to meet specific client goals and risk tolerances, utilizing a range of asset classes including public equities, fixed income, and alternative investments such as private equity, private debt, and real estate, often through pooled vehicles and multi-manager funds. The firm also has a significant focus on mission-driven and faith-based impact investing, aiming to align clients' portfolios with their values.

fund.title: AlTi Tiedemann Global
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; impact-investing; hedge-funds; private-debt; public-markets; fixed-income; financial-services
fund.description: AlTi Tiedemann Global is a global wealth and asset management firm formed in January 2023 through the merger of Tiedemann Group, Alvarium Investments, and Cartesian Growth Corporation. The firm provides tailored financial advice, investment management, and trust services to ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, institutions, and foundations. AlTi emphasizes a client-centric approach and has a notable commitment to sustainable and impact investing.
fund.thesis: AlTi Tiedemann Global's investment thesis centers on providing comprehensive, unbiased financial advice and bespoke investment solutions on a global scale. The firm focuses on a "global yet local" approach, combining international scale with localized expertise, particularly for ultra-high-net-worth clients. They have a strong emphasis on alternative investments, including private equity, real estate, and private credit, alongside a significant commitment to impact and values-aligned investing to achieve both financial and societal returns.
