poc.description: Lyle Minton serves as the Chief Investment Officer at Keel Point, bringing over 25 years of experience in capital markets. Prior to joining Keel Point in 2013, he was a Founding Member and Chief Investment Officer at Point Clear Capital Management, where he managed a global macro hedge fund. His previous experience includes serving as a Senior Vice President at Alcentra, Inc., and as a Managing Director at HSBC Bank in New York. Mr. Minton earned a B.S. in Economics from Auburn University and an M.B.A in finance from Pace University.
fund.title: Keel Point
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; private-debt; public-markets; fixed-income; technology; software; ai-ml; infrastructure; impact-investing; esg
fund.description: Keel Point is an independent wealth management firm founded in 2003, serving multi-generational families, individuals, and institutional clients. The firm was formally established in its current structure through a merger in 2015 and provides a range of services including holistic wealth management, family office solutions, and institutional asset management. With over $3 billion in assets under management, Keel Point operates from eight offices across six states in the United States.
fund.thesis: Keel Point's investment philosophy is grounded in rigorous, data-driven analysis and a strong emphasis on risk management, viewing investing as a science. They create customized, strategy-driven portfolios tailored to client-specific goals, risk tolerance, and values, including mission-driven and faith-based investing. The firm utilizes a broad range of asset classes, including alternative investments like private equity and real estate mezzanine debt, having deployed over $1 billion into private investments since its inception.

poc.description: Joseph Moore serves as the Chief Wealth Officer at Keel Point, where he leads the firm's Family Office business. His responsibilities include managing the delivery of comprehensive financial services to high-net-worth families, with a focus on financial planning, investment management, and family dynamics. Prior to his current role, he was a Senior Family Wealth Director within the firm, having joined Keel Point in 2011. Mr. Moore is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ and holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from The Ohio State University's Fisher College of Business, and he completed his Certified Financial Planning studies at Georgetown University.
fund.title: Keel Point
fund.sectors: financial-services; ai-ml; private-equity; private-debt; impact-investing; public-markets; fixed-income
fund.description: Keel Point is an independent wealth advisory firm founded in 2003, with a predecessor firm established in 1998. The firm provides holistic wealth management, family office solutions, and institutional asset management services to individuals, multi-generational families, and institutions. Keel Point was formally created in 2015 through the merger of Keel Point and Blue Creek Investment Partners, significantly broadening its geographic presence and service depth. The firm is recognized for its commitment to faith-based and impact investing, launching a dedicated platform in 2020.
fund.thesis: Keel Point's investment philosophy is grounded in data-driven analysis and rigorous risk management, viewing investing as a science. The firm focuses on creating individualized, strategy-driven solutions and utilizes an open architecture platform to provide exposure to a wide range of asset classes, including alternative investments like private equity and real estate mezzanine debt. They have a particular focus on faith-driven investing, aiming to align portfolios with client values through screening, shareholder advocacy, and investments in companies that promote positive societal impact.

poc.description: David Zimmer is an accomplished entrepreneur and the CEO of Kalodion GmbH, a single family office he established following the successful sale of his company, inexio. An entrepreneur since 1990, he has founded various companies in the media, IT, and telecommunications sectors. With Kalodion, which he runs with his son Laurence, he invests in promising start-ups, established companies with potential, and real estate, with a focus on sustainability and long-term value. Prior to Kalodion, David Zimmer founded the German fiber optic company inexio, which he grew into a major player in the telecommunications market before its sale in 2019.
fund.title: Kalodion GmbH
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; real-estate; impact-investing
fund.description: Kalodion GmbH is a single family office based in Berlin, Germany, founded by David Zimmer after the successful sale of his telecommunications company, inexio, in 2019. The firm is an active investor in the German market, with a focus on venture capital, private equity, and real estate. Kalodion is also involved in philanthropic activities and supports social entrepreneurship.
fund.thesis: Kalodion's investment philosophy is centered on sustainability and a long-term perspective, investing in promising start-ups, established companies with potential, and distinctive real estate. In its venture capital activities, the firm primarily focuses on seed-stage investments in German-based startups across a variety of sectors. Kalodion also engages in private equity co-investments and invests in venture capital funds.

poc.description: Osama El Haddad is the President of HADYA, a prominent asset management company in Saudi Arabia. He co-founded the HALJ Group with his mother, Mrs. Hadia Abdul Latif Jameel, and has been instrumental in its expansion over the past 18 years. The group's portfolio includes significant real estate developments like Jameel Square, a major commercial center in Jeddah, as well as other local and global investments.
fund.title: Jameel Square
fund.sectors: real-estate
fund.description: Jameel Square is a premier Grade-A commercial office and retail building located in the heart of Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. Developed by Hadya Abdul Latif Jameel, it is positioned as a landmark property, providing a prestigious address for numerous reputable local and multinational companies. A key milestone was achieved in early 2024, when Jameel Square became the first commercial building in Saudi Arabia to be awarded the prestigious LEED Gold v4.1 certification for its commitment to sustainability and innovation.
fund.thesis: The development strategy, executed by parent company Hadya Abdul Latif Jameel Group, focuses on creating high-value, sustainable, and architecturally significant real estate projects in prime locations. The firm aims to attract elite corporate tenants by offering state-of-the-art facilities, cutting-edge technology, and a premium environment, thereby setting new standards for commercial properties. This approach aligns with the broader goals of Saudi Vision 2030, emphasizing quality, sustainability, and the development of modern business and lifestyle communities.

poc.role: Chief Operating Officer and General Counsel
poc.description: Edward Diener is the Chief Operating Officer and General Counsel at King Philanthropies, where he provides leadership on financial, operational, legal, and governance matters. He is also a nationally recognized practitioner in program-related investing. Prior to his current role, he served as General Counsel for the Skoll Foundation for nearly 13 years and was the Vice President of Finance & Administration at the Omidyar Foundation. His earlier career includes senior legal and finance positions at the Packard Foundation and 17 years practicing commercial and corporate law. Diener holds a JD from the UC Berkeley School of Law and a bachelor's degree in accounting from Bowling Green State University.
fund.title: King Philanthropies
fund.sectors: impact-investing; cleantech; agriculture; energy; sustainable-finance; ai-ml; biotech; technology
fund.description: King Philanthropies is a family office founded by Robert and Dorothy King in 2016 to make a meaningful difference in the lives of the world's poorest people. The organization operates as both a grantmaking foundation and an impact-investment platform, focusing on multiplying the impact of high-performing leaders and organizations. Around 2020, the foundation shifted its focus to the intersection of climate and poverty, a key milestone marked by a $25 million donation to MIT to establish the King Climate Action Initiative.
fund.thesis: King Philanthropies' mission is to catalyze solutions at the intersection of climate and livelihoods for those in extreme poverty (living on less than $2.15 a day). They take a 'social impact first' approach, using a flexible toolbox of grants, program-related investments (equity, debt, project finance), and climate impact investments to support the most impactful solutions. The firm seeks to back high-performing, scalable non-profits and social ventures with proven interventions, primarily in Sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia.

fund.description: K8 Capital is a hybrid private credit and venture capital firm founded in 2023 by Andre Koo Jr. Based in New York, the firm is positioned as a next-generation investment platform that integrates both high-yield short-term returns from private credit and long-term growth from venture capital. fund.thesis: Latsco Family Office focuses on long-term strategic investments in sectors where it has extensive experience, as well as diversifying into newer technology and service-oriented ventures. The firm targets companies that demonstrate a clear differentiation from their competition and have the potential to shape their respective markets, with a particular emphasis on the Greek economy. While specific ticket sizes are not public, their investments range from minority stakes in large corporations to participation in venture capital funds.

Founded in 2011, the firm has transitioned from a single-family office to an institutional private equity fund. L2 Capital employs an operations-focused strategy to accelerate market share gain and drive growth in its portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: L2 Capital Partners' investment thesis centers on partnering with niche market leaders to enhance their core operations and expand into new markets, categories, and geographies. The firm seeks to make majority buyout investments in companies with an enterprise value of less than $150 million and annual EBITDA between $4 million and $15 million. L2 Capital primarily focuses on opportunities within North America.

He holds the CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ (CFP®) designation. Prior to his current role, he advanced from a financial representative to a lead advisor at Northwestern Mutual, focusing on investment and planning strategies.
fund.title: Lido Advisors

fund.description: Lido Advisors is a nationally recognized wealth advisory firm that provides a family office experience to high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Founded in 1999, the firm has grown to be one of the nation's fastest-growing RIAs with offices across the United States. Lido Advisors has been recognized by publications such as Forbes, Barron's, and the Financial Times for its wealth management services.
fund.thesis: Lido Advisors' investment philosophy focuses on helping clients achieve their financial goals while minimizing market risk and volatility through a holistic and coordinated approach. The firm utilizes a range of asset classes, including fixed-income, equities, real estate, and alternative investments, to create customized portfolios tailored to each client's objectives. Lido Advisors primarily serves high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth clients across the United States.

poc.role: Senior Vice President, Senior Wealth Manager
poc.description: Henry Herrill is a Senior Vice President and Senior Wealth Manager at Lido Advisors, a position he has held since joining the firm in 2017. His professional focus is on advancing his knowledge of alternative investments and new opportunities to provide comprehensive advice to his clients. Prior to Lido Advisors, he worked as a financial representative for Northwestern Mutual. Herrill holds a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Northwestern University, where he was also the captain of the Men's Soccer team.
fund.title: Lido Advisors
fund.sectors: private-equity; private-debt; real-estate; public-markets; fixed-income; financial-services
fund.description: Lido Advisors is a nationally recognized wealth advisory firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing comprehensive investment and wealth strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Founded in 1999, the firm has grown significantly, now managing over $38 billion in regulatory assets under management and has been recognized on lists such as Barron's Top 100 RIA Firms and Forbes' Top RIA Firms. A key milestone in its growth was the strategic partnership with Charlesbank Capital Partners in 2021, and more recently with HPS Investment Partners.
fund.thesis: Lido Advisors' investment thesis is centered on a holistic, family office-style approach that integrates investment management with tax, estate, and legacy planning to grow, protect, and maximize their clients' legacies. The firm utilizes a mix of traditional and alternative asset classes, including equities, fixed income, real estate, and private funds, with a focus on risk mitigation and creating customized portfolios tailored to individual client objectives. Their primary focus is on serving high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth clients across the United States.

poc.description: David Parks is the Founder and Executive Chairman of Keel Point, a multi-family office and investment firm he established in 1998. His vision for the firm is to assist families in understanding their complex needs to achieve their unique goals. Prior to founding Keel Point, Mr. Parks led a financial planning practice for nine years with the Mason Companies and also worked with Young Life for six years. He earned his Bachelor of Science in Management Sciences from Duke University and is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™.
fund.title: Keel Point
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; impact-investing; public-markets
fund.description: Keel Point is a multi-family office and investment advisory firm that provides wealth management, family office services, and institutional asset management. Founded with a predecessor firm in 1998 and officially formed through a merger in 2015, the firm serves high-net-worth individuals, multi-generational families, and institutions. Keel Point emphasizes a client-centric approach, combining financial planning with investment management to address complex financial needs.
fund.thesis: Keel Point's investment philosophy is grounded in data-driven analysis and rigorous risk management, viewing investing as a science. The firm creates individualized, strategy-driven portfolios and has a significant focus on alternative investments, including private equity and impact investing. A key area of their impact strategy is 'Faith-Driven Investing,' which includes private equity investments in companies that promote a culture of faith or address societal issues like human trafficking.

He has over 25 years of experience in investing and operations, covering public and private equity, technology, venture funding, and alternative investments. fund.description: Lonsdale Capital is a single-family office headquartered in Singapore, incorporated on April 28, 1999. The firm was founded by former Gems TV executive Jason Choo and manages the Choo family's diversified global portfolio. Lonsdale Capital invests across a wide range of assets, including public equity, private transactions, debt, and alternative strategies, with a particular emphasis on technology and healthcare. The firm also operates Lonsdale Social Innovation Capital, an arm focused on funding and mentoring social enterprises to scale their impact on low-income communities globally.
fund.thesis: Lonsdale Capital's main investment arm seeks to build long-term, consistent gains by deploying capital across a diverse range of assets like public equity and debt. Its private equity arm focuses on partnering with strong founders and management teams at various growth stages to build businesses of lasting value. Through its social innovation arm, it provides flexible, long-term capital and support to social enterprises, particularly those in emerging markets like Bangladesh.

The firm is comfortable with concentration, illiquidity, and volatility, viewing them as opportunities rather than risks.

fund.description: MAI Capital Management is a multi-family office and registered investment adviser founded in 1973. Initially established to serve the financial needs of athletes, the firm has evolved into a comprehensive wealth management firm catering to high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutional investors. MAI has grown significantly through a strategy of acquiring other wealth management firms, with 37 acquisitions since 2018. The firm offers a wide range of services including financial planning, investment management, and alternative investments.
fund.thesis: MAI Capital Management's investment philosophy is centered on a long-term, goals-focused approach, creating customized portfolios tailored to each client's specific needs, risk tolerance, and financial objectives. They emphasize a client-first mentality and invest with a margin of safety to deliver strong, sustainable returns over years, not quarters. The firm utilizes a diversified approach, allocating capital across equities, fixed income, and alternative asset classes, including private equity, real estate, and private credit, to achieve attractive risk-adjusted returns.

He also holds the title of Director at the company, which has also been known as Genthod Global Advisory SA. His prior experience includes working as a sell-side equity research analyst at Natixis Securities from 2008 to 2010. The company's stated purpose is to provide investment advice, strategies, and investor research, with a particular specialization in luxury goods and services.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy centers on achieving capital appreciation by investing in a global portfolio of high-quality stocks within the luxury sector. This involves identifying and investing in companies involved in the manufacturing, retail, and marketing of high-end consumer goods and services. Their approach is demonstrated through the management of the DGC – Franck Muller Luxury Fund, which invests in established luxury brands.

Prior to her role at Lerner, she spent over 15 years at Host Hotels & Resorts, most recently as Vice President and Assistant Treasurer. Ms. Le earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, with a focus on finance and international marketing, from American University and a Master of Business Administration from the University of Maryland.
fund.title: Lerner Enterprises

fund.description: Lerner Enterprises is a prominent family-owned real estate development, investment, and management company based in the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area. Founded in 1952 by Theodore N. Lerner, the firm has developed over 20 million square feet of commercial, retail, residential, and hospitality properties, significantly shaping the region's landscape. Notable achievements include the development of Tysons Corner Center and the ownership of the Washington Nationals baseball team, which won the World Series in 2019.
fund.thesis: Lerner Enterprises primarily focuses on long-term real estate development and ownership, with a vertically integrated approach that encompasses all phases from planning and design to asset management. While deeply rooted in real estate, the family office also makes direct and indirect investments in growing businesses across various sectors in the United States, including technology, AI/ML, aerospace, and defense. Their venture investments are typically in early-stage companies, as evidenced by their participation in seed and Series A/B rounds.

Their real estate portfolio is diversified across residential, office, retail, and hotel assets.

poc.description: Jeremy S. Office is the Founder of Maclendon Wealth Management, where he specializes in portfolio construction, strategic asset and liability management, and long-term financial planning for successful individuals, families, and businesses. Before founding Maclendon in 2011, he served as vice president and associate director for Merrill Lynch and previously worked as a business consultant for large corporations. Mr. Office earned his Ph.D. in global leadership and management from Lynn University, and holds numerous financial certifications, including Certified Financial Planner™ and Certified Investment Management Analyst®.
fund.title: Maclendon Wealth Management
fund.sectors: venture-capital; hedge-funds; real-estate; financial-services; insurance
fund.description: Maclendon Wealth Management is a multi-family office founded in 2011 that provides personalized financial guidance and wealth management services. The firm primarily serves entrepreneurs, business owners, athletes, and entertainers, functioning as their personal CFO. Maclendon emphasizes a team-based approach called OneTeam® to address complex financial concerns, ranging from wealth preservation to alternative investments.
fund.thesis: Maclendon Wealth Management's investment thesis revolves around providing independent and objective financial advice tailored to the specific needs of their entrepreneurial clients. Their strategy involves a holistic approach to wealth management, including asset management, liability planning, and advisory services for alternative investments such as private placements, venture capital, and hedge funds. The firm focuses on building long-term relationships and aligning its success with the portfolio growth and financial security of its clients.

poc.description: Drew Beresford has a career focused on advising families and individuals on wealth management. He was formerly the President of Manchester Capital Management, a national multi-family office. Prior to that, he began his career at Bank of America's Private Bank. Mr. Beresford earned a BA in International Relations from Brown University, completed coursework at Harvard Business School, and holds a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charter.
fund.title: Manchester Capital Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds; venture-capital; financial-services
fund.description: Manchester Capital Management is an independent multi-family office founded in 1992 that provides wealth management, investment advisory, and family office services to high-net-worth families. The firm is owned by its partners and select founding families, serving clients across the United States and internationally from its offices in Vermont, California, New York, and Virginia. Manchester Capital has been recognized as one of America's top registered investment advisors by publications such as Barron's.
fund.thesis: Manchester Capital Management employs a customized, client-centric investment strategy focused on creating enduring, well-constructed, and risk-managed portfolios. Their approach emphasizes diversification across traditional equities and ETFs, as well as alternative investments like private real estate, private equity, and hedge funds, often sourced through a curated selection of third-party managers. The firm has a particular focus on emerging trends and opportunities in the private markets, including sectors like AI, Life Sciences, and CleanTech.

poc.role: Senior Vice President, Senior Wealth Manager
poc.description: Viktoria Falus is a Senior Vice President and Senior Wealth Manager at Lido Advisors, where she acts as a financial quarterback for her clients, leveraging her expertise in comprehensive financial planning and wealth management. Prior to joining Lido in 2023, she spent 18 years with Colorado Financial Management, where she was the Senior Financial Planner for over a decade. Viktoria holds the CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ (CFP®) and Enrolled Agent (EA) designations and earned a B.A. in Economics from the State University of New York.
fund.title: Lido Advisors
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate; private-equity; fixed-income; public-markets
fund.description: Lido Advisors is a nationally recognized wealth advisory firm headquartered in Los Angeles, California, providing comprehensive investment and wealth strategies for high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Founded in 1999, the firm has grown to become one of the nation's fastest-growing private wealth management companies, recognized by publications like Forbes. Lido operates with a multi-family office approach, integrating investment management with tax, estate, and legacy planning.
fund.thesis: Lido Advisors' investment philosophy centers on a holistic and coordinated approach to wealth management, aiming to grow, protect, and maximize their clients' legacies. The firm utilizes a broad range of asset classes, including equities, fixed income, and alternative investments like private equity, private credit, and real estate, to build customized and diversified portfolios. Their strategy emphasizes risk mitigation and providing clients with access to specialized and exclusive investment opportunities typically reserved for the ultra-wealthy.

poc.description: Kirby Ott is a Partner and Managing Member at Matter Family Office, where he is also a member of the board of managers. He joined the firm in 2009 and is based in the St. Louis office. His primary responsibility is leading internal collaboration to integrate the firm's service areas, and he has deep expertise in investment management, portfolio construction, and liquidity planning. Prior to joining Matter, Kirby earned a finance degree from the University of Missouri and an MBA from Washington University.
fund.title: Matter Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; commodities; financial-services
fund.description: Matter Family Office is an independent multi-family office founded in 1990 that serves ultra-high-net-worth families across the United States. [1, 4, 7, 12] The firm provides integrated wealth management services, including investment management, wealth planning, and family learning and communication. [2, 6] Matter has been recognized multiple times by the Family Wealth Report Awards, winning its category in 2018 and 2019, and being named a finalist in 2025. [5, 10] In 2025, the firm merged with Denver-based IWP Family Office. [8]
fund.thesis: Matter's investment philosophy is grounded in the endowment model, emphasizing broad diversification across asset classes, geographies, and investment styles to achieve long-term returns. [1, 6] The firm prioritizes capital preservation and volatility reduction while building sophisticated global portfolios designed to participate in global economic growth. [1, 3] Their approach is to act as a long-term, unconstrained investor, focusing on strategic asset allocation and selecting respected investment managers that align with each family's specific goals and values. [11, 18]

fund.title: Lido Advisors

fund.description: Lido Advisors is a nationally recognized wealth advisory firm that provides a comprehensive, family office experience for high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Founded in 1999, the firm has grown rapidly, particularly through a series of strategic acquisitions, to manage over $38 billion in assets across dozens of offices in the United States. Lido is known for its active approach to asset management, focusing on risk mitigation and providing clients with access to a broad range of investment strategies.
fund.thesis: Lido Advisors' investment strategy centers on providing holistic and coordinated wealth planning that integrates investment management with tax, estate, and legacy objectives. The firm utilizes a diverse mix of traditional assets and alternative investments, including private equity, private debt, and real estate, to build customized, outcome-based portfolios designed to protect and grow client wealth. As a fiduciary, Lido emphasizes a client-first, planning-centric approach to navigate complex financial needs beyond the scope of traditional portfolios.

poc.role: Founder, Chairman of the Board, and Chief Executive Officer
poc.description: Martin D. Sass is the Founder, Chairman of the Board, and Chief Executive Officer of M.D. Sass, an investment management firm he established in 1972. His career in investment management began in 1963. Prior to founding M.D. Sass, he was the President and Chief Investment Officer of Neuwirth Management and Research Corp and founded the Special Situations Division at Argus Research Corporation. He earned his B.S. in Accounting from Brooklyn College and pursued graduate studies at New York University and City University of New York.
fund.title: MD Sass Investors

fund.description: M.D. Sass is an independent asset management firm founded in 1972 by Martin D. Sass. The firm specializes in creating differentiated investment strategies across various asset classes, including equities, fixed income, and alternatives. M.D. Sass serves a diverse client base that includes Fortune 500 companies, pension funds, endowments, foundations, and high-net-worth individuals.
fund.thesis: M.D. Sass employs a value-driven, research-intensive investment approach, seeking out-of-favor and misunderstood investment opportunities where perception lags reality. Their 'Concentrated Value' strategy focuses on a high-conviction portfolio of approximately 20 large and mid-cap U.S. stocks that are believed to be fundamentally strong but temporarily undervalued. The firm emphasizes a long-term investment horizon and thorough fundamental analysis to identify companies with the potential for significant positive earnings revisions.

fund.title: Lewben Family Offices
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; hedge-funds; cleantech; financial-services; crypto-blockchain; sustainable-finance
fund.description: Lewben Family Offices, rebranded as Noewe in late 2023, is a multi-family office founded in 2009 and headquartered in Vilnius, Lithuania. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services including wealth management, financial planning, legal, tax, and business consulting to high-net-worth individuals and families. Through its merger and rebranding, Noewe has become one of the largest professional service providers in the Lithuanian market, with offices in Amsterdam and Nicosia. The firm has received recognition as the best family office service provider in Lithuania by Euromoney magazine on multiple occasions.
fund.thesis: Noewe's investment thesis centers on providing a holistic and structured approach to wealth management, tailored to the individual needs and long-term objectives of their clients. They focus on wealth preservation and growth by systematically analyzing the legal, fiscal, and financial circumstances of each family. Their strategy involves creating customized solutions that encompass wealth structuring, tax planning, and legal support to help clients achieve their financial goals for current and future generations.

poc.description: Katherine Lintz is the Founder and a Managing Partner of Matter Family Office, a firm she established in 1990. Her career in financial services began in 1980 at Chase Manhattan Bank, where she was involved in developing one of the first financial education and planning programs. Prior to founding Matter, which was originally KBL & Associates, she worked at Bry & Associates, a sports agency in St. Louis, where she provided financial planning for professional athletes. Katherine earned a BA in history from Duke University and is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ (CFP®) certificant.
fund.title: Matter Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; commodities; real-estate
fund.description: Matter Family Office is a private, independent multi-family office founded in 1990 that provides integrated wealth management services to ultra-high-net-worth families across the United States. The firm serves as a strategic advisor, guiding clients on investment management, wealth planning, and family culture and learning. In 2024, Matter entered into a strategic partnership with BW Forsyth Partners to support long-term growth, and in 2025, merged with IWP Family Office.
fund.thesis: Matter Family Office's investment philosophy is based on the endowment model, which emphasizes broad diversification across asset classes, geographies, and investment styles to achieve long-term returns while managing risk. The firm prioritizes capital preservation and aims to reduce volatility while maintaining competitive returns through a long-term, global investment perspective. They construct customized portfolios that align with each family's specific circumstances, objectives, and values.

poc.description: Lisa Hauck is a Partner at Matter Family Office, where she oversees a wide range of firm management responsibilities including compliance, controller functions, human resources, and corporate insurance. She has the distinction of being the firm's second employee, having joined in 1990 and has been integral to the company's operations for over three decades. Lisa is a Certified Financial Planner (CFP®) and holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a focus in finance from the University of Missouri.
fund.title: Matter Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; real-estate; commodities; public-markets; fixed-income
fund.description: Matter Family Office is an independent multi-family office founded in 1990 that provides integrated wealth management services to ultra-high-net-worth families. The firm acts as a strategic advisor, guiding clients on investment management, wealth planning, and family learning and communication to build enduring legacies. In 2024, Matter entered into a strategic partnership with BW Forsyth Partners to support its growth, and in 2025, it merged with IWP Family Office. The firm has received recognition as a top financial advisor and has been a finalist for and winner of Family Wealth Report Awards.
fund.thesis: Matter Family Office's investment philosophy is grounded in the endowment model, emphasizing diversification across asset classes, geography, and investment style to achieve long-term returns while prioritizing capital preservation. They build sophisticated portfolios designed to participate in global economic growth and focus on reducing volatility. The firm serves as a thought partner to high-net-worth families, creating customized investment policies that align with the family's specific vision, values, and wealth objectives.

poc.description: Ted Cronin is the founding partner of Manchester Capital Management and currently serves as the Executive Chairman of the Board. In his active daily role, he focuses on client engagement and services while providing overall leadership for the firm's direction. Prior to founding Manchester Capital, he was a former Trustee of the Village of Manchester and past Chairman of the Board of the Vermont Natural Resources Council. Mr. Cronin received a B.A. from Williams College and completed coursework at Harvard Business School and the New York Institute of Finance.
fund.title: Manchester Capital Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; venture-capital; private-debt; real-estate; impact-investing; ai-ml; cleantech; financial-services
fund.description: Manchester Capital Management is an independently owned multi-family office founded in 1993. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management, family office services, and direct real estate investment advisory to high-net-worth families. Manchester Capital has been consistently recognized as a top registered investment advisor by publications such as Barron's.
fund.thesis: The firm employs a customized, client-centric investment strategy focused on creating enduring portfolios tailored to individual family circumstances, goals, and values. Their approach utilizes an open-architecture model to build diversified portfolios across traditional assets, private investments, and direct real estate, with a focus on long-term wealth preservation and growth. A recent focus includes private market innovation in sectors like AI, Life Sciences, and CleanTech, alongside a commitment to impact and sustainable investing.

poc.description: Tapan Bhargave is the Managing Principal at Odoomber Tree Capital and the Founder and CEO of EarthBenign, a financial technology company. His career began in microchip design engineering at IBM after earning a degree in Electrical Engineering from Cornell University. He later moved into real estate entrepreneurial ventures before returning to technology, including a role as a systems process engineer at SourcePulse.
fund.title: Odoomber Tree Capital
fund.sectors: hospitality
fund.description: Odoomber Tree Capital is a multi-family office based in Dallas, Texas. The firm maintains a very low public profile, with its website serving as a basic landing page without detailed information. Its specific market position, founding year, and notable achievements are not publicly available.

poc.description: Charles Thevenin serves as the Managing Director and Bond Fund Manager at Mobilis Gestion, a position he has held since joining the firm in 2015. His responsibilities include managing bond funds and mandates, utilizing both direct securities and multi-management strategies. His prior experience includes working as a Risk Consultant at Deloitte, a Risk Manager at Barclays AM for two years, and subsequently as a Bond Fund Manager at Barclays Wealth for eight years. Charles is a graduate of Paris IX Dauphine with a DEA in Finance.
fund.title: Mobilis Gestion
fund.sectors: public-markets; hedge-funds; fixed-income; commodities; private-equity; real-estate; retail
fund.description: Mobilis Gestion is a French asset management company that functions as the single-family office for the Mulliez family. Founded in 1989 and based in Roubaix, France, the firm is authorized by the Autorité des Marchés Financiers (AMF). Mobilis Gestion operates across all international financial markets, including equities, hedge funds, bonds, commodities, and private equity, offering services from direct management to advisory.
fund.thesis: The firm's core strategy is to manage and preserve the family's wealth through a disciplined approach to asset allocation, direct investments, and long-term planning with a focus on capital preservation and intergenerational continuity. Mobilis Gestion maintains a diversified portfolio and provides corporate finance, strategy, legal, and tax expertise to a federation of over 200 companies primarily in the retail, restaurant, textile, and real estate sectors.

poc.role: Managing Director, Real Estate and Chief Compliance Officer, Partner
poc.description: Bart Kraft serves as the Chief Compliance Officer and directs the private real estate portfolios for Manchester Capital Management, where he is also a Partner. He joined the firm in 1998. Prior to his tenure at Manchester Capital, he was the Chief Financial Officer of Environmental Power Corp. Mr. Kraft began his career with a CPA firm, where he worked for eleven years with a focus on audit, tax, and business management services, and he studied accounting and finance at the University of Vermont and Stetson University.
fund.title: Manchester Capital Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds; private-debt; venture-capital; ai-ml; healthtech; cleantech; financial-services
fund.description: Manchester Capital Management is an independent multi-family office founded in 1993 that provides investment management, family office, and private real estate services to high-net-worth families. The firm is owned by its partners and select founding families, serving clients across the United States and globally from its offices in Vermont, California, New York, and Virginia. Manchester Capital has been recognized by publications like Barron's and CNBC as one of America's top registered investment advisors.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy is customized to each client's specific circumstances, goals, and risk tolerance, which are formalized in a written Investment Policy Statement. They construct diversified portfolios using a mix of traditional assets, direct real estate, and private investments, often accessed through a vetted list of third-party managers. A recent focus has been on private market opportunities in sectors like AI, Life Sciences, and CleanTech, where they seek to invest with large, established firms to mitigate risk.

poc.description: Vinod Nair is an entrepreneur and the founder of the Nair Family Office, a single-family office that manages the assets generated from his technology and digital finance ventures. He is also the Founder and CEO of MoneySmart Group, Southeast Asia's leading personal finance portal. His entrepreneurial career began in 2007 when he founded HomeSpace, a map-based property search engine. He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Computing with a focus on Communications and New Media from the National University of Singapore.
fund.title: Nair Family Office
fund.description: Nair Family Office, operating as Nair Pte Ltd, is a single-family office based in Singapore that manages the wealth of Vinod Nair and his family. Founded in 1999, the firm evolved from Vinod Nair's ventures in technology and digital finance, including the MoneySmart Group. The office aims to be an international, nimble firm focused on near-term opportunities to create long-term value, unconstrained by traditional asset management conventions.
fund.thesis: The firm invests in companies with strong fundamentals and sound business principles, particularly when it believes the market has undervalued their long-term growth strategies. It has a multi-strategy and ethical investment approach with a focus on equities in India, the United States, and Europe, with a particular interest in emerging concepts and markets. The firm's sector interests include biotech (new drugs and devices) and resource extraction (mining, oil, and gas).

poc.description: Alessandro Mauceri is the CEO of Memento, a single family office. Official Swiss commercial records for Memento SA list his title as President and sole administrator. Publicly available information regarding his detailed career history prior to Memento is limited.
fund.title: Memento
fund.sectors: financial-services; public-markets
fund.description: Memento SA is a Swiss-based single family office located in Geneva that provides wealth and asset management services. Founded in 2015, the firm offers financial advisory, asset analysis, and financial planning services. It operates as a service company focused on managing personal finances and investments.
fund.thesis: Memento SA's investment strategy focuses on providing comprehensive financial services, including asset management, financial engineering, and planning. The firm aims to offer a personalized approach to financial planning and investment management to help individuals save and invest for the future. Their services extend to accounting, legal, and tax activities to support their clients' financial goals.

poc.description: Rodolphe de Changy is a Partner at My Family Office, a position he has held since joining the firm in 2012. He is an economist by training and holds a degree in Global Wealth Planning from the Private Bankers Association Belgium. His prior experience includes providing advice at Arthur Andersen and working in private banking at Group Degroof and Banque de Luxembourg.
fund.title: My Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; real-estate; impact-investing; financial-services; insurance
fund.description: My Family Office is a multi-family office established in September 2007 in Luxembourg. The firm provides independent wealth management and advisory services to a select number of families, focusing on the preservation and growth of their assets. Their services include financial asset auditing, asset consolidation, and investment advice to help clients define and execute their long-term financial strategies.
fund.thesis: My Family Office acts as an independent advisor, assisting clients in structuring and supervising their financial assets. They have expertise in various investment vehicles, including private equity, hedge funds, structured products, and insurance-based investments, and help clients understand and select investments that align with their personal and financial objectives. While their geographic focus is not explicitly stated, their location in Luxembourg and mention of being in contact with bankers and managers in various countries suggests a European and potentially international scope.

poc.description: Olivier Couchard is a Founding Partner at My Family Office. He has over 15 years of experience as a private banker at major banking institutions, including ING and BNP Paribas. He possesses a strong financial background with credentials from HEC, ABAF, and the Private Bankers Association. In his current role, he is dedicated to providing high-quality service focused on listening, responsiveness, and pragmatism for the clients of the firm.
fund.title: My Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; financial-services
fund.description: My Family Office (MFO) is a multi-family office based in Luxembourg, founded in 2007. The firm acts as a central coordinator for its clients' wealth, providing services such as auditing financial assets, consolidated reporting, and strategic advice. MFO works with a limited number of families to ensure a personalized, long-term approach to preserving and growing their assets.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy is to act as an independent advisor, helping clients define their risk profile and asset allocation strategy. They specialize in advising on alternative investments, including Private Equity and Hedge Funds, and help clients understand and select these vehicles. MFO focuses on coordinating with various service providers (bankers, managers, etc.) across different countries to implement the defined strategy, rather than direct management.

poc.description: Daniel Bachmann is the founder of Nezzo Holding AG, a family investment office. With over 20 years of experience as an entrepreneur, founder, and investor, he is a hands-on strategist. His strengths lie in networked thinking and analysis, and he helps organizations and startups build a secure foundation for growth.
fund.title: Nezzo Holding
fund.sectors: technology; software; saas; fintech; ecommerce; consumer; healthtech
fund.description: Nezzo Holding AG is a value-oriented family investment office based in Rotkreuz, Switzerland. The firm focuses on contributing to a meaningful and sustainable society by investing in companies that share these values. Led by Daniel Bachmann, an entrepreneur and investor with over 20 years of experience, Nezzo Holding primarily engages with new technologies and digitalization.
fund.thesis: Nezzo Holding's investment thesis centers on supporting a future-proof society through strategic investments in technology and digitalization. The firm takes an active role in its portfolio companies, often with a seat on the board, to foster growth and ensure alignment with its core values. They seek to build a secure foundation for the organizations and startups they partner with, emphasizing a holistic and networked approach to their investments.

poc.description: Mark Cuban is a seasoned entrepreneur and investor who serves as the Founder of the Mark Cuban Foundation, which is part of his family office, Mark Cuban Companies. His career began with the establishment of MicroSolutions, a computer consulting service he sold to CompuServe. He later co-founded Broadcast.com, which was acquired by Yahoo! for $5.6 billion. Cuban is also widely recognized for his role as a "shark" investor on the television series Shark Tank and as the owner of the Dallas Mavericks.
fund.title: Mark Cuban Foundation - Family Office
fund.sectors: technology; software; saas; enterprise-software; ai-ml; healthcare; healthtech; fintech; cleantech; energy; consumer; retail; ecommerce; media; entertainment; telecommunications; transportation; education; financial-services; crypto-blockchain; impact-investing
fund.description: Mark Cuban Companies is the investment vehicle and family office for entrepreneur and investor Mark Cuban. After achieving billionaire status from the sale of his early ventures MicroSolutions and Broadcast.com, Cuban has become a prolific investor in hundreds of companies across a vast array of sectors. He is widely recognized for his role as a "shark" investor on the ABC reality show "Shark Tank," where he has invested in numerous startups since 2011. A notable recent venture is the establishment of Mark Cuban Cost Plus Drug Company, aimed at disrupting the pharmaceutical industry by offering low-cost generic drugs.
fund.thesis: Mark Cuban's investment strategy is characterized by a hands-on, founder-focused approach, backing entrepreneurs who are knowledgeable, capable of selling, and have a product with a unique and defensible proposition. He is stage and sector-agnostic, investing in everything from technology, AI, and healthcare to consumer products and media, primarily in the United States. While known for seed-stage deals through "Shark Tank," he also participates in later-stage venture rounds.

poc.description: Scott Swenor is the Chief Financial Officer and a Partner at Manchester Capital Management, where he oversees the firm's financial operations, manages key financial relationships, implements budgets, and supervises the accounting process. Prior to joining the firm in 2006, he held various financial leadership positions at a Dutch Multinational, Corporate Express, Buhrmann, and was a Senior Auditor at Price Waterhouse. He earned a B.S.B.A. in Accounting from Bryant University and an M.S. in Finance from the University of Denver. Scott is also a licensed certified public accountant.
fund.title: Manchester Capital Management
fund.sectors: ai-ml; biotech; cleantech; financial-services; private-debt; private-equity; public-markets; real-estate
fund.description: Manchester Capital Management is a multi-family office and SEC-registered investment adviser founded in 1993. The firm provides customized portfolio management, family office services, and private real estate advisory for high-net-worth individuals and families. Owned by its partners and select founding families, it operates as a fiduciary focused on tailored wealth management solutions. The firm's founder, Ted Cronin, has been recognized on Barron's list of “Top 100 Independent Financial Advisors” for 17 consecutive years.
fund.thesis: Manchester Capital Management's investment thesis is client-centric and customized, focusing on creating enduring portfolios that align with a family's specific goals, risk tolerance, and legacy objectives. The firm develops a written Investment Policy Statement for each client, guiding the construction of diversified portfolios that include traditional public markets, private investments, and real estate to achieve long-term goals. This strategy is built on a comprehensive data-gathering process to understand the client's time horizon, tax considerations, and liquidity needs.

poc.description: Jonathan Ross is a Partner at Mountview Partners, a boutique family office. He has spent his entire career in technology, with experience spanning sales to operations. For 19 years, he was with an SMB that provided enterprise SaaS to health and fitness clubs, serving as the President and CEO for the last 10 of those years. In his leadership role, his primary areas of focus were on product development, IT, strategy, and finance.
fund.title: Mountview Partners
fund.sectors: software; saas; enterprise-software; private-equity
fund.description: Mountview Partners is a boutique family office established in 2017 and based in Houston, Texas. The firm was founded by two former software executives with extensive experience in operating and growing vertical niche software companies. Mountview Partners differentiates itself by being self-financed, which allows for a long-term investment horizon without the pressure of returning capital to outside investors.
fund.thesis: Mountview Partners seeks to acquire a majority stake in vertical niche software companies with annual revenues ranging from $1.5 million to $6 million. Their strategy is to leverage their operational expertise to grow the businesses they invest in. As a self-financed family office, they aim to build sustainable companies with excellent products and services over the long term.

poc.description: Brian Gaister is the Co-Founder and CEO of Pennington Partners & Co., where he leads the strategy and vision of the firm. Prior to this, he served as a financial advisor at Morgan Stanley and a wealth management advisor for Merrill Lynch. He earned a Bachelor of Science in International Business from the University of Maryland's Robert H. Smith School of Business and holds the Certified Investment Management Analyst® (CIMA®) and Certified Private Wealth Advisor® (CPWA®) certifications.
fund.title: Pennington Partners & Co
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; growth-capital; technology
fund.description: Pennington Partners & Co. is a multi-family office and investment adviser founded in 2016 to serve the needs of entrepreneurial founders, CEOs, and their families. The firm provides comprehensive investment management, wealth planning, and financial administration services. Pennington Partners has received recognition as a top RIA firm by Forbes and has won multiple awards from Private Asset Management, including "Best Multi-Family Office".
fund.thesis: Pennington Partners' investment thesis centers on a partnership model, investing alongside their clients in differentiated, tax-advantaged alternative investments. They focus on backing smaller growth and buyout managers with specialized strategies, particularly those backing "bootstrap businesses" that have not yet taken institutional capital. The firm's geographic focus is primarily on North America, with a secondary focus on Western Europe, and they also have a dedicated real estate investment vertical targeting opportunities across the United States.

fund.title: Praesidian Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; private-debt; manufacturing; consumer; healthcare; technology; entertainment; aerospace; defense
fund.description: Praesidian Capital is a private investment firm established in 2002, focusing on the lower middle market. The firm provides capital for buyouts, recapitalizations, and growth to businesses across various sectors. Initially focused on mezzanine financing, Praesidian has since expanded its strategy to include acquiring controlling stakes in companies. With offices in the United States and Europe, the firm has invested over $800 million in more than 80 businesses since its inception.
fund.thesis: Praesidian Capital targets lower middle-market companies in the United States and Europe with strong management teams and potential for growth. The firm is sector-agnostic but has historically invested in manufacturing, distribution, and service industries while avoiding sectors like oil & gas exploration and real estate. Praesidian is flexible in its investment approach, providing both debt and equity capital to support various transaction types, including buyouts and recapitalizations.

poc.description: Axel Despriet is a Managing Partner and Board Member at Mitiska REIM, a company he co-founded in 2008. In his role, he also serves as the Managing Director for Germany. His previous experience includes positions at GLL Real Estate Partners in Munich and Catella Property Group in Brussels. He holds a master's degree in civil engineering from KU Leuven and a master's in general management from Vlerick Business School.
fund.title: Mitiska
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds; public-markets
fund.description: Mitiska is the single-family office of the Geuten family, founded in 1990 in Brussels, Belgium. It began as a private equity investor primarily in retail businesses and has since diversified into a portfolio spanning private equity, real estate, and asset management. In 2012, Mitiska co-founded Mitiska REIM, which has become a leading specialist investor in European convenience real estate. The family office takes a long-term, value-add approach to its investments, leveraging its operational experience.
fund.thesis: Mitiska's strategy is diversified across three core areas: private equity, real estate, and asset management. In private equity, it invests both directly in companies and through top-tier funds, seeking strong management teams to support. Its real estate focus, primarily executed through its affiliate Mitiska REIM, targets value-add opportunities in European convenience real estate, including retail parks, urban logistics, and self-storage, often partnering with local experts. The asset management arm invests in liquid financial instruments like bonds and shares to ensure portfolio diversification and liquidity.

poc.description: Dr. Simon Colson is a Managing Partner at Moortown Capital, a family office. He has over 30 years of experience in the financial markets, with a background in investment banking, investment management, and financial consulting. Previously, he served as a Managing Director at Deutsche Bank AG London from 1995 to 2001, where he was in charge of closed-end fund origination and distribution. Dr. Colson is a qualified Medical Doctor and holds an MBA in Finance & Investment from Bayes Business School (University of London).
fund.title: Moortown Capital

poc.description: Marco Di Lorenzo is the Chief Executive Officer of Next Holding S.p.A., a family office focused on private equity and venture capital. Born in Florence in 1967, he graduated from the Faculty of Political Sciences "Cesare Alfieri" at the University of Florence. His career is marked by numerous executive and directorial positions, including roles at Ekamant Italia S.p.A., First Capital S.p.A., and as a former independent director at Eukedos S.p.A. He has extensive experience in financial investments and private equity.
fund.title: Next Holding
fund.sectors: private-equity; impact-investing
fund.description: Next Holding is a single-family office that invests in Italian companies. It operates as the family office for the Manganelli family, managing their assets and investments for over 15 years. The firm partners with entrepreneurs, providing capital, expertise, and a network of relationships to foster growth and value creation.
fund.thesis: Next Holding specializes in private equity transactions, taking qualified minority stakes (between 10% and 40%) in Italian businesses. They are flexible investors, not bound by specific sectors, and focus on companies that create value for all stakeholders with a commitment to sustainability within the Italian territory. Their investment size for a single operation is between €1 million and €5 million.

poc.description: Tobias Poensgen is the CEO of Momentum Capital, a single family office he established in 2002 and has led since its inception. He is responsible for deal sourcing, transactions, and heads the investment committee, in addition to leading the family office and sovereign wealth fund advisory services. His career began in strategic business development and corporate finance at Siemens AG and Stettner Group, followed by a position at SG Warburg in London in 1986. In 1997, he founded Unica Communications, which became a leader in integrated communications services for SMEs in the UK.
fund.title: Momentum Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; financial-services; fintech; saas; cleantech; ai-ml; energy; software; media
fund.description: Momentum Capital is the direct investment arm of a single family office, founded in 2002. Originally a mid-market private equity investor, the firm has since broadened its scope to become a diversified investment company. Based in London, United Kingdom, Momentum Capital leverages its permanent capital base to operate with agility in the market.
fund.thesis: Momentum Capital's investment strategy is to identify and invest in opportunities with unrealized potential across private equity, venture capital, real estate, and financial markets. The firm acts as an active investor, providing both financial and human capital to under-performing companies to drive growth and value. Their approach is opportunistic and flexible, aiming to anticipate market trends and think creatively to generate exceptional returns.

poc.description: J. Marc Albertson is a founding Partner and Director of Client Services at Patton Albertson & Miller, where he also serves as a Senior Relationship Manager. His career in the financial sector began in 1973 and includes a significant tenure at SunTrust Bank, Middle Georgia, before co-founding his current firm in 2003. Mr. Albertson is a Certified Financial Planner (CFP®) and holds a Certificate in Trusts from Southern Trust School and a Certified Financial Services Counselor (CFSC) designation from the National Graduate Trust School. He specializes in wealth management, trust administration, and building deep relationships with families to provide insightful guidance on wealth transfer issues.
fund.title: Patton Albertson & Miller
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Patton Albertson & Miller is a fee-only registered investment advisor founded in 2003 that provides comprehensive wealth management services to high-net-worth clients. The firm specializes in financial life management, including investment management, estate planning, tax planning, and risk management. In 2015, the company became a partner firm of Focus Financial Partners, a major milestone that expanded its resources.
fund.thesis: The firm operates as a fee-only fiduciary, focusing on creating personalized, comprehensive financial plans for affluent families and individuals, typically with $1 million or more to invest. Their strategy is to act as a 'Trusted Advisor,' navigating complex financial matters such as business succession, estate planning, and wealth transition to simplify finance and minimize tax implications for their clients. They serve clients across the United States from their offices in Georgia and Tennessee.

poc.description: Benno Smit is the Owner of Nieuwe Parklaan Family Office. His professional background includes experience in private banking and investment services. He has previously held positions at ABNAMRO, Robeco, and Rabobank. Benno studied General Economics and Spatial Sciences at the University of Groningen.
fund.title: Nieuwe Parklaan Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; real-estate
fund.description: Nieuwe Parklaan Family Office is a multi-family office based in The Hague, Netherlands, founded in 2004. The firm provides strategic wealth planning, coordinates independent asset management, and offers support on tax, insurance, and pension matters for affluent families. With a license from the Dutch Authority for the Financial Markets (AFM), they focus on preserving and growing multigenerational capital by mediating with and monitoring external service providers.
fund.thesis: Nieuwe Parklaan Family Office operates on an advisory and supervisory basis rather than as a direct investor. Their approach is to help wealthy individuals and families create a long-term financial plan based on their goals and risk tolerance, and then select and critically monitor appropriate external asset managers to execute that plan. The firm focuses on providing clients with alternatives and ensuring proper attention is given to their assets, which can include financial portfolios, private equity, and real estate participations.

poc.description: Jackson Huggett is a Director at Newmark, based in the Boca Raton office. He specializes in new business generation, as well as the marketing and sale of multifamily properties, land, and the structuring of joint ventures. Since joining Newmark in 2019, he has been involved in the sale of over $8 billion in multifamily assets throughout Southeast and Southwest Florida.
fund.title: Manchester Capital Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; hedge-funds; real-estate; impact-investing; private-debt
fund.description: Manchester Capital Management is a multi-family office founded in 1993 that provides tailored wealth management services to high-net-worth families. The firm is independently owned by its partners and select founding families, positioning itself as a leading fiduciary focused on investment management, family office services, and real estate advisory. Manchester Capital has been recognized as one of America's top registered investment advisors by publications like Barron's and CNBC.
fund.thesis: Manchester Capital Management employs a customized, client-centric investment strategy focused on long-term, multi-generational wealth preservation and growth. Their approach involves creating diversified portfolios that include traditional equities and ETFs, as well as alternative assets like private equity, hedge funds, private debt, and direct real estate. The firm has a growing interest in private market innovations, particularly within the AI, Life Sciences, and CleanTech sectors.

poc.description: Joakim D. Lehmkuhl is a Founder and the Chairman of Octogone Family Office (formerly Octogone Gestion SA), which he co-founded in 1995. His career in finance began in New York with Brown Brothers Harriman. Subsequently, he worked for the Investment Department of Orkla Borregaard in Norway, followed by a position as a Portfolio Manager at Ferrier Lullin & Cie, and later at Bearbull in Geneva. Mr. Lehmkuhl is an economics graduate from the University of Colorado in Boulder.
fund.title: Octogone Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; hedge-funds; financial-services
fund.description: Octogone Family Office is a multi-family office founded in 1995, providing personalized wealth management services to families and institutions. Headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, the firm offers discretionary and advisory portfolio management, consolidated reporting, and estate planning. In 2022, the Octogone Group joined Focus Financial Partners Inc., a global partnership of independent wealth management firms. Octogone has received recognition for its international presence, being named "Manager with International Offices outside of Switzerland" at the WealthBriefing Swiss EAM Awards in 2023 and "International Team" in 2024.
fund.thesis: Octogone's investment philosophy is centered on providing unbiased, independent, and customized advice to fit the specific needs and personal situation of each client. The firm's approach involves a thorough analysis of a client's objectives, risk tolerance, and liquidity needs to define a tailored investment strategy. They invest across various asset classes, including public markets (equities and bonds), private equity, and hedge funds, utilizing both direct investments and fund-of-funds strategies.
fund.geographies: Europe; USA; Latin America; Middle East

poc.description: Anish Patel is an Acquisitions & Investments Associate for a family office active in real estate, alternatives, venture capital, AI/ML, and IoT. His professional background and specific responsibilities in this role are not publicly available. His educational credentials include studies at Babson College and HBS Online, although further details are not specified in publicly accessible sources.
fund.title: Real Estate, Alternatives, Venture Capital, AI/ML, IoT, Funds
fund.sectors: real-estate; hospitality; financial-services; technology; healthcare; private-equity; public-markets
fund.description: NewcrestImage is a privately held family office investment firm based in Dallas, Texas, that was formed in 2013. The firm started primarily as a hotel developer and operator and has since diversified its holdings into a broader range of real estate assets and alternative investments. NewcrestImage is known for developing distinctive hotel properties, including dual-branded hotels and the adaptive reuse of historic buildings, and has received numerous industry awards. A key milestone was the January 2022 sale of a 27-hotel portfolio to Summit Hotel Properties for $822 million, which marked a strategic shift to focus more on acquisitions and third-party management partnerships.
fund.thesis: NewcrestImage's strategy focuses on opportunistically acquiring properties and portfolios, particularly those that may deter other buyers, and creating value through repositioning, renovation, or improved management. The firm actively buys and sells assets, often purchasing large portfolios, retaining desirable properties, and quickly selling the rest. While historically focused on hospitality across the U.S., the firm has diversified post-COVID to include public equities, financial institutions, a debt fund, and other alternative investments to balance its portfolio.

poc.description: San Yetlee is the Creative Director at NEON Adventures, a London-based single family office. In her role, she has led the interior design and overall branding for significant projects, including the Izza hotel in Marrakech, a property owned by Neon Adventures Ltd. Her work on the Izza hotel has been recognized in the AHEAD Awards for Hospitality Experience and Design. She is a recognized figure in the design and hospitality industry.
fund.title: NEON Adventures
fund.sectors: technology; real-estate; consumer; impact-investing; venture-capital; crypto-blockchain; ecommerce; software; saas; enterprise-software; education
fund.description: NEON Adventures is a single family office headquartered in London, United Kingdom, established in 2013. The firm has diversified interests, making venture capital, impact, and real estate investments across technology, property, lifestyle, and philanthropy sectors. NEON Adventures focuses on fostering innovation and growth, combining strategic investments with a commitment to creating long-term value and positive societal benefits.
fund.thesis: NEON Adventures invests in early-stage ventures, typically at the Pre-Seed and Seed stages. The firm focuses on technology, E-Commerce, SaaS, Enterprise Software, Blockchain, and Education, and generally participates in funding rounds with 3-4 other investors. While based in Europe, the firm's investment focus is global, with a significant number of investments in the United States.

poc.description: Etienne de Surmont is a Director at the family office Pater Familias. He has a background in private banking, having previously worked at Puilaetco and Banque Degroof Petercam. His career in the financial sector began after completing his education at IAG.
fund.title: Pater Familias
fund.sectors: financial-services

poc.description: Courtney Pullen serves as the Chief Learning Officer at Matter Family Office, where he leads the firm's Culture and Learning practice. He is responsible for helping families navigate the complexities of wealth across generations by facilitating family meetings, guiding succession and estate planning, and coaching family members. In addition to his role at Matter, he is the President of Pullen Consulting Group, which he founded in 1992. He holds a Master's degree in Counseling Psychology from the University of Northern Colorado and is a faculty member at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business for the Certified Private Wealth Advisor (CPWA) program.
fund.title: Matter Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; public-markets; fixed-income; commodities; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Matter Family Office is a private, independent multi-family office founded in 1990 that provides integrated investment management, wealth planning, and family learning services to high-net-worth families. [2, 3, 7] The firm is 100% privately held and serves clients nationally from its offices in St. Louis, Denver, and Dallas. [3, 12] Key recent milestones include a 2025 merger with IWP Family Office and a significant strategic partnership with BW Forsyth Partners in 2024 to support long-term, sustainable growth. [3, 8, 9]
fund.thesis: The firm's investment philosophy is grounded in the endowment model, with a primary focus on capital preservation and reducing volatility through significant diversification across various asset classes, geographies, and investment styles. [1, 2] Matter partners with Asset Consulting Group (ACG), an institutional consultant advising on over $100 billion, to access deep research, due diligence, and opportunities with respected investment managers. [1, 3] This approach is designed to build sophisticated, long-term portfolios that participate in global economic growth. [1]

poc.description: Grégory Hug joined Octogone in 2016. Prior to his current role, he advised private individuals and family offices on cross-asset investments. His earlier career includes working as a physical and paper oil trader from 2002 to 2011, a period in corporate finance at Deutsche Bank, and as an analyst in the Debt Capital Markets department at Chase Bank in London. Gregory graduated from EBS London with a BA, majoring in Economics.
fund.title: Octogone Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; financial-services; esg
fund.description: Octogone Family Office is a wealth management firm founded in 1995 in Geneva, Switzerland. The firm provides personalized asset management and family office services to a clientele of families and institutions across Europe, the USA, Latin America, and the Middle East. In 2022, the Octogone Group was acquired by Focus Financial Partners Inc., a leading global partnership of independent wealth management firms. Octogone has received recognition at the WealthBriefing Swiss EAM Awards in 2023 and 2024.
fund.thesis: Octogone's investment philosophy is centered on providing unbiased, independent, and tailor-made solutions that align with each client's specific needs, risk tolerance, and long-term objectives. Their approach emphasizes capital preservation and generating performance through a rigorous and dynamic investment process that includes investing in traditional assets, alternative and private equity funds, and direct investments. The firm is also sensitive to ESG considerations and integrates them into its investment analysis and decision-making.
fund.geographies: Europe; USA; Latin America; Middle East

poc.description: Kerem Ozmen is the Managing Director at Ozmen Ventures, a family office and venture capital firm. He is also the Co-Founder and CEO of 8090 Industries, an investment firm focused on the next industrial revolution, and the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of 8090 Partners. Previously, he was a Managing Director at Kairos K50 Fund and a Junior Partner at Kairos. He earned his graduate degree from the University of Nevada.
fund.title: Ozmen Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; ai-ml; aerospace; fintech; software; healthcare; crypto-blockchain; financial-services; technology; manufacturing
fund.description: Ozmen Ventures is an early-stage venture capital fund and family office founded in 2017 by Eren and Fatih Ozmen, the owners of Sierra Nevada Corporation. Based in Reno, Nevada, the firm was established to support innovative startups and cultivate the entrepreneurial ecosystem, with a particular focus on the Northern Nevada region. Ozmen Ventures invests in a variety of technology-driven sectors.
fund.thesis: Ozmen Ventures primarily invests in seed and early-stage companies located in the United States. The firm targets startups developing innovative solutions in sectors such as artificial intelligence, aerospace, fintech, enterprise applications, and high tech. Their investment approach is to support young and dynamic companies, filling a critical gap for early-stage capital in the local Reno area and beyond.

poc.description: Sheetal Patel serves as a Director at Narratus Capital, a role she has held since her appointment in October 2017. Narratus Capital operates as a family office and provides regulated managed accounts for private clients, focusing on creating total returns while preserving capital. As a Director, Sheetal Patel is one of the key officers of the company. Prior to her current role, there is limited publicly available information regarding her professional career and educational background.
fund.title: Narratus Capital
fund.sectors: public-markets; commodities
fund.description: Narratus Capital is a private family office incorporated on October 11, 2017, with its registered office in London. The firm provides regulated managed accounts for other family offices and private clients. Its official nature of business is registered as 'Activities of head offices'.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy focuses on a foreign exchange (FX) strategy, taking long and short positions primarily in G10 currencies. Their approach combines fundamental and technical analysis of trends and momentum, with a philosophy centered on creating total returns while minimizing downside volatility and preserving capital. Narratus Capital aims for double-digit returns with quantifiable risk, utilizing a progressive return model and seeking a minimum reward-to-risk ratio of 5:1.

poc.description: Ani Arutyunyan is a Senior Associate at Nimble Ventures, a single family office. Due to the private nature of her role and the limited public information available, further details regarding her specific responsibilities, career history, and educational background could not be independently verified through public search results.
fund.title: Nimble Ventures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; healthcare; biotech; fintech; consumer; crypto-blockchain; software; saas; enterprise-software; healthtech
fund.description: Nimble Ventures is a single family office and venture capital firm based in San Francisco, California. Founded in 2012, the firm focuses on early-stage investments in a variety of technology-driven sectors. Key team members include founder John Burbank, who also founded Nimble Partners as an evolution of his prior firm, Passport Capital.
fund.thesis: Nimble Ventures specializes in early-stage investments, typically at the Seed and Series A stages, in technology startups with innovative approaches and scalable business models. The firm invests globally, with a focus on the United States and Israel, targeting sectors such as technology, healthcare, biotech, fintech, consumer tech, and blockchain. They aim to support and nurture companies with high growth potential that can transform industries through cutting-edge solutions.
