poc.description: Jane Evans serves as the Chief Operating Officer at Legacy Advisors, a family office. She is a member of the firm's Executive Committee.
fund.title: Legacy Advisors
fund.sectors: financial-services; insurance; public-markets
fund.description: Legacy Advisors, LLC is a wealth management firm and family office providing comprehensive financial, investment, and estate planning services to high-net-worth, multi-generational families. [14, 17] Operating as an SEC-registered investment adviser since 2011, the firm focuses on delivering tailored advice and creating lasting legacies that align with their clients' values and community commitments. [2, 14] Their services are designed to address the sophisticated and complex needs of successful families, including business continuity and philanthropic planning. [14]
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy is centered on providing independent, objective advice from a fiduciary standpoint, with a focus on long-term, risk-adjusted returns. [2, 12] They create customized and diversified portfolios based on each client's specific goals, blending traditional and non-traditional investments to design tax-efficient solutions. [2, 12] The process is disciplined and involves ongoing monitoring and frequent reviews to adapt to changes in client life events or market conditions. [2]

poc.description: Mathias Lejeune is a Partner at PF Multi Family Office. Prior to his current role, he was a Senior Director for infrastructure solutions at CBRE Investment Management. His previous experience includes serving as Investor Relations Director at Ancala Partners, a European infrastructure mid-market manager, and as a Relationship Manager with a focus on infrastructure at Pantheon, a private markets manager. At Pantheon, he was promoted to Vice President in the Investor Relations and Marketing department.
fund.title: PF Multi Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate
fund.description: PF Multi Family Office is a multi-family office founded in 2019 by Philippe Feller, a former private banker. The firm is based in Monaco and provides a range of services to high-net-worth families, including wealth management, tax planning, real estate support, and family governance. Their primary goal is to ensure the long-term sustainability of their clients' assets while respecting their individual values.
fund.thesis: PF Multi Family Office operates as an independent family advisor, offering personalized and comprehensive advice tailored to each client's tax and family situation. Their investment philosophy is centered on the preservation of assets and promoting inter-generational harmony. They assist clients with a variety of financial matters, including estate consolidation, real estate transactions, and the ongoing monitoring of their assets, with a primary geographic focus on Monaco.

fund.title: Mozaic
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; venture-capital
fund.description: Mozaic LLC is an independent, privately owned multi-family office founded in 2007 and based in Beverly Hills, California. The firm provides outsourced chief investment officer (OCIO) and family office services to a select group of high-net-worth families, foundations, and corporations. Mozaic specializes in personalized wealth management, offering customized and diversified investment strategies.
fund.thesis: Mozaic's investment thesis centers on providing customized, objective investment advice and access to institutional-grade alternative investments. The firm works closely with its clients to understand their financial goals, risk tolerance, and cash flow needs to implement diversified investment strategies, often utilizing third-party investment managers. Mozaic primarily serves ultra-high-net-worth individuals, families, and charitable organizations, with a stated account minimum of $100,000,000.

poc.description: Emily M. Paul is a Certified Public Accountant at Paul | McCoy Family Office Service in Boston, MA. Publicly available documents confirm her role as a CPA and preparer for the firm. Further details regarding her professional history and educational background are not publicly available.
fund.title: Paul | McCoy Family Office Service
fund.description: Paul | McCoy Family Office Service is an exclusive multi-family office located in Boston, MA, founded in 2001. The firm's partners have over 50 years of combined experience serving the needs of high-net-worth individuals and families. They specialize in managing the complex financial lives of affluent families by integrating investment management, tax strategy, estate planning, and philanthropic administration into a single, fiduciary-focused platform.
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy is to preserve and grow intergenerational wealth through quiet, fiduciary-focused oversight. They partner closely with clients' existing advisors, trustees, and next-generation family members to provide comprehensive financial stewardship. Their services encompass investment management, tax, and estate planning, indicating a holistic approach to wealth management rather than a focus on singular, speculative investments.

poc.description: Philippe Feller is the Founder and Managing Director (Administrateur Délégué) of PF Multi Family Office, which he established in Monaco in 2019. With 40 years of experience in the financial sector across three countries, including 20 years in Monaco, he has an extensive background as a private banker for renowned institutions in Luxembourg and Monaco. At PF MFO, he acts as a coordinator for families, providing comprehensive and tailored advice on wealth management, tax planning, and asset consolidation. His firm specializes in assisting high-net-worth individuals, including high-level athletes.
fund.title: PF Multi Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate
fund.description: PF Multi Family Office is a multi-family office founded in 2019 by Philippe Feller and based in Monaco. The firm provides a range of wealth management services to high-net-worth families, including tax planning, real estate support, and family governance. Their primary objective is to ensure the long-term sustainability of their clients' assets while respecting their individual values.
fund.thesis: PF Multi Family Office operates as a family advisor, offering independent and personalized services with the core mission of preserving and sustaining their clients' wealth across generations. The firm focuses on providing comprehensive and tailor-made advice that aligns with the client's tax and family situation, acting solely in the interest of their clients. Their geographic focus is primarily on serving families in Monaco.

poc.description: Megan Bleil is a Partner and Family Office Advisor at Pennington Partners & Co. with over 18 years of experience in the financial services industry. She is responsible for building long-term relationships with operating partner families and providing them with sophisticated service. Her career began in finance at a commercial mortgage firm, followed by seven years at Fortigent LLC and ten years at Bronfman E.L. Rothschild, where she managed 40 family relationships. Megan holds a Bachelor of Arts in Religious Studies from Allegheny College and a FINRA Series 65 License.
fund.title: Pennington Partners & Co
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; private-debt; technology; fintech; growth-capital
fund.description: Pennington Partners & Co. is a multi-family office founded in 2016 to serve the needs of entrepreneurial founders, CEOs, and their families. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services including investment management, wealth planning, and financial administration. Pennington Partners is recognized as an award-winning multi-family office, dedicated to managing complex multi-generational wealth.
fund.thesis: Pennington Partners' investment thesis focuses on building customized, holistic portfolios with an emphasis on differentiated, tax-advantaged alternative investments. They seek to align interests by investing alongside their clients, targeting small growth and buyout managers with specialist strategies, particularly those with a technology element. The firm's geographic focus is primarily on North America and Western Europe.

poc.description: Guy Scott serves as the Chief Compliance Officer at Pennington Partners & Co., where he brings over 20 years of experience in regulatory compliance within the financial services industry. In his role, he is responsible for architecting the compliance framework. Prior to joining Pennington, he was a Senior Compliance Manager at American Capital, Ltd., and also founded and managed his own compliance consulting firm, Guyscott Consulting Inc. His previous experience also includes serving as CCO of Institutional Shareholders Services. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Management - Investment Finance from the University of Maryland Global Campus and a Bachelor of Science in Public Affairs Management – Economics from Michigan State University.
fund.title: Pennington Partners & Co
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; technology; financial-services
fund.description: Pennington Partners & Co. is a private multi-family office founded in 2016 to provide advisory and investment management services to successful entrepreneurial families. The firm specializes in multi-generational wealth management, offering services such as family governance, investment management, and comprehensive family office solutions. Pennington Partners has been recognized for its work, winning the Best Multi-Family Office award in the $2.5 Billion to $5.0 Billion AuM/AuA category at the Eleventh Annual Family Wealth Report Awards.
fund.thesis: Pennington Partners' investment thesis centers on providing bespoke, holistic investment management tailored for founders, executives, and multigenerational families, with a philosophy of aligning interests by investing alongside their clients. They focus on differentiated, tax-advantaged alternative investments, including private equity and real estate, alongside traditional portfolio management. The firm targets investments in small growth and buyout managers with specialist strategies, particularly those backing "bootstrap businesses" that have scaled without institutional capital, and has a geographic focus on North America and Western Europe.

poc.description: Graham Jones serves as Vice President, Investments at Pittco Capital Partners, a single-family office. In this role, he is involved in managing a part of Pittco's public equity portfolio and participates in the sourcing, evaluation, and monitoring of direct investments. Prior to joining Pittco, he was an associate attorney at King & Spalding LLP in Atlanta, where he advised private equity and venture capital firms on various transactions. He holds a Bachelor of Accountancy and a Master of Taxation from the University of Mississippi, as well as a Doctor of Jurisprudence from Vanderbilt University Law School.
fund.title: Pittco Capital Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; growth-capital; real-estate; technology; financial-services; healthcare; media; telecommunications; energy; manufacturing
fund.description: Pittco Capital Partners is the single-family office for Joseph R. “Pitt” Hyde III, the founder of AutoZone, and his wife, Barbara. Established over 30 years ago, the Memphis-based firm provides investment, accounting, tax, and financial services. Pittco has a history of successful investments and is also closely linked to the Hyde Family Foundation, which focuses on philanthropic efforts in Memphis, TN.
fund.thesis: Pittco's investment strategy is diversified across three main areas: managed funds with outsourced expertise, direct investments in compelling opportunities, and multi-family housing opportunities. Their direct investments span various stages, including early and late-stage venture capital, buyouts, and public-to-private transactions. While they invest globally, there is a stated emphasis on opportunities within the United States, particularly the Southeast.

poc.description: Jon Hottinger is a Principal on the Investment Team at Pittco Capital Partners, where he is primarily responsible for managing the firm's hedged equities, absolute return, and energy and natural resources portfolios. With over two decades of experience, he has a significant background in investment banking, having held positions at FORVIS Corporate Finance, BB&T Capital Markets, and Avitas Capital. Previously, he was the Director of Corporate Development for Synalloy Corporation and began his career at a boutique technology and business process consulting firm. Jon earned his BS in Systems Engineering from the University of Virginia and an MBA from Vanderbilt University.

Pittco has a history of investing in a variety of opportunities, including being a minority owner of the Memphis Grizzlies.
fund.thesis: Pittco's investment strategy is diversified across three main areas: managed funds where investment risk is outsourced to external managers, direct investments in compelling opportunities across various stages from early-stage venture capital to buyouts, and investments in multi-family housing. They seek to partner with strong management teams and invest in businesses with the potential for significant growth.

fund.description: Checkmate Capital is a multi-family office and advisory group founded in 2017 with its headquarters in Pasadena, California. Checkmate Capital specializes in sectors such as biotechnology, energy technology, and agriculture technology, leveraging its team's experience from institutions like Morgan Stanley, BlackRock, and Panasonic.
fund.thesis: Checkmate Capital invests in companies, primarily in North America, that have reached a growth inflection point and are positioned to disrupt large, addressable markets. The firm partners with its portfolio companies, often investing its own funds, to implement growth strategies and provide transactional support. It utilizes its global presence, with offices and team members in North America, East Asia, and the Middle East, to create opportunities for portfolio companies to access new markets and partners.

poc.description: Brian Hatton is a Partner at QVentures, a venture capital firm, and has been with the company since 2017. He is also a member of the Investment Committee for the QVentures Pre-Seed Fund and an Angel Investor in the member-managed Flywheel Fund. With a career spanning over two decades, Brian has extensive international experience in venture investing, fundraising, and financial markets. His educational background includes an MBA in Finance from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business and an MSc in Accounting and Finance from The London School of Economics and Political Science.
fund.title: QVentures

fund.description: QVentures is a London-based venture capital firm founded in 2013. It operates as a members-only investment club, providing direct investment opportunities and fund management for a community of individual angels, Ultra-High Net Worth Individuals (UHNWIs), family offices, and institutional investors. QVentures has participated in rounds with a combined size of over £351 million in 115 companies and also advises on a Pre-Seed Fund focused on UK-based software companies.
fund.thesis: QVentures invests in high-growth, revenue-generating technology companies from pre-seed to Series C, with a focus on Seed to Series B rounds. As technology generalists, they look for disruptive companies with strong management teams, a proven product-market fit, large addressable markets, and a clear path to profitability, investing primarily in the United Kingdom. Their Pre-Seed fund specifically targets UK-based founders creating software-driven solutions to disrupt traditional industries.

Following his military service, he founded Anima Regni Partners, a single-family office, and later served as President & CEO of Modern Holdings Incorporated. Mr. Guy holds a Bachelor of Science degree from the United States Naval Academy and an MBA from Vanderbilt University.

poc.description: Tony Zeiger, CFA, serves as the Chief Investment Officer at PeakView Private Investment Office. His career history includes roles as a Portfolio Manager at Jagged Peak, an Analyst at Citadel, and an Associate at Bear Stearns. He holds a BBA in Finance from the Texas McCombs School of Business.
fund.title: PeakView Private Investment Office
fund.sectors: public-markets; private-equity; private-debt; fixed-income; commodities; real-estate; venture-capital; financial-services; esg
fund.description: PeakView Private Investment Office is a tailored investment management solution for private family wealth based in Geneva, Switzerland. Founded in 2015, the firm operates as a dedicated investment partner for a select number of wealthy families and individuals, helping them oversee and manage sizeable and complex financial assets. It aims to provide a higher level of sophistication and customization than traditional investment managers, integrating with a client's existing banking and family office arrangements.
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy is centered on total customization, aligning every aspect of its service and portfolio management with the client's unique objectives. They take an institutional approach, seeking opportunities across the entire spectrum of global public markets, private markets, and direct capital transactions, aiming to access sophisticated investments beyond the reach of typical wealth management firms. This is combined with dynamic risk management and continuous, real-time portfolio monitoring.

poc.description: Arthur Liu serves as a Director – Partnership at NF Trinity, a role he assumed in 2024. His career in finance began at Arthur Andersen. Mr. Liu has gained extensive experience working with prominent financial institutions such as N.M. Rothschild, Citi Private Bank, DBS Private Bank, and PwC, where he provided investment banking, wealth management, and consulting services to Chinese family businesses. He also co-founded an RMB private equity fund focused on growth stage investments and holds a Bachelor's degree in International Accounting from the University of International Business and Economics.
fund.title: NF Trinity
fund.sectors: private-equity; technology; healthcare; healthtech; public-markets; financial-services
fund.description: NF Trinity is the financial investment arm and family office of the Nan Fung Group, a Hong Kong-based conglomerate founded in 1954. The firm operates as a multi-family office, managing diversified portfolios for high-net-worth families and institutional investors. NF Trinity focuses on multiple asset classes, including public securities, private direct investments, and private market funds, with a global presence.
fund.thesis: NF Trinity pursues a long-term, multi-asset global investment strategy with an objective to achieve strong compounded returns in a steady risk-adjusted manner. The firm invests across various asset classes, sectors, and regions, including public and private markets, and leverages dedicated teams for each. They have a global investment scope with a focus on Asia, the US, and Europe, and are expanding their presence in the United States.

His professional background includes experience in the real estate sector, having previously held the position of Agency Director at Powers Properties in Monaco. fund.title: PF Multi Family Office
fund.sectors: real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: PF Multi Family Office is a multi-family office established in 2019 and based in Monaco. Founded by Philippe Feller, the firm provides a range of services to high-net-worth families, including wealth management, tax planning, real estate support, and philanthropy advisory. Their primary focus is on serving families within Monaco, offering personalized and independent advice to ensure the long-term preservation of their clients' assets.
fund.thesis: PF Multi Family Office's investment philosophy centers on providing comprehensive, tailor-made advice aligned with their clients' tax and family situations, with a primary objective of ensuring the sustainability of their assets. They act as a family advisor, operating with independence and in the sole interest of their clients to help them make appropriate decisions in a complex information environment. Their services include overall asset allocation and investment strategy, as well as managing and advising on banking relationships.

poc.description: Troy Noard is a Managing Director of the Private Investments group of PSP Partners and a member of the investment committee. He joined the firm in 2011 and leads the Business & Technology Services sector focus, where his responsibilities include strategy development, execution, and portfolio company oversight. Prior to joining PSP Partners, he was a Partner at Frontenac Company for 13 years and also worked in investment banking at Goldman Sachs. Mr. Noard earned a Bachelor of Arts degree from DePauw University and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business.
fund.title: PSP Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; technology; software; manufacturing
fund.description: PSP Partners is a diversified global private investment firm founded in 2011 by Penny Pritzker, continuing her family's long legacy of building and investing in businesses. The firm operates through three main arms: PSP Capital for buyouts of established companies, PSP Growth for venture capital investments in emerging businesses, and Pritzker Realty Group for real estate investments. PSP Partners leverages its extensive network and experience to foster long-term, values-driven partnerships aimed at creating strong performance and societal impact.
fund.thesis: PSP Partners follows a long-term, fundamental investment approach, focusing on partnerships with companies that share its core values of integrity, discretion, and candor. The firm invests across various stages, from earlier-stage, high-growth B2B software companies to established, market-leading businesses in the advanced industrials and business and technology services sectors. PSP Partners has a flexible capital structure that allows for investments in operating companies, real assets, and both public and private securities, seeking to amplify growth and drive value creation.

poc.description: Caitlyn Johnson is an Investment Analyst at Perot Investments, where she underwrites and invests in public and private debt and equity opportunities. Prior to joining Perot in 2019, she was with Goldman Sachs in the Special Situations Group, focusing on principal investing and lending to middle-market companies. Caitlyn graduated summa cum laude from Southern Methodist University with a BBA in Finance, specializing in Alternative Asset Management and concentrating in Real Estate Finance.
fund.title: Perot Investments
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; technology; software; real-estate; financial-services; media; telecommunications; aerospace
fund.description: Perot Investments is the family office of the Perot family, founded by entrepreneur Ross Perot, who established successful ventures like Electronic Data Systems (EDS) and Perot Systems. The firm, operating as Petrus Asset Management, partners with business owners and management teams to provide long-term capital and support. Its legacy is rooted in the creation of the IT services sector and continues with investments in various industries, including real estate through its affiliate Hillwood.
fund.thesis: Perot Investments is industry-agnostic and seeks to acquire majority stakes in middle-market companies through recapitalizations, management buyouts, and corporate divestitures. With a flexible and patient investment approach and a generational time horizon, they invest across the capital structure in companies at various life cycle stages. Through its affiliate Perot Holdings, the firm typically invests $25 million to $100 million in companies with a minimum EBITDA of $5 million.

poc.description: Senapathy 'Kris' Gopalakrishnan is a co-founder of Infosys, where he served as CEO and Managing Director from 2007 to 2011 and as Vice Chairman until 2014. He is the Chairman of Axilor Ventures, a startup accelerator, and manages his family's investments through Pratithi Investments, his private investment arm. Mr. Gopalakrishnan holds master's degrees in physics and computer science from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, and is involved in various philanthropic initiatives, particularly in scientific research and entrepreneurship through the Pratiksha Trust.
fund.title: Pratithi Investments
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; private-debt; technology; healthcare; consumer; financial-services
fund.description: Pratithi Investments is the private investment arm and single-family office of Kris Gopalakrishnan, a co-founder of Infosys. Founded in 2015, the firm supports innovation and enterprise in India through financial investments and strategic assistance. Pratithi has invested in over 100 startups and more than 20 venture and private equity funds across various sectors.
fund.thesis: Pratithi Investments is sector-agnostic and primarily focuses on late-stage debt and equity investments in Indian startups. The firm's thesis is to back companies with strong founders, well-developed products, and high standards of corporate governance, co-investing alongside leading institutional investors. They prefer to invest in capital-efficient companies and aim to support entrepreneurship, technological advances, and scientific research within India.

poc.description: Remo Stebler is the Deputy Chief Executive Officer at Proseba (Schweiz) AG, a single family office. He has over 20 years of leadership experience at the intersection of governance, technology, and operations of family offices. Previously, he has served as a CEO, COO, and board member for a multi-jurisdictional family office. In addition to his roles in family offices, Mr. Stebler founded Initcon, an advisory firm specializing in IT, cybersecurity, and digital transformation for clients in regulated environments.
fund.title: Proseba (Schweiz) AG
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; financial-services; impact-investing
fund.description: Proseba (Schweiz) AG is a single-family office headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, founded on December 23, 2008. The firm's purpose is to provide advisory and services related to asset management, including fund management and financial transactions. As a family office, it focuses on managing and preserving multi-generational wealth through asset allocation, direct investments, and alternative strategies, with an emphasis on long-term capital preservation and risk management.
fund.thesis: Proseba (Schweiz) AG engages in a disciplined approach to asset allocation and risk management across public and private markets to support long-term financial stewardship. The company's legal purpose allows for the establishment of subsidiaries, participation in companies with similar objectives, and the acquisition and management of real estate in Switzerland and abroad. There is a noted cooperation with the Perpetua Family Office in London, which coordinates services in real estate, private equity, wealth management, and philanthropy.

poc.description: Diedrik Oost is a Partner at Ramphastos Investments, where he is co-responsible for deal sourcing, investment opportunity screening, deal execution, and portfolio management. He joined the firm in 2016 and was appointed as a partner in May 2024. Prior to his tenure at Ramphastos, he worked for several years at the financial advisory firm Lazard, where he was involved in cross-border M&A transactions, IPOs, and refinancings. Mr. Oost holds a Master's degree in Finance & Law from the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam / Duisenberg School of Finance and also studied at the Copenhagen Business School.
fund.title: Ramphastos Investments
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; financial-services; retail; media; manufacturing; energy; aerospace; telecommunications; transportation; ecommerce; technology
fund.description: Ramphastos Investments is a Dutch venture capital and private equity firm founded in 1994 by entrepreneur Marcel Boekhoorn. The firm focuses on driving top-line growth in companies at all stages, from startups to mature enterprises. A notable achievement was the acquisition of Telfort, a Dutch mobile provider, and its sale within nine months to KPN for over a billion euros.
fund.thesis: Ramphastos primarily acquires majority stakes in companies with a unique competitive position, strong intrinsic growth potential, and favorable underlying market trends. Their strategy focuses on driving revenue growth through methods like buy-and-build strategies, internationalization, and strategic partnerships. The firm invests across a wide range of sectors and is primarily active in several European countries, including the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, Italy, Spain, and Malta.

He focuses on identifying and managing private equity investments and is involved in business development for the firm. With over 30 years of experience, he has been involved in investing in and growing over 300 middle-market companies. Prior to co-founding Promus, Andy was a founder and longtime partner at CHS Capital, a middle-market private equity firm he co-founded in 1988.
fund.title: Promus Equity

fund.description: Promus Equity Partners is a private investment firm affiliated with the multi-family office Promus Holdings, which was established by the Code and Musso families in 2008. Founded in 2010, the firm focuses on direct private equity investments in lower-middle-market companies. Promus Equity Partners leverages its flexible capital and extensive experience to partner with management teams and accelerate growth in its portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: Promus Equity Partners targets profitable lower-middle-market businesses with revenues under $150 million and EBITDA up to $15 million. The firm has a flexible investment mandate, allowing for various transaction types including leveraged buyouts, management buyouts, recapitalizations, and both majority and minority positions. Their primary geographic focus is the United States and Canada, with a preference for sectors such as business services, consumer products, distribution, education, food & beverage, healthcare, and proprietary industrial products.

poc.description: Theodore J. Davies is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Reicon Capital, LLC, a private investment firm established in 2000. At Reicon, he is involved in the firm's investment activities across various asset classes. Prior to co-founding Reicon Capital, Mr. Davies worked at FleetBoston Robertson Stephens, Inc., where he was responsible for originating and executing public and private high-yield debt transactions. His earlier career included positions at Lehman Brothers and Merrill Lynch, focusing on high-yield transactions.
fund.title: Reicon Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; private-debt; real-estate; hedge-funds; public-markets; consumer; software
fund.description: Reicon Capital, LLC is a private investment management firm founded in 2000 and based in Atlanta, Georgia. The firm was established after the sale of a family-owned private company to manage the family's investment portfolio internally. Reicon Capital actively manages discretionary capital across public markets and has a diverse portfolio of alternative investments, including private equity, credit, hedge funds, and real estate.
fund.thesis: Reicon Capital operates as a multi-family office, deploying flexible capital across various market cycles for its founding family and aligned investors. The firm's strategy involves constructing diversified, risk-adjusted portfolios that encompass public equity, options strategies, private equity, real estate, and private credit. They leverage their team's background as investment bankers and relationships in business and asset management to access distinctive investment opportunities.

poc.description: Paul J. Marinelli is the Founder and President of RiverGlades Family Offices, LLC, a firm he established in Naples, Florida in 2014. His career in investment management includes experience at large asset management companies and assisting in the growth of newly formed Registered Investment Advisory (RIA) firms. Prior to founding RiverGlades, he held positions at Naples Capital Advisors, Antonetti Capital Management, LLC, Clearbridge Advisors, LLC, Citigroup Global Markets Inc., and Morgan Stanley. Mr. Marinelli earned a degree in Economics from Duke University and holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and Certified Private Wealth Advisor® (CPWA®) designations.
fund.title: RiverGlades Family Offices
fund.sectors: public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; venture-capital
fund.description: RiverGlades Family Offices, LLC is a registered investment advisor founded in May 2014 by Paul J. Marinelli III in Naples, Florida. The firm provides bespoke investment management and family wealth consulting services to high-net-worth individuals, families with multi-generational wealth, and non-profit organizations. It was established to offer clients a combination of forward-thinking investment management and attentive personal service, addressing a gap experienced by affluent investors.
fund.thesis: RiverGlades employs a global, multi-asset class approach, using portfolio optimization to establish a recommended allocation based on client goals, risk tolerance, and time horizon. The firm's strategies include fundamental and technical analysis, modern portfolio theory, and long-term trading, with a focus on risk management and diversifying risk to provide long-term asset growth. They seek to allocate more capital to investment markets with higher expected returns and view the portfolio as having a global opportunity set.

poc.description: Robert Walsh is the Managing Partner at QVentures, a venture capital firm. He leads the team and is responsible for the firm's venture capital investments in early-stage companies, catering to a network of Family Offices and UHNWIs. Prior to his role at QVentures, Robert accumulated 30 years of experience in investment banking, holding management positions at notable firms including Credit Suisse, DrKW (Dresdner Kleinwort), and UniCredit.
fund.title: QVentures
fund.sectors: venture-capital; technology; saas; enterprise-software; fintech; healthtech; consumer; education
fund.description: QVentures is a London-based venture capital firm founded in 2013 that provides direct and fund investment opportunities to a network of Family Offices, UHNWIs, and Institutional Investors. The firm sources, screens, and invests in top-tier start-ups, having participated in rounds with a combined size of over £351m in 115 companies. QVentures also has a fund management arm, notably a Pre-Seed SEIS Fund focused on UK technology companies.
fund.thesis: QVentures invests in high-growth, revenue-generating companies from pre-seed to Series C, with a focus on enterprise software, marketplaces, and consumer technology. They seek disruptive companies with proven product-market fit, quality management teams addressing large addressable markets, and a clear pathway to profitability. The firm's primary geographic focus is the United Kingdom, and they invest in early-stage technology companies with valuations typically ranging from £500k to £4M for their pre-seed fund.

poc.description: Terris Chorney is the Executive VP of Opportunity Procurement at PIC Investment Group. He has extensive experience in business management and investment banking, where he was involved in raising over $17.5 billion in capital and advised on $21.0 billion in M&A assignments. In his current role, he focuses on working with PIC's portfolio companies to help them operate and grow, and is also responsible for broader opportunities for PIC to acquire more businesses. Terris holds an M.B.A. from the University of Alberta and is a P. Eng.
fund.title: PIC Investment Group
fund.sectors: venture-capital; private-equity; technology; software; healthcare; healthtech; fintech; real-estate; energy; manufacturing; consumer; hospitality; transportation; agriculture; financial-services; insurance; aerospace
fund.description: PIC Investment Group is a family office based in Saskatoon, Canada, founded in 1976. It operates as a diversified holding company, managing a portfolio of wholly-owned and partially-owned operating companies, as well as making venture capital and private equity investments. The firm also provides comprehensive support services to its portfolio companies, including financial, HR, and management expertise. Originally a chemical distribution company, it has grown into a significant business with a diverse portfolio across various sectors.
fund.thesis: PIC Investment Group's investment thesis centers on a hands-on, value-add approach, seeking to facilitate entrepreneurship and the growth of existing businesses through equity investments on a majority or minority basis. They prioritize the quality of the management team and look for opportunities with strong market potential, financial viability, and a clear exit strategy, typically within a 5 to 8-year timeframe. While their sector focus is broad, they have notable interests in industries complementary to their operating companies, including agriculture, healthcare, and various industrial sectors, with a primary geographic focus on Western Canada.

poc.description: Ghislaine Martinotti serves as the Office Manager at PF Multi Family Office. Details regarding her previous professional experience and educational background are not publicly available.
fund.title: PF Multi Family Office
fund.sectors: real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: PF Multi Family Office is a Monaco-based firm founded in 2019 by Philippe Feller. The firm provides comprehensive and personalized wealth management services to high-net-worth families, with a primary objective of ensuring the long-term preservation and sustainability of their clients' assets. PF Multi Family Office acts as a family advisor, offering services that include financial and estate planning, real estate support, and tax advisory.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on acting as an independent and trusted advisor, providing bespoke advice that is tailored to the specific tax and family situation of each client. Their philosophy is to defend the sole interests of their clients and to foster inter-generational harmony for the preservation of assets. PF Multi Family Office leverages a network of specialists in sectors such as banking, real estate, and taxation to provide comprehensive solutions, with a primary geographic focus on Monaco, while also assisting with international relocation and tax planning.

poc.description: Adam C. is a Partner at Promus Equity, where he is actively involved in all aspects of the investment process for the firm's private equity direct investing strategy. His responsibilities include sourcing, due diligence, deal execution, and the management and monitoring of portfolio companies. Prior to joining Promus in 2018, he gained 13 years of experience in mergers and acquisitions, having worked at Creation Investments and as an analyst in the investment banking department at William Blair & Company.
fund.title: Promus Equity
fund.sectors: private-equity; consumer; manufacturing; education; healthcare; financial-services; transportation
fund.description: Promus Equity Partners is a private investment firm based in Chicago, Illinois, operating as an affiliate of the multi-family office Promus Holdings. Founded in 2010, the firm specializes in direct private equity investments, focusing on lower-middle-market companies. Promus partners with management teams to foster growth through strategic initiatives and acquisitions.
fund.thesis: Promus Equity employs a flexible investment mandate, targeting profitable lower-middle-market businesses with sustainable market positions and revenues under $150 million. The firm seeks companies with an EBITDA of up to $15 million and invests across various sectors, including consumer products, industrial growth, education, and business services. Their investment approach allows for leveraged buyouts, management buyouts, recapitalizations, and both minority and majority ownership positions.

poc.description: Thomas Ellis serves as a Portfolio Manager at Lone Oak Trust Company. His previous experience includes a role as an Investment Analyst at Kentucky Retirement Systems. He holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance from the University of Kentucky.
fund.title: Lone Oak Trust Company
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Lone Oak Trust Company is an independent trust company based in Fort Worth, Texas, that was approved for a charter in 2022. The firm's primary focus is providing professional and confidential trust and estate services for high-net-worth individuals and families. As a fiduciary, it does not market proprietary investment products and sets itself apart through flexible and personal service.
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy centers on taking a holistic approach to a client's complete financial situation, providing continuity of administration across generations. It utilizes an open architecture approach for investment oversight, allowing collaboration with clients' pre-existing financial advisors, attorneys, and accountants. The core service is managing and administering trust affairs as a corporate trustee, agent, or custodian, ensuring the client's intentions are fulfilled.

poc.description: Penny Pritzker is the Founder and Chairman of PSP Partners, a private investment firm with ventures in real estate, hedge funds, and startups. With over 30 years of experience, she is an entrepreneur, civic leader, and philanthropist. Previously, she served as the 38th U.S. Secretary of Commerce from June 2013 to January 2017. Ms. Pritzker has founded several other businesses, including Vi Senior Living and The Parking Spot, and has served on the boards of Microsoft, TransUnion, and Hyatt Hotels Corporation.
fund.title: PSP Partners
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; real-estate; manufacturing; technology; software; enterprise-software
fund.description: PSP Partners is a global private investment firm founded in 2011 by Penny Pritzker, continuing her family's legacy of building and investing in businesses. The firm operates through three main strategies: PSP Capital for buyouts of established companies, PSP Growth for venture capital investments in emerging businesses, and Pritzker Realty Group for real estate investments. PSP Partners leverages its extensive network and experience to foster long-term, value-driven partnerships aimed at creating strong performance and societal impact.
fund.thesis: PSP Partners pursues a long-term, fundamental investment approach focused on building durable businesses and real estate assets. The firm targets sectors where it has deep experience, including advanced industrials, business and technology services, and real estate. For its buyout strategy, PSP Capital typically invests $100-300 million in established, market-leading businesses, while its venture capital arm, PSP Growth, makes initial investments of $1-5 million in high-growth B2B software companies with the potential for follow-on investments up to $25 million.

poc.description: Alex M. serves as the Chief Operating Officer at Salsano Family Office. Further details regarding his professional background, responsibilities, and career history would be available on his LinkedIn profile.
fund.title: Salsano Family Office
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; technology; venture-capital
fund.description: Salsano Family Office (S.F.O.) is the single-family office of businessman and philanthropist Sandro Salsano, founded in 2007. The firm invests its proprietary capital primarily in real estate, private equity, and technology. Notable achievements include Sandro Salsano being named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum and featured on the cover of Forbes in April 2019, which dubbed him "the Warren Buffett of Central America".
fund.thesis: Salsano Family Office pursues a long-term, deep value investment strategy with a typical horizon of 10 years or more. While sector-agnostic, they have a core focus on logistics, green food, fintech, wastewater, and renewables, and have also been involved in co-investments with other families and funds. The firm has a global investment approach with a particular emphasis on emerging markets, especially in Latin America.

poc.description: Kent Andrews serves as Partner, Investments at Pennington Partners & Co., where he is responsible for sourcing, underwriting, structuring, and monitoring alternative investments across private equity and private credit. He plays a key role in shaping the firm's investment strategy and asset allocation policy and is a member of the firm's asset allocation and general investment committees. Prior to his current role, he was a Vice President and started at the firm as an Investment Analyst. He is a graduate of UNC Chapel Hill with a BS in Business Administration from the Kenan-Flagler Business School and a BA in Economics.
fund.title: Pennington Partners & Co
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; growth-capital; private-debt; hedge-funds; financial-services
fund.description: Pennington Partners & Co. is a private multi-family office founded in 2016 to serve the complex financial needs of ultra-high-net-worth families, particularly successful entrepreneurs, CEOs, and founders. The firm provides a comprehensive suite of services including investment management, wealth planning, and personal financial administration, operating as an extension of their clients' family offices. In 2023, Pennington Partners was recognized as the Best 'Multi-Family Office (Up to and Including $2.5 Billion AuM/AuA)' at the Tenth Annual Family Wealth Report Awards.
fund.thesis: Pennington Partners' investment thesis revolves around providing bespoke, holistic financial solutions and aligning interests by investing alongside their partner families. They focus on sourcing differentiated, tax-advantaged alternative investments and have a specific interest in smaller growth and buyout managers with specialist strategies in North America and Western Europe. The firm's private equity platform, Pennington Private Access, builds curated portfolios of funds and direct co-investments in specialized niches, particularly targeting companies that have not yet taken on institutional capital.

Their approach is to foster innovation and provide customized solutions for small and medium-sized enterprises across various industries.

poc.description: Ashli Blumenfeld is the Marketing Director at Penrose Fort Worth, a single family office. She joined the firm in the summer of 2011, bringing her energy and enthusiasm to the role. In addition to her position at Penrose, she also serves as the Co-President of Standard Meat Company. Prior to her current roles, Ashli spent five years in New York City, working in the communications department at the Italian fashion house Ermenegildo Zegna and later as the Public Relations and Events Manager at St. John Knits. She earned her Bachelor of Arts in Communication with a minor in Business from Tulane University, graduating Cum Laude.

fund.description: Penrose is a third-generation single-family office for the Rosenthal family, founded by Billy Rosenthal in 1998. Based in Fort Worth, Texas, the firm has a long-standing history of over 40 years rooted in the family's multi-generational success in the food industry, notably with Standard Meat Company. Penrose makes diverse, long-term investments across a wide array of sectors, leveraging its extensive experience to foster growth in its partner organizations.
fund.thesis: Penrose's investment philosophy is centered on making sound, long-term investments in people and building relationships with trusted partners. The firm seeks to add value and influence to its portfolio companies, working hands-on to positively affect outcomes. Their strategy is sector-agnostic, with a diverse portfolio that includes private equity, venture capital, real estate, public equities, and fixed income across industries like manufacturing, technology, healthcare, and entertainment.

poc.description: Sandro Salsano is the Chairman of the Salsano Family Office and President of the Salsano Group, a private conglomerate investing in real estate, private equity, and technology. His career began at Scottish Widows Investment Partnership in London, and he later became a partner in an investment bank that was partially acquired by Goldman Sachs. Mr. Salsano graduated with honors from Bocconi University, completed an MBA exchange program at the University of San Diego, and has also studied at Harvard Business School, Princeton, and Oxford University. He was recognized as a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum.
fund.title: Salsano Family Office

fund.description: Salsano Family Office (SFO) is the single-family office of businessman and philanthropist Sandro Salsano. Founded in 2007, the firm invests its proprietary capital primarily in real estate, private equity, and technology. Sandro Salsano was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum, and Forbes featured him on its April 2019 cover, calling him "the Warren Buffett of Central America".
fund.thesis: The firm focuses on direct private equity investments with a very long-term horizon, typically 10 years or more. While generally sector-agnostic, their core areas of interest include logistics, green food, fintech, wastewater, and renewables. Geographically, Salsano Family Office invests globally with a particular focus on emerging markets in Latin America.

fund.title: Reinicke Family Office

fund.description: Reinicke Family Office is a multi-family office located in Baden-Baden, Germany, established in 2005. The firm manages the capital generated from the Reinicke family's industrial services and maintenance engineering ventures, and also provides investment and advisory services to other affluent families. They focus on structuring diversified portfolios and providing disciplined, succession-minded wealth stewardship.
fund.thesis: Reinicke Family Office's investment thesis centers on the preservation and growth of family assets across generations. They structure diversified portfolios that span public markets, real estate, private equity, and direct investments in operating companies. The firm's approach is to provide disciplined wealth management with a long-term, succession-oriented perspective.

poc.description: Ken De Stefano serves as a Director at Reig Capital. His career history includes a position as Vice President at deMorgan & Co., Inc. He also has experience as an Associate at the same firm. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance from the University of Southern California.

fund.description: Reig Capital is a single-family office established in 1998 to manage the investments of the Reig Moles family. Based in Andorra, the firm has an international presence and operates across several sectors, including real estate, hospitality, private equity, and financial services. Historically, the family's business activities also included the tobacco industry.
fund.thesis: Reig Capital is dedicated to the long-term management and growth of the family's assets, deploying international teams to support its business interests in various countries. The firm focuses on a range of sectors, including real estate, hotels, and private equity investments in areas such as industry, fashion, and luxury goods. Their investment approach is characterized by a long-term vision and a commitment to value creation.

Brad is a CFA Charterholder, bringing extensive experience in investment management to his role.
fund.title: Premis Advisors
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Premis Advisors is a Registered Investment Advisor (RIA) and multi-family office founded in 2016 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management services, including investment advisory, estate planning, and philanthropic guidance, to a limited number of ultra-high-net-worth families. Operating with the intimacy of a private bank or family office, Premis emphasizes its independence from traditional broker-dealers to offer a purely client-centered, fiduciary mandate.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy focuses on creating bespoke portfolio allocations tailored to each client's specific risk tolerance and financial goals. Their approach involves a disciplined, process-driven method for portfolio construction, execution, and risk management, which includes strategies for diversifying concentrated equity positions and managing liabilities. This investment management is integrated into a holistic wealth strategy that also encompasses long-term planning for trusts, estates, and family stewardship.

poc.description: Christine Phelps is a Partner and Wealth Advisor at Sage Mountain Advisors, where she advises families and business owners on protecting and maximizing their wealth for future generations. She has over 19 years of experience in the financial services industry, including wealth management, financial planning, and corporate/commercial banking. Prior to joining Sage Mountain in May 2020, she was a Senior Vice President and Wealth Advisor at BB&T (now Truist) and a Vice President and Senior Private Banker at Wells Fargo. Christine earned a BBA in Finance and Real Estate Finance from Southern Methodist University and obtained the CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ designation after completing coursework at Emory University.
fund.title: Sage Mountain Advisors

fund.description: Sage Mountain Advisors is an independent wealth management firm founded in 2018 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The firm provides comprehensive financial planning, investment management, and advisory services to high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Sage Mountain has experienced significant growth, expanding its team by over 30% in a six-month period in 2022 and advising on over $6 billion in assets as of late 2025.
fund.thesis: Sage Mountain Advisors' investment thesis centers on providing a holistic, concierge-level service that goes beyond traditional wealth management to include trust and estate planning, tax strategies, and philanthropic planning. They emphasize a community-sourced approach to alternative investments, leveraging their network of clients to source and evaluate private market opportunities. The firm focuses on downside risk, stress-tests portfolios, and creates customized asset allocations tailored to individual client needs, with a stated focus on North America.

poc.description: John Catsimatidis is the Chairman and CEO of the Red Apple Group, a diversified corporation with holdings in energy, aviation, real estate, and retail, including the Gristedes and D'Agostino Supermarkets chains. He began his career in the grocery business in 1971, opening his first Red Apple grocery store and expanding to ten stores by the time he was 24. Over the decades, he grew the Red Apple Group into a major private company with holdings in various sectors, including United Refining Company. Catsimatidis studied electrical engineering at New York University before leaving to focus on his burgeoning business.
fund.title: Red Apple Group
fund.sectors: energy; real-estate; financial-services; insurance; retail; media; venture-capital; aerospace; defense; healthcare; consumer; manufacturing; infrastructure; entertainment; education
fund.description: Red Apple Group is a large, privately-held conglomerate founded and controlled by billionaire John A. Catsimatidis. Established in 1971 with a single grocery store in Manhattan, the firm has grown into a diversified holding company with major operations in energy, real estate, supermarkets, and media. The company's holdings include hundreds of gas stations, a 70,000 barrel-per-day oil refinery, the Gristedes supermarket chain, and media assets like WABC Radio.
fund.thesis: Red Apple Group seeks to partner with founders and families for long-term value creation through operational excellence rather than financial engineering. For new platform acquisitions, the firm targets control equity investments in North American companies with revenues between $25 million and $250+ million and EBITDA of $10 million to $100+ million. The company also pursues add-on acquisitions of any size for its existing portfolio companies and makes select early and late-stage venture capital investments.

Rix Capital takes an institutional approach to managing the wealth generated from Playrix, diversifying investments across various asset classes.
fund.thesis: Rix Capital's investment strategy is divided into two main portfolios: a multi-asset portfolio and a direct investment portfolio focused on the entertainment sector. poc.description: Tyra Miller previously served as an Associate in the CFO Department at Cresset. She has since transitioned to the role of Director of Finance at Urban Growers Collective as of May 2024. fund.description: Cresset Capital is a multi-family office founded in 2017 by Eric Becker and Avy Stein to provide a more comprehensive and client-aligned wealth management experience. The firm serves high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth clients, including entrepreneurs, CEO founders, and multi-generational families, by offering a suite of services that includes financial planning, investment advisory, and direct access to private investments. Cresset has grown rapidly, now managing over $70 billion in assets and has been recognized as a top advisory firm by publications like Barron's and Forbes.
fund.thesis: Cresset's investment philosophy is centered on a client-first, fiduciary approach, providing access to a diversified range of both public and private market opportunities, including private equity, real estate, private credit, and venture capital. The firm seeks to create long-term value and sustainable growth by investing in institutional-quality opportunities that are typically inaccessible to individual investors. Their strategy involves a combination of active and passive management, utilizing fundamental, quantitative, and qualitative analysis to inform their investment decisions across various sectors, with a primary focus on the United States but also investing abroad.

As part of the Rosemont International group, which has been operating since 1981, Rosemont Monaco assists clients in structuring and managing their international assets in a tax-efficient and compliant manner.
fund.thesis: Rosemont Monaco's strategy is to act as a full-service advisor and family office, guiding clients through complex international tax, estate, and real estate matters. The firm focuses on providing bespoke solutions for structuring asset ownership, pre-move planning for residency in Monaco and France, and administering property holding companies. Their approach is centered on international and cross-border issues, utilizing a team of qualified tax experts, jurists, and accountants to serve a global clientele with assets in multiple jurisdictions.

poc.description: Whitney Imeraj is the Chief Compliance Officer and Partner at Sage Mountain Advisors, where she works alongside the CEO and CIO in the management of the company and leads the firm's compliance program. fund.description: Sage Mountain Advisors is an independent, employee-owned wealth management firm founded in 2018. Sage Mountain has experienced significant growth, expanding its team and advising on over $6 billion in assets.
fund.thesis: Sage Mountain Advisors' investment strategy centers on a comprehensive, individualized approach to wealth management, going beyond traditional investments to include a focus on alternative and private market opportunities. They emphasize a deep understanding of each client's financial situation to build a diversified portfolio that aligns with long-term goals and risk tolerance, with a focus on downside risk mitigation. The firm prides itself on a transparent, fee-only model and leverages its network to source and evaluate unique investment opportunities, particularly in private equity and private debt.

poc.description: Matthew Bone serves as the Director of Reporting Partner at Sage Mountain Advisors, a role he was promoted to in 2025 after joining the firm in October 2021 as the VP of Reporting. fund.description: Sage Mountain Advisors is an independent wealth management firm founded in 2018 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. The firm provides comprehensive financial planning, consulting, and investment management services to a select group of high-net-worth individuals, families, and institutions. Sage Mountain emphasizes a concierge-level service model, combining the experience of a large Wall Street firm with the flexibility of a boutique advisory.

They operate on a fee-only, fiduciary basis, avoiding commissions to ensure their advice is aligned with client interests. The firm utilizes a broad range of solutions in both public and private markets, with a notable focus on providing clients with access to community-sourced alternative investments, including private equity and private debt, to achieve risk-adjusted returns.

fund.title: Singer Burke
fund.sectors: media; entertainment; financial-services
fund.description: Singer Burke is a financial services firm with a 50-year legacy of providing wealth management, tax, and business management services. Founded by Sandy Singer in 1972, the firm specializes in serving high-net-worth creative professionals, executives, and artists in the media and entertainment sectors. In October 2025, the firm, which consists of two entities (SB Capital Management Inc. and Singer Burke Zimmer & Kogan LLP), was acquired by Mercer Global Advisors to serve as the cornerstone of Mercer's new specialty practice for media and entertainment professionals.
fund.thesis: Singer Burke operates with a holistic, family-office service model that combines wealth management, tax planning, and business management to provide comprehensive, planning-led financial solutions. The firm's strategy is to act as a collaborative partner, helping clients in the entertainment industry navigate complex financial landscapes and take control of their financial lives. Following its acquisition by Mercer Advisors, Singer Burke is now part of the 'Regis Group,' a specialized team focusing on families with $25 million or more in investable assets.

poc.description: James Heathcote is the Founder and Managing Partner of Sanctoras, where he works with high-net-worth individuals, families, and trustees globally. He is a member of the Chartered Institute of Taxation and the Association of Tax Technicians and holds a degree in Languages & Linguistics from the University of York.
fund.title: Sanctoras

Founded in 2020, the firm has offices in London, Dubai, and Abu Dhabi and focuses on international and cross-border financial matters. Sanctoras has been recognized as a 'Top Recommended' Tax and Trusts Advisor by Spear's for five consecutive years and is ranked for Ultra-High Net Worth Individuals and Family Offices by Tatler.
fund.thesis: Sanctoras's approach is centered on providing bespoke, tax-efficient structures for wealth preservation and intergenerational succession. They work with clients to establish and manage entities such as trusts and family investment companies across various jurisdictions, tailoring solutions to family dynamics, long-term objectives, and compliance requirements. Their services cater to an international clientele, with a focus on matters in the UK, UAE, and the wider GCC region.

Previously, Maurice worked at Lloyds Banking Group, focusing on Private Equity fund investing and distressed debt workouts, and before that, he was with the actuarial consultants Hymans Robertson, specializing in defined benefit pension schemes. fund.description: Souter Investments is the family investment office of Sir Brian Souter, co-founder of Stagecoach, established in 2006. The firm specializes in private equity investments in unquoted companies and has invested in over 100 businesses since its inception. Based in Edinburgh, UK, it is recognized as one of the most active private equity-focused family offices in the UK.
fund.thesis: Souter Investments employs a sector-agnostic and opportunistic investment strategy, focusing on taking significant minority or majority stakes in unlisted businesses. The firm is flexible in its approach, investing on its own or alongside partners, and is not constrained by specific deal sizes or situations, though it avoids investments in sectors such as alcohol, gambling, tobacco, and armaments. Their typical equity investment ranges from £2 million to £30 million, with a primary geographic focus on the United Kingdom, but also considering global opportunities, especially in the transport sector.

poc.description: Tony Cox is the Co-Founder, President, and Chief Investment Officer of Sage Mountain Advisors. In his role, he is instrumental in shaping the firm's investment strategies and processes. Prior to co-founding Sage Mountain, he spent nine years in the Private Wealth Management division at Goldman Sachs. He holds a Master of Science in Finance from Vanderbilt University and a bachelor's degree in finance from the University of Kentucky.
fund.title: Sage Mountain Advisors

fund.description: Sage Mountain Advisors is an independent, employee-owned wealth management firm and multi-family office headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded in 2018, the firm provides concierge-level financial planning, consulting, and investment management services to a select group of high-net-worth families and individuals across the United States. As a registered investment adviser (RIA), Sage Mountain combines the experience of a large financial institution with the flexibility of a boutique firm, focusing on tailored solutions for its clients.
fund.thesis: Sage Mountain's investment strategy is built on a client-centric and risk-aware foundation, focusing on downside protection and portfolio diversification across public and private markets. The firm takes a comprehensive approach, understanding each client's financial picture, liquidity needs, and risk tolerance to build customized portfolios that may include private equity, hedge funds, real estate, and public securities. They often utilize independent third-party managers and emphasize a transparent, fee-only model, aligning their interests with those of their clients.

Shepperd Investors AG focuses on collaborating with other families on investments across various sectors, including real estate, technology, and healthcare.
fund.title: Shepperd Investors

fund.description: Shepperd Investors AG is a single-family office founded in 2007 by Frederick M. Shepperd. The firm operates as a strategic investor, often collaborating with other families to invest in projects aimed at transforming regions and communities. Based in Zug, Switzerland, their primary corporate purpose is the management, acquisition, and sale of shareholdings in various companies, both domestically and internationally, alongside managing its own assets.

The firm collaborates with other family offices on bespoke services and partnership opportunities. Their core approach involves acquiring and managing holdings in various companies to foster transformation and growth in communities and regions.

fund.description: Sharpe Family Office represents a multi-generational Australian family with a history dating back to 1799. The office showcases the family's long-standing involvement in Australian industry, management, and advisory roles across various sectors. Rather than a traditional investment firm, it serves as a platform to highlight their philanthropic endeavors, community service, and contributions to organizations like Family Business Australia and various industry chambers.
fund.thesis: The Sharpe Family Office does not publicly state a formal investment thesis for external capital allocation. Their focus appears to be on the stewardship and growth of their own operating businesses and assets, alongside holding advisory and board roles in various industries. Their activities emphasize community engagement and supporting industry growth through collaboration with trade and research organizations.

poc.description: Jeffrey C. Kvam is a founding partner of SE Capital, a private investment firm. He has a career spanning since 1985 in investment banking, business consulting, and operations management. In his current role, he focuses on designing and implementing operating strategies for portfolio companies to improve business performance and also works on developing new investment ideas. Previously, Mr. Kvam was a Vice President at Goldman Sachs in the Investment Banking Group, Vice President & General Manager at MCI Systemhouse Inc., and started his career as a management consultant with Deloitte & Touche. He holds a Master's in Mathematics from Northwestern University and a BA from St. Olaf College.
fund.title: Quinnell

fund.description: SE Capital Partners is a private equity firm founded in 2001 and based in Chicago, Illinois. The firm targets service-oriented businesses in the lower middle market, focusing on change-of-control investments in niche market leaders within highly fragmented industries. SE Capital Partners operates as the exclusive direct private equity arm of Berggruen Holdings, a multi-billion dollar single-family office.
fund.thesis: SE Capital employs a thesis-based, "buy, build, and hold" investment strategy, partnering with experienced management teams to drive long-term value. The firm seeks established businesses with revenues between $10 million and $200 million and EBITDA between $3 million and $20 million, concentrating on leaders in niche or protected markets with potential for growth and consolidation. Their focus is on management-supported buyouts, aligning interests to build broader, more diverse businesses through operational improvements and complementary acquisitions.

The firm values independent and contrarian thinking and seeks to build deep partnerships with the leadership teams of its portfolio companies, often investing multiple times. Their investment approach is unconstrained by traditional mandates, allowing them to invest in both private and public markets.

poc.description: Stephanie Connor Arkof is a Wealth Management Partner at Singer Burke, which was acquired by Mercer Advisors. With 21 years of experience, she specializes in providing personalized investment and estate planning strategies for high-net-worth individuals, particularly within the entertainment industry. She holds a degree in business economics from UCLA and has a background in accounting, serving as a key link between the firm's wealth management and CPA services. Her responsibilities often extend to serving as an executor and trustee for her clients.
fund.title: Singer Burke
fund.sectors: private-equity; media; entertainment; financial-services; healthcare; real-estate; technology
fund.description: Singer Burke is a wealth management, tax, and business management firm founded in 1972 by Sandy Singer. The firm specializes in providing a comprehensive family office service model to high-net-worth creative professionals and executives, primarily in the media and entertainment sectors. In October 2025, Singer Burke was acquired by Mercer Global Advisors and now serves as a cornerstone of Mercer's specialty practice for media and entertainment professionals.
fund.thesis: Singer Burke's strategy centers on providing integrated and collaborative financial services, combining wealth management, tax planning, and business management under one roof. The firm focuses on serving ultra-high-net-worth families, particularly accomplished individuals in the entertainment and media industries like showrunners, producers, writers, and actors. As part of Mercer Advisors' Regis Group, it specifically targets families with $25 million or more in investable assets, aiming to provide a bespoke, coordinated family office experience.

poc.description: Stephen Martin joined Souter Investments as a Finance Manager in November 2024. His responsibilities include the day-to-day financial management of the group companies, as well as annual reporting and tax planning. Prior to his current role, he worked in both the finance and investor relations teams at Dalmore Capital. Stephen qualified as a Chartered Accountant (ICAS) in 2019 while at PwC's audit practice and graduated from the University of St Andrews in 2016 with a BSc (Hons) in Molecular Biology.
fund.title: Souter Investments

poc.description: Sean White is a Partner at Spire Capital, where he is involved in sourcing and leading transactions, managing industry and executive relationships, and investor relations. He has been with the firm since its inception in 2000, focusing on sectors such as business services, information services, software, and media. Prior to Spire Capital, he was a Vice President at Waller-Sutton Media Partners and also worked at Waller Capital Corporation and Arthur Andersen's Valuation Services Consulting Group. He holds an MBA from New York University and a Bachelor of Science from Binghamton University, in addition to being a Chartered Financial Analyst ("CFA").

fund.description: Founded in 2000, Spire Capital is a private equity firm that focuses on control investments in lower middle-market companies. The firm targets the technology-enabled business services, media, education, and communications sectors. Spire Capital partners with management teams, providing capital and operational guidance to foster growth. Since its inception, the firm has managed over $1 billion in committed capital, completing numerous platform investments and add-on acquisitions.
fund.thesis: Spire Capital's investment strategy centers on making control buyout and recapitalization investments in cash-flow positive companies in North America. The firm seeks businesses with strong growth potential, recurring revenue, and high barriers to entry, typically with a minimum of $10 million in revenue and $3 million in EBITDA. Spire works actively with its portfolio companies to create value by expanding distribution, entering new geographic markets, and pursuing strategic acquisitions.

fund.title: Rix Capital
