fund.description: Rix Capital is the London-based single-family office for Igor and Dmitry Bukhman, the billionaire founders of mobile gaming company Playrix. [1, 5, 7] Established in late 2021, the firm was created to manage the family's wealth, focusing on long-term preservation, impact, and philanthropic activities. [1, 5, 6] Rix Capital employs an institutional approach to manage its assets and established its first permanent office in London's St. James's district in 2023. [3, 6, 8]
fund.thesis: Rix Capital's investment strategy is divided into two main portfolios: a multi-asset portfolio and a direct investment portfolio focused on the entertainment sector. [3] The multi-asset portfolio follows a diversified, endowment-style approach, utilizing external managers and allocating capital across various asset classes including private equity, hedge funds, fixed income, and public stocks. [3, 8, 10] Stemming from their origins in the gaming business, the firm also builds a concentrated portfolio through direct stakes in entertainment companies. [3]

poc.description: Matthew Burke is the Partner of Business Management at Mercer Advisors, a role he assumed after Mercer Advisors acquired Singer Burke in 2025. For 35 years, he was the Managing Partner of Singer Burke, a multi-family office practice he was instrumental in growing. His career also includes positions at Ernst & Young and a national real estate syndication firm. Matthew earned a B.S. in business administration from the University of California, Berkeley, and holds a certificate in financial management for the family office from Pepperdine University; he is also a CPA and a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ professional.
fund.title: Singer Burke
fund.sectors: financial-services; media; entertainment; healthcare; real-estate; technology
fund.description: Singer Burke was a Los Angeles-based wealth management, tax, and business management firm founded by Sandy Singer in 1972. With a 50-year history, the firm specialized in serving creative professionals and executives in the media and entertainment industries. In October 2025, Singer Burke was acquired by Mercer Global Advisors, a national Registered Investment Adviser (RIA) founded in 1985. Following the acquisition, the Singer Burke team became the cornerstone of Mercer Advisors' media and entertainment specialty practice and joined its Regis Group, which is dedicated to families with $25 million or more in investable assets.
fund.thesis: As part of Mercer Advisors, the firm's strategy focuses on providing a comprehensive, integrated "family office" experience that includes financial planning, investment management, tax strategy, and estate planning. Their investment philosophy is grounded in Modern Portfolio Theory, utilizing strategically weighted, globally diversified portfolios and a factor-based approach to capture returns from sources like value, size, and momentum. The firm emphasizes a long-term, evidence-based approach, avoiding market hype and using low-cost vehicles like ETFs and index funds, while also incorporating private investments for diversification.

poc.role: CEO, Partner and member of the Board of Directors
poc.description: Ilias Läber is the CEO, Partner, and a member of the Board of Directors at Spectrum Value Management Ltd, a role he has held since 2021. In this capacity, he is responsible for the industrial and private investments of the Thomas Schmidheiny family. His career began at McKinsey & Company, where he worked from 2001 to 2008, rising to the position of Associate Principal. Following this, he was a Partner and Managing Director at Cevian Capital's Swiss office from 2008 to 2019. Dr. Läber holds a Master of Science in Engineering from ETH Zürich, as well as a Master of Arts in Economics and a doctorate from the University of Zurich.
fund.title: Spectrum Value Management
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; healthcare
fund.description: Spectrum Value Management is a single-family office based in Rapperswil-Jona, Switzerland, established in 2002. The firm manages the commercial and private interests of the Thomas Schmidheiny family, a Swiss industrialist family with a long entrepreneurial heritage. Spectrum Value Management supports the family in their entrepreneurial and financial ambitions and also oversees their philanthropic strategies.
fund.thesis: As a single-family office, Spectrum Value Management's investment thesis is centered around managing and growing the wealth of the Thomas Schmidheiny family through direct investments in private equity and real estate. The firm appears to focus on high-growth technology startups, as evidenced by its investments in the biotech, drone, and semiconductor industries. Their geographic focus includes Western Europe and Asia, with a specific investment office, Simon Murray & Company, serving the Asian market.

poc.description: Anthony Kan is a qualified chartered accountant with extensive experience in finance and real estate. After qualifying in 1985, he became a partner in a London accounting firm before joining a private construction company with operations in Malaysia, Brunei, and the UK. In 2006, he joined AAFM, a Brunei Family Office, as finance director, and he now serves as the Deputy CEO and CFO of SIAHAF Management Ltd.
fund.title: SIAHAF Management Ltd
fund.sectors: real-estate; hospitality; energy
fund.description: SIAHAF Management Ltd is the operational arm of a family office, the Strategic Iconic Assets Heritage Acquisition Fund (SIAHAF), which focuses on investments in real estate, hospitality, and energy. Established in 2009, the firm specializes in acquiring and redeveloping real estate with significant historic, iconic, or cultural attributes. The firm is led by its principal sponsor and Chairman/CEO, Shuif Hussain, and leverages its Anglo-Asian ties to identify off-market opportunities.
fund.thesis: SIAHAF's investment strategy centers on acquiring and developing real estate projects with historical and cultural significance, aiming to create sustainable, community-focused environments. The firm seeks to deliver high-quality refurbishments of historic British assets and has a broader investment interest across leisure, hospitality, oil and gas, and property in the UK and Asia. Their approach often involves large-scale restoration and regeneration projects, transforming underutilized areas into valuable community assets.

poc.description: Blakely Page is the Founder and President of Spouting Rock Financial Partners, a firm he established to provide innovative financial solutions. He brings over 30 years of experience in the financial services and asset management sectors. In addition to his role at Spouting Rock, he is also a Principal at JM Search, focusing on the Financial Services Practice. His earlier career includes positions at Morgan Stanley, Thomas Weisel Partners, Susquehanna International, and Bank of America.
fund.title: Spouting Rock
fund.sectors: private-equity; hedge-funds; private-debt; public-markets; technology; healthcare; energy; enterprise-software; financial-services; impact-investing; esg
fund.description: Spouting Rock Asset Management, founded in 2018, is a multi-boutique manager platform providing alternative, traditional, and thematic investment solutions. Located near Philadelphia, the firm offers a shared services model to sophisticated investors, financial professionals, and institutions, focusing on niche strategies in less efficient markets where active management can add value. Key milestones include the acquisition of majority stakes in firms like Penn Capital Management, Reinhart Partners, and Old Hill Partners, significantly expanding its assets under management and investment capabilities.
fund.thesis: Spouting Rock's investment thesis centers on identifying and partnering with skilled boutique asset managers in inefficient market segments where active management has the potential to generate significant alpha. They seek to acquire majority or minority stakes in established managers with strong track records, providing them with a robust operational and distribution platform to foster growth. The firm has a broad focus across various asset classes, including public and private markets, with stated expertise in areas like healthcare, technology, energy, and asset-based lending, and is actively expanding its global and ESG-focused offerings.

poc.description: Dr. Frank A. Erhard is the founder and CEO of Rising Star AG, a Swiss investment firm specializing in alternative investments for high-net-worth families and institutional investors. Prior to establishing Rising Star AG, he founded Victoria Family Office AG in 2000. His entrepreneurial career began in 1990 when he co-founded a company in the mobile communications sector before transitioning his focus to financial investments. Dr. Erhard also holds positions as Managing Director at Star Private Equity Beteiligungs GmbH & Co. KG and Co-Managing Director at Star Private Equity II Beteiligungs GmbH & Co. KG.
fund.title: Rising Star AG
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds; commodities
fund.description: Rising STAR AG is a leading, bank-independent specialist for private equity and real estate investments within the German-speaking market, founded in 2001. [17] The firm provides investors with access to an international elite of private equity and real estate managers. [17] A key milestone was the 2001 launch of the first bank-independent hedge fund certificate for the German-speaking market. [10, 23]
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy operates under the mission "Invest with the best," which involves selecting internationally renowned and successful private equity and real estate managers for specific regions or investment themes. [17] Rising STAR structures these as fund-of-funds products, allowing clients to invest alongside prominent institutional investors and large family offices. [17, 20]

poc.description: Carlos J. Peraza is a Partner at SP Family Office, LLC. He is also associated with MON Capital Management LLC, which he founded in 2024, and is a shareholder in SP Capital International S.A., an investment management firm registered in Panama. His previous experience includes a role at ING Private Wealth Management LLC from 2006 to 2008. He provides investment advice, wealth management, and consulting services to a variety of clients, including high-net-worth individuals and families.
fund.title: SP FAMILY OFFICE, LLC
fund.description: SP Family Office, LLC is a family office based in New York. According to financial data provider Preqin, it operates as a multi-family office. The firm's official website is currently under construction and provides limited information.
fund.thesis: The firm's specific investment thesis is not publicly disclosed. A profile on Preqin indicates an interest in a range of alternative asset classes, including private equity, venture capital, and real estate, though details on its strategy, stage preference, or ticket size are unavailable.

poc.description: Michael Mulcahy is a Principal at Silver Fox Partners, a family office he established with his mother, Anne Mulcahy, and brother, Kevin. He began his career in 2005 at the advertising agency Y&R, where he focused on brand strategy for clients such as Land Rover, Campbell Soup Company, and MetLife. In 2012, he transitioned to the hospitality industry and later co-founded Gaggyl.com, an online discovery engine for group experiences, before founding Silver Fox Partners. Michael earned a B.A. in Marketing from Boston College.
fund.title: Silver Fox Partners
fund.sectors: agriculture; consumer
fund.description: Silver Fox Partners is a single-family office founded in 2017 by Anne Mulcahy, the former CEO and Chairman of Xerox Corporation. Based in New York, the firm invests in businesses that exhibit strong tangible qualities like financial performance and assets, as well as intangible qualities such as leadership, mission, and values. The firm provides portfolio companies with expertise in enterprise strategy, marketing, financial guidance, and leadership development to foster growth.
fund.thesis: Silver Fox Partners seeks to invest in quality businesses for the long-term, taking either majority ownership or minority co-investment stakes. The firm's primary criteria for investment include durability (a history of or clear path to positive EBITDA), favorable market dynamics, strong leadership with a passion for their business, and strategic discipline with a focus on ROI. Their sector focus is on Food & Agriculture and Consumer Goods.

poc.description: M. Gruber is currently a Financial Analyst and Corporate Lawyer at ST 77 Holding, a family investment office. Further details regarding their professional background, specific responsibilities, and career history are not publicly available.
fund.title: ST 77 Holding
fund.sectors: real-estate; retail; healthcare
fund.description: ST 77 Holding is a value-oriented family investment office that has been operating since 1977. Based in Ulm, Germany, the firm is responsible for asset and wealth management, guided by a conservative mindset. Their activities focus on the acquisition of commercial and retail properties within Germany.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy centers on acquiring high-yield real estate locations and properties throughout Germany to create long-term, profitable opportunities for its investors. They focus on commercial and retail properties in both the food and non-food sectors, including shopping centers, discount stores, and specialty stores, as well as senior housing and land. ST 77 Holding manages all aspects of the investment process in-house, from market analysis and planning to asset and property management.

poc.description: Sara Goldstein serves as the Personal Assistant to the Director at Spielmann Capital. She is noted as having a strong background in finance. Insufficient public information is available regarding her detailed career history and educational background.
fund.title: Spielmann Capital
fund.sectors: real-estate; hospitality; infrastructure; private-equity; venture-capital
fund.description: Spielmann Capital is a single-family office headquartered in London, United Kingdom, with an additional office in Geneva. Founded in 1996, the firm manages the multi-generational wealth of the Spielmann family, which was built through real estate holdings, hospitality ventures, and IT infrastructure businesses in the UK and Europe. Spielmann Capital allocates long-term capital to private equity, venture capital, and direct property investments.
fund.thesis: Spielmann Capital pursues a long-term investment approach, often with a horizon of over ten years, acting as an active partner to the companies it is involved with by providing support and expertise. The firm is primarily active in the real estate, catering and hospitality, and IT infrastructure sectors. Their geographic focus is on the United Kingdom and Europe, with a specific mention of Western Europe.

poc.description: Thomas F. Taft, Sr. is the Chairman & CEO of Taft Family Ventures, where he oversees the day-to-day operations for all departments, including acquisitions, construction, and operations. He joined the family business in 1988 and has since expanded its real estate investments across multiple states. Prior to his current role, he served three terms in the North Carolina State Senate. Mr. Taft is a graduate of Duke University and the University of North Carolina School of Law.
fund.title: Taft Family Ventures
fund.sectors: real-estate; retail; hospitality
fund.description: Taft Family Ventures (TFV) is a third-generation, family-owned real estate investment firm headquartered in Greenville, North Carolina. Founded in its current form in 1988, the company acquires, develops, constructs, and manages a diverse portfolio of properties. TFV operates through five integrated companies: Taft Development Group, Taft Management Group, Taft Construction Group, Taft-Mills Group, and Taft Family Office, aiming to build attractive, livable, and sustainable communities.
fund.thesis: Taft Family Ventures follows a purposeful investment philosophy focused on acquiring, owning, and developing a wide range of property types, including retail, multi-family residential, office, student housing, and affordable housing. Their strategy involves identifying and capitalizing on trends and opportunities to create value, with a primary goal that extends beyond financial success to building sustainable and attractive communities. The firm invests in high-growth urban and suburban markets, primarily through development projects.

poc.description: Maximilian Rümmelein serves as the Head of Operations & Portfolio Management at Swiss 5 Group. His responsibilities also include overseeing portfolio management, IT infrastructure, and client relationship development as Director & Head of Operations at SVTG Strategische Vermögenstreuhand AG. Previously, he held key positions at EVERON AG, where he led strategic projects in product and IT development and contributed to the creation of digital investment platforms. He holds a Master-level diploma in Financial Economics from EDHEC Business School and a Bachelor's degree in Banking & Finance from the University of Zurich.
fund.title: Swiss 5 Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; financial-services
fund.description: Swiss 5 Group is an independent multi-family office founded in 1994 and based in Zurich, Switzerland. The firm provides comprehensive asset management, family office, and corporate finance services to high-net-worth individuals and entrepreneurs. The group was formed following a spin-off from the Swiss operations of German private bank Georg Hauck & Sohn, and the current partners have been building the firm in its present form since 2011. Swiss 5 Group is a member of the SECA Swiss Private Equity & Corporate Finance Association and the Alliance of Swiss Asset Managers.
fund.thesis: The firm follows a long-term, sustainable advisory approach, aiming to be a reliable partner for wealthy and entrepreneurial clients in all financial matters. In its corporate finance activities, it supports investors and entrepreneurs through all phases of a project, from screening and structuring to due diligence and exit, with a focus on the sustainable growth of medium-sized businesses. The group's geographical focus is primarily on Switzerland, Germany, and Austria.

poc.role: Partner, Senior Advisor, Board Member, Director of Charlotte Office
poc.description: Russ Cearley is a Partner, Senior Advisor, Board Member, and Director of the Charlotte Office at SignatureFD, where he provides strategic investment consulting and comprehensive wealth management services to high-net-worth clients. He is also a senior member of the SignatureFD Investment Committee. Prior to joining SignatureFD, he worked at SunTrust Investment Services, and he began his career at TIAA-CREF as an investment consultant. Mr. Cearley holds a Bachelor of Arts in Economics and Political Science from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and is a CFA® charterholder.
fund.title: SignatureFD
fund.sectors: private-equity; private-debt; fixed-income; public-markets; real-estate; insurance; financial-services
fund.description: SignatureFD is an Atlanta-based wealth management and financial advisory firm founded in 1997, serving high-net-worth individuals, families, and related entities. The firm's approach is centered on a concept called Net Worthwhile®, which aims to integrate a client's wealth with their personal values and life goals. A significant milestone was achieved in October 2025 when the firm announced it had surpassed $10 billion in assets under management or reporting, having doubled its assets in the previous five years. SignatureFD has received national recognition, including being named to the Inc. 5000 list of America's Fastest-Growing Private Companies and the Forbes Top RIA Firms list.
fund.thesis: SignatureFD's strategy focuses on being comprehensive wealth managers for their clients, rather than solely portfolio managers, by managing the client's total financial picture. The firm utilizes a combination of fundamental, technical, and cyclical analysis to inform its investment advice, creating diversified portfolios that may include equities, fixed income, mutual funds, ETFs, and private investments. Their primary focus is on high-net-worth clients in the United States, with a strong presence in the Southeast, helping them design and implement plans to grow, protect, and transfer their wealth.

poc.description: Tim L. Baker is the Founder of Timonier, Wealth Beyond Financial™, where he also holds the titles of President and CEO. He established the firm in 1997 with a vision to create a vertically integrated office serving families based on insight, integrity, and advocacy. With a career in the financial industry since 1981, Tim has extensive experience in investment management, financial planning, and risk management. He earned a bachelor's degree in business administration and management from the University of South Carolina.
fund.title: Timonier, Wealth Beyond Financial™
fund.sectors: financial-services; real-estate
fund.description: Timonier, Wealth Beyond Financial™, is a multi-disciplinary, fee-only family office founded in 1997 by Tim L. Baker. The firm provides holistic wealth management services, including financial planning, investment advisory, tax and estate planning, and real estate services, positioning itself as a comprehensive "wealth sanctuary" for its clients. Timonier emphasizes a collaborative, centralized approach to serve all of a client's wealth needs.
fund.thesis: Timonier's investment strategy is centered on an evidence-based philosophy, focusing on long-term participation in market growth through patient, diversified investments. They prioritize strategic asset allocation across stocks, real estate, bonds, and cash, and manage risk by diversifying across thousands of global companies to eliminate unsystematic risk. A core tenet of their approach is to minimize unnecessary costs and taxes to maximize client returns, often utilizing investment solutions from providers like Dimensional Fund Advisors and Vanguard.

poc.description: Michael Rümmelein is the Managing Partner and Chief Executive Officer of Swiss 5 Group, a family office he co-founded in 2011. His responsibilities include acting as a partner and member of the Board of Directors for all companies within the group. Prior to establishing Swiss 5 Group, he was responsible for the development and management of Hauck & Aufhäuser (Schweiz) AG, ultimately serving as Chairman of the Board of Directors. Mr. Rümmelein studied law in Munich and banking in Frankfurt am Main and has worked for various private bankers in France, Germany, and Switzerland.
fund.title: Swiss 5 Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; financial-services; fintech; healthcare; media
fund.description: Swiss 5 Group is an independent multi-family office founded in 1994 by Michael Rümmelein and Michael Bufler, with offices in Zurich and Zug, Switzerland. The firm provides comprehensive asset management, family office, and corporate finance services to high-net-worth individuals and entrepreneurs. Its origins trace back to key employees of the German private bank Hauck & Aufhäuser, and it continues to focus on being a financial institution for wealthy and entrepreneurial private clients. The firm is a member of the Swiss Private Equity & Corporate Finance Association (SECA) and the Alliance of Swiss Asset Managers (ASV/ASWM).
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy focuses on providing sustainable, independent, and long-term advice across all financial matters, including strategic, cross-generational planning and management of family assets. In its corporate finance practice, it supports investors and entrepreneurs in buying and selling corporate participations, structuring financing, and guiding projects from screening to exit. The investment focus is on German-speaking Europe, specifically Switzerland, Germany, and Austria, with a preference for stages such as Buyout, Expansion/Development Capital, and Mezzanine financing across all industrial sectors.

poc.description: Joseph Taussig is the founder and Chief Executive Officer of Taussig Capital. He has a long and distinguished career in the financial services industry, having started the first investment bank in Bermuda in 1990. Previously, he was the CEO of Multi-Strat Holdings and has been involved as a merchant banker in numerous financial services startups, divestitures, and acquisitions since 1990. Mr. Taussig holds a BS in engineering from the U.S. Naval Academy and an MBA from Harvard University.
fund.title: Taussig Capital
fund.sectors: insurance; financial-services; hedge-funds
fund.description: Taussig Capital is an advisory firm that specializes in the insurance, financial services, and hedge fund sectors. The firm is known for its pioneering approaches to risk management and its ability to bring alternative sources of capital to the insurance and reinsurance industries. A key milestone for the company was the acquisition of Spencer Re I.I. in 2021, which was subsequently rebranded as Taussig Capital Re, a Puerto Rico-licensed reinsurance company.
fund.thesis: Taussig Capital's investment philosophy centers around the concept of "Structural Alpha," which involves executing investment strategies through an insurer or reinsurer to achieve superior risk-adjusted returns compared to a traditional fund structure. They advise asset managers, family offices, insurers, and banks on creating these structures to gain access to permanent capital and increase assets under management. The firm has a particular focus on creating bespoke, non-traditional capital solutions for companies, including restructuring legacy insurance programs.

poc.description: David A. Greene is an accomplished advisor with credentials as a licensed attorney in Tennessee and Virginia, a Certified Public Accountant (CPA), and a Personal Financial Specialist (PFS). His career in estates and trusts began after graduating summa cum laude from the University of Tennessee, Knoxville with a Bachelor of Science in Accounting and a Finance collateral, followed by a Law Degree from Washington and Lee University School of Law. He has professional experience as an estate planning attorney and in the tax department of a public accounting firm, where he advised clients on tax-efficient wealth transfers, business succession strategies, and asset protection. At Still Waters Family Office, which was co-founded by the partners of First Covenant Trust & Advisors, he assists families with estate planning and administration.
fund.title: StillWater Family Office
fund.sectors: financial-services; impact-investing; real-estate; insurance
fund.description: Still Waters Family Office provides comprehensive, integrated services to manage the complexities of generational wealth for high-net-worth families. Their offerings include investment management, tax compliance and planning, estate and trust administration, and family office administration. The firm acts as a fiduciary, aiming to simplify the challenges of significant wealth and bring efficiency to the governance of a family's financial goals and legacy plans.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is built on a customized and collaborative approach, tailored to each family's unique needs, objectives, and circumstances. They work to create a detailed investment policy statement that guides investment selection, execution, and monitoring, managing assets to both protect and grow wealth in a measured way that aligns with the client's risk comfort level. As an independently owned firm, they emphasize providing cost-effective and transparent decisions.

poc.description: Chelsea Luzier serves as the Chief Compliance Officer and Director of Operations at The Clarius Group, LLC, where she is also a member of the firm's leadership group. She has been in the investment industry since 2003, starting her career as a registered client associate at a large broker-dealer/RIA. Prior to joining The Clarius Group in 2019, she moved into supervisory functions in 2010, eventually managing the development of a supervision program for an investment advisory business. Ms. Luzier holds the Investment Adviser Certified Compliance Professional (IACCCP®) and Financial Paraplanner Qualified Professional (FPQP®) designations.
fund.title: The Clarius Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; infrastructure; private-debt; software; saas; retail; ecommerce; technology; financial-services
fund.description: The Clarius Group is a multi-family office headquartered in Seattle, Washington, founded in 2014. [2, 3] The firm operates a shared family office model, providing services such as investment management, holistic financial planning, and personal accounting to affluent families and charitable foundations. [3, 4] With roots dating back to 1999 through its principals' prior activities, Clarius focuses on serving as a loyal fiduciary to preserve multigenerational capital for its clients. [4]
fund.thesis: The Clarius Group's investment thesis revolves around providing customized and comprehensive wealth management that aligns with each family's specific goals. [4] The firm's strategy includes creating tailored, tax-controlled portfolios using direct indexing, private markets, and alternative investments, with a focus on private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and private debt. [4, 6, 7] They primarily serve high-net-worth families in the Northwest US and beyond, acting as a central coordinator for all financial matters, including investments, taxes, estate planning, and philanthropy. [4, 9]

poc.description: Paul McEwan is a Principle at Table Mountain Capital, a family office focused on alternative investments and early-stage companies. He is a co-founder of Kapa Biosystems, a company that develops life science tools and kits using protein evolution technology. His previous experience includes co-founding Agencourt Bioscience Corporation and Agencourt Personal Genomics, and he was a member of the technology development group at the Whitehead/MIT Center for Genome Research, where he contributed to the Human Genome Project. Paul holds a BS in Biology and Anthropology from Emory University.
fund.title: Table Mountain Capital
fund.sectors: technology; healthcare; venture-capital
fund.description: Table Mountain Capital is a family office founded in 2006 that focuses on alternative investments and early-stage companies. The firm's principals bring a unique perspective as both operators and investors, having co-founded and successfully exited ventures like Kapa Biosystems, which was acquired by Roche in 2015. With offices in Colorado and South Africa, the firm's team is actively involved in sourcing, selecting, and managing a diverse portfolio of holdings.
fund.thesis: Table Mountain Capital acquires interests in early-stage businesses, specializing in the life science and technology sectors. The firm partners with management teams, often taking a board role, to create long-term sustainable value by leveraging their experience in finance, R&D, and sales. Their strategy seeks to maintain a moderate risk/return mandate to achieve consistent returns throughout market cycles.

poc.description: Nick Clay is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER™ (CFP®) practitioner, Certified Private Wealth Advisor® (CPWA®), Accredited Investment Fiduciary (AIF®), and holds the Accredited Asset Management Specialist℠ (AAMS®) designation at StillWater Family Office. He graduated from East Tennessee State University in 2005 with a Bachelor's Degree in Corporate Finance and completed the Certified Private Wealth Advisor® (CPWA®) Certification and Executive Education program from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business in 2022.
fund.title: StillWater Family Office

The firm offers integrated support across investment management, tax compliance and planning, trust and estate administration, and philanthropy. Their stated goal is to simplify the challenges of significant wealth, allowing families to focus on their vision and legacy.
fund.thesis: The firm's investment thesis is centered on creating a customized and collaborative framework tailored to the specific needs and long-term objectives of each family. They act as fiduciaries, emphasizing a transparent, team-based approach to identify a family's financial situation and risk tolerance, which then informs a clear investment policy. Their strategy involves managing assets to both protect and grow wealth in a measured way, with risk aligned to each client's comfort level.

poc.description: Matthew Hoffer is the Principal, Co-Founder, and Chief Executive Officer of Spire Capital, a private investment firm focusing on direct investments in private markets. He is also the Co-Founder & Managing Partner of Spire Strategy, a digital transformation and consulting firm. Prior to founding Spire, he was Head of Middle East Government Affairs at the World Economic Forum and also worked at JPMorgan Investment Bank in London within equity derivatives structured products sales. He holds a Master's degree from the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University and a bachelor's degree from Bath University.
fund.title: Spire Capital
fund.sectors: private-equity; technology; software; ecommerce
fund.description: Spire Capital, founded in 2000, is a private equity firm based in New York. The firm focuses on control investments in lower middle-market companies within the technology-enabled business services, media, education, and communications sectors. Spire Capital leverages its industry experience and network to partner with management teams, aiming to create long-term value and drive growth in its portfolio companies. Since its inception, the firm has managed over $900 million of equity capital across several funds.
fund.thesis: Spire Capital's investment strategy is to make control-oriented investments in cash-flow positive North American companies with revenues between $10 million and $100 million. The firm targets sectors like technology-enabled business services, media, education, and communications, seeking businesses with strong growth potential, recurring revenue, and high barriers to entry. Spire takes a long-term view, utilizing modest leverage to ensure portfolio companies have the flexibility to invest in sustainable growth.

poc.description: Uri Krausz is the Founder and CEO of Toledo Capital AG, a Zurich-based multi-family office he established in 2010. He is responsible for providing comprehensive wealth management and family office services to a global clientele. Before founding Toledo Capital, Krausz gained extensive experience in the Swiss banking sector, holding high-level management positions at both UBS and Credit Suisse. Born and raised in Zurich, he is intimately familiar with the Swiss banking system's culture and mentality, focusing on delivering Swiss precision and innovative financial solutions.
fund.title: Toledo Capital AG
fund.sectors: financial-services; private-equity; venture-capital; hedge-funds; public-markets; fixed-income; real-estate; crypto-blockchain
fund.description: Toledo Capital AG is a multi-family office headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2011 by Uri Krausz. The firm is regulated by the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA) and is a member of the Aquila Group of Independent Asset Managers. Toledo Capital provides comprehensive wealth management and tailored financial solutions to high-net-worth individuals and families globally.
fund.thesis: Toledo Capital employs a core-satellite investment approach to construct client portfolios, with the goal of minimizing costs and volatility while maximizing risk-adjusted returns. The core of their portfolios consists of long-term holdings in bonds, equities, hedge funds, and alternative investments, while satellite investments are used to capitalize on shorter-term market opportunities. The firm focuses on multigenerational wealth preservation and provides clients with access to a diverse range of investment opportunities, including private equity, real estate, and digital assets.

poc.description: Stenning Stueppert is a Partner at Tillery Capital with over 20 years of experience in private equity investments. He is a business leader with expertise in M&A financial and execution, as well as strategic consulting. His career includes co-founding CenterGate Capital, serving as Senior Vice President of Strategy & Corporate Development for Total Safety, and holding Principal positions at Eos Partners and H.I.G. Capital. Mr. Stueppert began his career as a consultant with Bain & Company after earning his M.B.A. from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business and a B.A. in Economics from Northwestern University.
fund.title: Tillery Capital

fund.description: Tillery Capital is an operationally focused private investment firm with a family office structure, founded in December 2006. The firm partners with management teams to invest in and build lower-middle market companies. The principals of Tillery Capital have collectively acquired over 50 companies, with the total value of these transactions exceeding $1.0 billion.
fund.thesis: Tillery Capital makes control equity investments in companies with an EBITDA between $2 million and $15 million. They are a "hands-on," consultative investor, focusing on a limited number of platform investments to ensure deep involvement and drive operational and financial performance. Their primary sector focus includes agriculture, healthcare, niche manufacturing, and software, with a geographical preference for companies headquartered in the United States, particularly in the Southeast or Midwest.

poc.description: Michael Alexander is a member of the Investment Team at Stockdale Street. He is a CA (SA) and CFA® charterholder with a Bachelor of Business Science in Finance and Accounting, as well as a Postgraduate Diploma in Accounting (PGDA) from the University of Cape Town. His career began at Deloitte, followed by a role in corporate finance at One Capital. Prior to joining Stockdale Street, he worked in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan, where he was involved in mergers and acquisitions, debt and equity funding, and corporate restructurings.
fund.title: Stockdale Street

fund.description: Stockdale Street is a private equity firm that acts as the exclusive advisor to the Mary Oppenheimer Family Interests (MOD) and other prominent families for their direct private equity investments. Established in 2003, the firm is based in Johannesburg, South Africa, and manages the Oppenheimer family's South African private equity interests. Stockdale Street operates as a supportive, value-adding partner with a long-term investment horizon, leveraging its extensive networks to foster growth in its portfolio companies.
fund.thesis: Stockdale Street's investment philosophy is centered on partnering with established businesses that have sustainable market-leading positions and strong growth potential. The firm seeks to compound capital over the long term by acquiring both controlling and non-controlling stakes in companies across a broad range of industries, with a preference for sectors like financial services, consumer goods, and technology. They typically invest a minimum of $20 million but have no upper limit for compelling opportunities and can be flexible for unique growth prospects.

fund.title: The Clarius Group

The firm provides tailored investment management, financial planning, and family office services to high-net-worth individuals and families, primarily in the Northwest of the United States. With roots dating back to 1999 through its founders' prior activities, The Clarius Group operates on a shared family office model, aiming to provide the benefits of a private family office with aligned, service-driven partners.

They focus on a deep understanding of their clients' objectives to build tailored portfolios that encompass investments, taxes, estate planning, and philanthropy. The firm invests across various asset classes, including private markets such as private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and private debt, alongside public market solutions like direct indexing.

poc.description: Cornel von Geyr is a Managing Director at the Schürfeld Group, where he is the Geschäftsführer (Managing Director) of the Mass Customisation Group (MCG), a holding of the Schürfeld Group. His role involves identifying and integrating companies that align with the group's focus on personalized customer communication. fund.title: Schürfeld Group
fund.sectors: private-equity; venture-capital; manufacturing; technology; cleantech; impact-investing
fund.description: The Schürfeld Group is a family-run holding company based in Hamburg, Germany, founded in 1937 by Gustav Schürfeld. Originally an import and export business for pulp and paper, it has evolved into a strategic family office. The group specializes in national and international investments in medium-sized companies, maintaining a connection to its origins in the paper and packaging industry while also investing in innovative sectors and start-ups. In 2022, the portfolio companies of the Schürfeld Group generated a turnover of more than 1.5 billion euros with 12,000 employees.
fund.thesis: The Schürfeld Group's investment strategy focuses on long-term, sustainable success for all stakeholders through partnerships built on reliability, transparency, and mutual respect. They invest in medium-sized companies, both nationally and internationally, and contribute their extensive entrepreneurial experience. While they have a strong heritage and focus in the paper, packaging, and printing industries, they are also open to investing in innovative industries and start-ups.

fund.title: Tao Capital Partners

fund.description: Tao Capital Partners is a family office and venture capital firm based in San Francisco, representing the direct investment vehicle for the Pritzker family. Founded in the early 2000s and formally incorporated as a venture capital entity in 2013, the firm leverages the family's wealth to invest with a long-term, mission-aligned perspective. Tao Capital Partners is recognized for backing high-profile companies such as Tesla, SpaceX, and Uber, and focuses on ventures that aim to address critical global challenges.
fund.thesis: Tao Capital Partners invests globally across various stages, from early-stage seed to late-stage growth funding, without being limited by traditional fund structures. Prior to his career in financial services, he worked as a turkey farm laborer.

Founded in 1971 by Randy Johnson, the company specializes in serving business owners, executives, and families with significant wealth. The firm operates from a unique refurbished barn on a 40-acre property and partners with Ash Brokerage, a large privately held insurance brokerage, to serve its clientele.

fund.title: Concord Management LLC
fund.sectors: real-estate
fund.description: Concord Management LLC is a single-family office founded in 1999 by principal Michael Matlin. The firm was established to provide investment advisory, supervision, and management services for the U.S.-based investments of a single client, a wealthy former Russian official. As of January 2022, the firm managed an estimated $7.2 billion in assets for its client. In September 2023, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) charged Concord Management and Matlin with operating as unregistered investment advisers.
fund.thesis: Concord Management's strategy was to provide comprehensive, continuous supervisory and management services to build and oversee a diverse portfolio of U.S.-based private fund investments for its sole client. The firm sourced, arranged, and monitored hundreds of investments, primarily in private equity funds and hedge funds, to manage its client's multi-billion dollar portfolio. The firm's activities ceased in March 2022 after its client was sanctioned and his assets were frozen.

fund.title: Verona Advisory
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Verona Advisory is a part of the larger Verona Group, providing advisory services primarily from its base in Luxembourg. The firm focuses on helping international clients, many of whom are entrepreneurs, to plan, preserve, manage risk, and grow their wealth across multiple jurisdictions and generations. Their services encompass wealth planning, financial advisory, business advisory, and governance advisory, often extending to their clients' families and business interests. Verona Advisory emphasizes a personalized, trust-based approach to support clients through all stages of their personal and business life cycles.
fund.thesis: Verona Advisory's strategy centers on providing bespoke, comprehensive solutions for entrepreneurs and their families by integrating expertise in tax, law, strategy, and wealth planning. They focus on all stages of the business lifecycle, from startup and growth to internationalization and generational transfers, aiming to build sustainable growth and deliver measurable results. The firm partners with clients to understand their unique vision and values, developing tailored governance frameworks and financial plans to meet complex cross-border requirements.

[6] In its investment advisory capacity, the firm assists clients with fund-raising preparations, business model reviews, and M&A activities, connecting them with a Geneva-based investor pool. [13]

They are early-stage investors who take a hands-on approach, often joining pre-seed and seed stage companies as advisors and part-time employees to help with strategy, team building, and sales. Notable achievements include being early investors in successful companies like Klarna and Tobii.
fund.thesis: Walerud Ventures invests in deep-tech companies with a 'planet-positive' mission, focusing on sectors like AI, fintech, biotech, and cleantech. They look for exceptional founding teams with a focused product that solves a significant problem in a growing market and prefer to be within commuting distance of Stockholm due to their hands-on approach. Their typical investment is at the pre-seed and seed stage, with ticket sizes ranging from 1M to 10M SEK.

Prior to joining Verdence, he was a Managing Director and Partner at Hightower/Kelly Wealth Management and spent over two decades as a sports agent at Eastern Athletic Services, Inc. Headquartered in Hunt Valley, Maryland, the firm provides financial planning, investment management, and family office services to high-net-worth individuals, families, business owners, and institutions. Verdence is a nationally-recognized firm and has grown to over $4 billion in assets under management.

The firm emphasizes providing unbiased, transparent advice and leverages an open platform to access a wide range of investment opportunities for its clients, who are primarily located in the United States.

poc.description: Sir Tom Hunter is a Scottish businessman, entrepreneur, and philanthropist who founded West Coast Capital, the private equity arm of the Hunter family, in March 2001. His firm primarily invests in founder-led, profitable private businesses across sectors like e-commerce, property, and data analytics. Hunter's entrepreneurial career began with selling trainers from the back of a van, a venture he grew into Europe's largest independent sports retailer, Sports Division, which he sold in 1998 for £290 million. A graduate of the University of Strathclyde, he was knighted in 2005 for his services to entrepreneurship and philanthropy.
fund.title: West Coast Capital Ltd
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; venture-capital; ecommerce; retail; technology; transportation; consumer
fund.description: West Coast Capital, founded in 2001, is the private equity arm of the Hunter family, established by Scottish entrepreneur and philanthropist Sir Tom Hunter. The firm serves as the investment vehicle for the family and focuses on investing in founder-led, profitable private businesses. Profits generated from its investments are primarily channeled to philanthropic causes through The Hunter Foundation.
fund.thesis: West Coast Capital is sector-agnostic with a global reach and an ultra-long-term investment perspective, using its own capital for investments. The firm prefers to invest in B2C, retail, transportation, and e-commerce sectors through buyouts, debt, and growth capital. They look to take significant equity positions to accelerate growth in founder-led, profitable private businesses.

fund.title: Toledo Capital AG
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; hedge-funds; fixed-income; public-markets; crypto-blockchain; financial-services; healthtech
fund.description: Toledo Capital AG is a FINMA-regulated multi-family office located in Zurich, Switzerland, established in 2011 by founder Uri Krausz. The firm provides tailored and sophisticated financial solutions for high-net-worth individuals and families globally. As a member of the Aquila Group of Independent Asset Managers, Toledo Capital AG focuses on delivering transparent and multigenerational wealth preservation strategies without conflicts of interest.
fund.thesis: Toledo Capital employs a core-satellite investment approach to construct client portfolios, aiming to reduce costs and volatility while maximizing risk-adjusted returns. The core of their portfolios consists of bonds, equity, hedge funds, and alternative investments with a buy-and-hold strategy, while satellite investments in long-only equities and bonds are held for shorter periods to capitalize on market opportunities. The firm serves a global clientele and focuses on providing customized financial solutions with a strong emphasis on wealth preservation.

Their approach is built on a foundation of trust and transparency, aiming to serve as a permanent, multi-generational partner for their clients. The firm is active across private equity, private debt, real estate, and infrastructure, with a geographic focus on North America.

fund.title: Alpha Wealth Strategies
fund.sectors: financial-services; public-markets
fund.description: Alpha Wealth Strategies is a boutique, fee-only SEC registered investment advisory firm founded in 2005 by Clark M. Blackman II. The firm provides investment advice and financial guidance to a select number of high-net-worth families, requiring a minimum asset level of $5 million. The founder has received notable recognition, including being named one of the 100 most exclusive wealth advisors by The Robb Report and receiving multiple awards from the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA).
fund.thesis: The firm's investment strategy is based on a long-term approach rooted in modern portfolio theory, avoiding market timing and tactical allocation. They focus on strategic asset allocation and a manager selection process, primarily utilizing mutual funds that align with client objectives, and do not recommend alternative investments like hedge funds or private equity. The firm's services are geared towards experienced investors who value a prudent, time-tested process to preserve accumulated wealth and achieve optimal risk-adjusted returns.

fund.title: Naga Capital Partners
fund.sectors: financial-services; venture-capital; private-equity
fund.description: Naga Capital Partners is a Singapore-based multi-family office and boutique investment advisory firm that serves high-net-worth individuals and families globally. Founded in Hong Kong in 2012 by Wee Yang Yeo as a capital structure arbitrage fund, the firm relocated to Singapore in 2018 to refocus as an external asset manager and multi-family office. A notable early achievement for the firm was being seeded by a Singaporean billionaire, which led to its assets under management doubling within the first year of operation.
fund.thesis: The firm's strategy is to provide tailored asset management and independent advice to protect and grow the wealth of its clients. Naga Capital provides clients with access to exclusive private investment opportunities, including venture capital and private equity deals, which undergo a rigorous due diligence process by its investment team. While based in Singapore, the firm serves a global client base, including individuals and families in Southeast Asia, North Asia, and the Middle East.

Fxhb aims to be a one-stop solution for ultra-high-net-worth families, offering tailored wealth management strategies.

fund.title: ALTAVISTA FAMILY OFFICE
fund.sectors: private-equity; real-estate; public-markets; fixed-income; hedge-funds; infrastructure; technology; financial-services; healthcare; consumer; manufacturing
fund.description: AURETAS Family Office, formerly known as Spudy & Co. Family Office, is a multi-family office headquartered in Hamburg, Germany. Founded in 2005 through the merger of Spudy & Co. and Döttinger/Straubinger, the firm provides asset management, investment advisory, and asset controlling services to wealthy families, foundations, and corporations. AURETAS is one of the leading family offices in Germany, serving over 400 client families and employing around 50 staff members.
fund.thesis: AURETAS structures its investment strategy around three core functions: "Absicherung" (protection), "Ernte" (harvest), and "Chance" (opportunity). This framework, called the AURETAS "Anlagekompass" (Investment Compass), moves beyond traditional asset class views to align portfolios with clients' specific goals for security, income generation, and growth. The firm invests globally across all asset classes, including private markets, which it accesses through innovative and liquid listed investments.

fund.title: Wrise
fund.sectors: financial-services; fintech; software; saas
fund.description: Wrise Group is a Singapore-headquartered wealth management firm founded in 2022, targeting ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) and high-net-worth individuals and their family offices. The firm has expanded rapidly, establishing a strong presence in key financial hubs including Hong Kong, Dubai, Shenzhen, and Tokyo. Wrise utilizes a proprietary fintech platform called TREX to provide clients with real-time visibility and control over their assets held across multiple financial institutions.
fund.thesis: Wrise's strategy is to simplify wealth management for affluent clients by using technology to consolidate and manage assets across numerous banks and financial partners. The firm focuses on providing bespoke strategies and a comprehensive ecosystem of services, including wealth planning, asset management, and corporate advisory, leveraging a network of over 150 financial partners like Goldman Sachs and UBS. Through its WRISE Prestige subsidiary, it also aims to serve affluent clients with a lower investment threshold, democratizing access to private banking services.
fund.geographies: Singapore; Hong Kong; Dubai; Shenzhen; Tokyo; Asia; Middle East

fund.description: Two Bridge Capital is a family office founded by lifelong healthcare professionals who previously built a healthcare organization with over 15,000 employees and $1.5 billion in annual revenue. fund.thesis: Following a 2022 strategic shift, Two Bridge's primary mission is to address the mental health crisis through community, storytelling, and music, rather than through traditional equity investing. Their current focus is on creating events and content to foster connection and build a movement around mental wellness. Historically, the firm's investment thesis focused on investing in strong leaders across various sectors including healthcare, technology, and real estate.

The firm's sector focus includes manufacturing, industrial, transportation, distribution, and business services. Geographically, their investment activities are concentrated in North America.

poc.description: Barbara J. Hoeft is the founder of Willow Street Group, LLC, and Willow Street Trust Company of Wyoming, LLC, which she established in 2005. With 30 years of experience in the family office and trust and estate industry, she now serves as an Independent Director on the Board of Managers and acts as a consultant for the Client Services team. Her career began in the 1990s, and she holds a BA from the University of Virginia, a Diplôme from L'Université de Paris–Sorbonne, and the Trust & Estate Practitioner (TEP) designation.
fund.title: Willow Street Group
fund.sectors: financial-services
fund.description: Willow Street Group is a Jackson, Wyoming-based trust and fiduciary services provider for ultra-high-net-worth families globally. Founded in 2005 by Barbara Hoeft, the firm specializes in providing corporate trustee services and administering custom Wyoming trust structures. In December 2022, Willow Street combined with Pathstone, a multi-family office, operating as an independent sister company to serve the complex needs of multigenerational families. The firm is frequently recognized for its excellence, having been named "Best Fiduciary or Trust Services Provider" by the Family Wealth Report Awards multiple times, including in 2022, 2023, and 2025.
fund.thesis: Willow Street's strategy is centered on acting as a pure fiduciary to support the enduring legacy of families across generations. The firm collaborates with a family's existing network of advisors to provide specialized expertise in Wyoming trust administration, governance, and operations, leveraging the state's favorable trust and tax laws. Their approach is relationship-focused, proactive, and transparent, offering flexible and creative solutions tailored to each family's unique needs rather than making direct investments.

poc.description: Ban Esheng is an Assistant Vice President at Tecity Group, a multi-family office. Due to the limited public information available, further details regarding their professional responsibilities, career history, and educational background could not be verified.
fund.title: Tecity Group
fund.sectors: real-estate; hospitality; financial-services
fund.description: Tecity Group is a Singapore-based single-family office founded by the late banker and philanthropist Tan Sri (Dr) Tan Chin Tuan. The group is structured with three main arms: the Tecity Family Office for investments, the publicly-listed conglomerate The Straits Trading Company Limited, and the philanthropic Tan Chin Tuan Foundation. Recognized as one of Asia's most structured single-family offices, Tecity Group was the winner of the EY-Bank of Singapore Family Enterprise Award of Excellence in 2024.
fund.thesis: Tecity Group's investment philosophy aims to achieve the highest risk-adjusted return in a safe and prudent manner, adhering to the principles of its founder. The firm's strategy employs a long-term view, in-depth research, high conviction, and quiet engagement with its investee companies to create positive outcomes for all stakeholders. Its primary focus, executed largely through its public arm, is on real estate, hospitality, and resources across the Asia-Pacific region.

fund.title: Prime Asia Asset Management Pte. Ltd.
fund.sectors: private-equity; private-debt; real-estate; financial-services
fund.description: Prime Asia Asset Management is an independent multi-family office based in Singapore, founded in 2016 by former bankers. The firm provides comprehensive wealth management solutions, including investment advisory, tax planning, and family governance, to over 150 ultra-high-net-worth clients across Asia. The company holds a Capital Market Services (CMS) license from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS).
fund.thesis: Prime Asia Asset Management focuses on a broad spectrum of investments, including private equity, venture capital, and growth equity, with a particular emphasis on Southeast Asia. The firm seeks out regional expertise and values managers with a deep understanding of the diverse Asian markets beyond China. Their investment strategy also includes direct co-investments and a significant allocation to alternative assets.

fund.title: Circulate Capital
fund.sectors: impact-investing; sustainable-finance; esg; cleantech; venture-capital; private-equity; private-debt; biotech; ai-ml; manufacturing
fund.description: Circulate Capital is an investment management firm established in 2018, dedicated to advancing the circular economy and combating plastic pollution. The firm focuses on investing in companies and infrastructure that prevent the leakage of plastic waste into the environment, particularly in high-growth markets. A notable achievement is becoming the largest impact investment firm dedicated to fighting plastic pollution and advancing the circular economy in South and Southeast Asia.
fund.thesis: Circulate Capital's investment thesis is centered on the belief that investing in waste management, recycling systems, and the circular economy in high-growth markets can prevent plastic pollution while delivering financial, environmental, and social returns. The firm seeks to finance innovations, companies, and infrastructure that scale solutions to the plastic waste and climate change crises, targeting scalable solutions and untapped opportunities. Their geographic focus is on South and Southeast Asia, and they have recently expanded into Latin America and the Caribbean.

fund.title: One Hill Capital
fund.sectors: biotech; consumer; private-equity; public-markets; retail; venture-capital
fund.description: One Hill Capital is a single-family office headquartered in Singapore, founded in 2016. The firm was established to manage the family's assets, which include direct investments, private equity, venture capital, and liquid securities. One Hill Capital's mission is to preserve the family's legacy and enhance wealth while adhering to five pillars of value: independence, integrity, responsibility, humility, and charity.
fund.thesis: One Hill Capital's investment philosophy is centered on achieving consistent returns through disciplined processes and governance. They seek to create long-term value through symbiotic partnerships with their investee companies and portfolio managers. While their investment parameters are flexible, their approach mirrors that of an endowment model driven by a value and partnership framework, with a focus on Singapore-based startups in the consumer and retail sectors.

poc.description: Ryan Munoz serves as the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer of W5 Group, a real estate-focused family office. In his role, he is responsible for the firm's strategic direction, including investment strategy, sourcing, underwriting, and asset management of real estate investments. His oversight also extends to product strategy, investor relations, accounting, and operational efforts. Prior to joining W5 Group, he was a senior member of an institutional real estate private equity firm and began his career in the real estate divisions of Wells Fargo and Morgan Stanley. He holds a Bachelor of Science in management (finance) from MIT.
fund.title: W5 Group
fund.sectors: real-estate; venture-capital; growth-capital; technology; consumer; healthtech; software; fintech
fund.description: W5 Group, established in 2009, is the single-family office of real estate entrepreneur Ralph Winter. The firm invests in a wide range of asset classes, with a primary focus on innovative residential real estate in the United States and Europe. W5 Group also operates a growth equity and venture capital team that invests in companies from early-stage to growth equity, with a preference for the consumer-tech and prop-tech sectors.
fund.thesis: W5 Group's investment strategy focuses on long-term value creation in innovative residential real estate sectors, including multifamily, student housing, single-family rentals, co-living, and micro-apartments. For its venture capital investments, the firm is sector-agnostic but prefers technology-driven businesses. The firm targets equity, preferred equity, or mezzanine investments of $20 million or greater in its real estate ventures, focusing on major urban and high-growth markets in the United States and Europe.
